Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkHildreth
Reviews.Content: In keeping with the distincitive Kimpton hotel philosophy, The Monaco is an exceptionally welcomig place with a well-appointed living room and a pet friendly happy hour. Meeting the beagles and chatting with their owners makes everyone feel at home. The room was tastefully decorated, clean and warm. Tthe choice of bath products is excellent. One evening I took a friend to dinner in the hotel restaurant knowing that the food was likely to be excellent. I enjoyed a well-prepared roast chicken wish some unusually spices. Delicious. And the dessert was also wonderfu.

Reviews.Title: “What a fresh idea...”
Reviews.Author: Ted_Pidcock
Reviews.Content: Great staff and LOVED the bike loaner program. Had a meeting at 11 AM so knew I had time to kill. The hotel loans a bike (and helmet) at no charge. I rode for 2 hours that am. What a great idea. Also, you could play baseball in the room it was so big and it looked great. Nice spot.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome home”
Reviews.Author: Captcrazy
Reviews.Content: My husband came back from a year long deployment and we stayed at the Monaco for a night en route to San Antonio. The staff was professional and made us feel truly welcome. The location is within walking distance to the harbor and the room was clean and inviting. We have decided that the Monaco will be our hotel of choice from now on in each city we visit!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ana J
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my fiance's bday and the stay was wonderful. The staff was very professional, courteous and helpful. The hotel is wonderfully decorated and the lobby area is quite pleasant even romantic. The room and bathrooms were clean. The mini bar expensive but what mini bar isn't. We're from Baltimore, so the stay was just a night away from home and got this off priceline (name your own price) and was overly satisfied with our stay. Will defintiely stay again and again. I only gav 4 starts because of the parking...you must do valet or find a garage and walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Baltimore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfergeo
Reviews.Content: We had lived in Columbia, MD from 1975-2006 and spend a good amount of time in Baltimore until we retired to KY. We come back once a year to square dance and see old friends. Each time we come back, we stay some place different, this year it was Baltimore's time. We learned about this hotel from SniqueAway which got us a nice bargain for a couple of nights in Baltimore. Very nice hotel. Nice clean room, very high ceilings. Two queen beds that were very comfortable. We stayed on the 11th floor. Breakfast was nice. We didn't want potatoes and our waiter offered to substitute fresh fruit. Very thoughtful. The only negative thing about our room was the connecting door to the next room. It was definitely not soundproof. During the afternoon we could hear every word that was spoken during a business phone call that was made. Later that evening at 11:00 two guys were apparently talking in normal conversation tones which wasn't really noticeable until we turned off our TV. This was the only reason I didn't rate this place Excellent. If the adjoining room had been unoccupied it would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: nemom3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Monaco Baltimore, and we had an incredible stay. We came to Baltimore for a surprise birthday trip for my husband, and the hotel upgraded our room to a King Deluxe and also welcomed us with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. The architecture of the old B&O Railroad headquarters is magnificent. The service throughout the stay was top notch, the staff was very responsive, the room was very large with high ceilings, and we had a soaking whirlpool tub, double sink and large shower in the bathroom. The location is within walking distance of the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. We are already talking about staying there for our next visit to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel! Lavish surroundings that are "fit for a king and queen!!"”
Reviews.Author: Pololady1056
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the afternoon and enjoyed a nap before meeting friends for dinner. The pictures do not do the Hotel justice! It is magnificent!! A must stay!! The restaurant is a pleasant addition!! Definitely a must stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Special place”
Reviews.Author: davecm329
Reviews.Content: The location, ambiance, and outstanding staff make the Monaco in Baltimore a SPECIAL PLACE indeed. The classic architecture is simply breathtaking. This hotel is a short walk to all the attractions of the city. Its easy to get to and from on the interstate. I encourage any visitor to Baltimore to make their visit special with a stay the Monaco. Dave M

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: rebecca_philly
Reviews.Content: i love kimpton hotels, and the hotel monaco is no exception. a gorgeous space with comfortable rooms and incredibly helpful staff. great amenities, especially the wine reception. very convenient location - quick, safe walk to camden yards and the inner harbor. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “1920's elegance + every modern convenience!”
Reviews.Author: TheMontaneVole
Reviews.Content: The Monaco Baltimore Hotel is a lavishly restored / preserved building from the 1920's with a stunningly beautiful entryway (a white marble stairway, Tiffany glass, towering ceilings, lavish red carpet)--an opulence amid which we could easily imagine Scott and Zelda Fitzgerald feeling right at home! Yet our (very large) room had been wonderfully updated with a state-of-the-art television, very fast Wifi, a truly elegant marble bathroom, and luxurious bedding. The staff was unfailingly friendly, helpful, and attentive, and the convenient location in Baltimore's Harbor area couldn't be better! Just down the street are all the attractions of the Harbor area and many chain stores and restaurants. Three blocks in the opposite direction, there are many independent ethnic restaurants and boutiques. In the historic preservation of hotel properties, there is always a delicate balance between preservation and the needs of today's guests. More than any other such property I have ever stayed in, the Monaco Baltimore gets it EXACTLY right! HIGHLY recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ebuchheim
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived to the time we left, it was perfect! We wanted a place not to far from home where our dog would be welcome. This is the place if you are a pet owner! Our dog needed a week to recover after living like a king! Flawless service great gym, restaurant, close to everything. We parked our car and didn't move it until we left. The entire staff went out of their way to exceed our expectations! It was like being at the islands 2 hours drive from home!! We will always stay at Kimpton from this day forward because Mason our dog was as much a guest as we were! Ed, Kim, and Mason

Reviews.Title: “Historical charm”
Reviews.Author: dmlover76
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly & welcoming staff. Conveniently located in the heart of Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: jmbdt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days in March after getting an amazing deal with AAA. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The hotel is an historic building that does share some common space with offices and a bank. The marble staircase, stained glass, and even the old brass mail chutes on the floors are wonderful if you like to feel a part of history. We had a king suite which was beautiful with high ceilings a great bathroom. The inner harbor was a short, 4 or 5 block walk and the convention center was about a block and a half. If you are looking for something a little different and don't mind the short walk to the harbor attractions, I'd definitely recommend the Kimpton. Also be sure to sign up for the Kimpton rewards program which is free and gets you free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bob P
Reviews.Content: The staff made you feel welcome and the restaurant was great. Thsi hotel is the former B&O Building. When CSX Transportation was there I has the facilities mananger for them and the room I stayed in was exactly where my Baltimore Office was located, so the trip really had special meaning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Combo of the Classic and the Quirky”
Reviews.Author: AmanDaAman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 2012 after getting a great deal for the double room on Jetsetter.com (about $155/night before taxes). The hotel is housed in an amazing historic building which used to house the B&O Railroad company, and the entry area feels very grand. Room decor is lovely in a more modern way. I always enjoy Kimpton hotels for their unique quirks which make the stay a real experience: animal print bathrobes, free wine hour, pet-friendly policies, the ability to 'borrow' a pet goldfish during your stay, interesting minibar items, etc. The only negative I would list is that the front desk/lobby area was constantly mobbed with groups of loud, raucous groups, as was my 7th floor hallway upon returning to our room that night. This experience took away from the tasteful nature of the rest of the hotel. Lines at check-in and check-out were fairly long but moved quickly. I was there on a Saturday and Sunday, which probably contributed to the crowding. Overall I'd highly suggest this hotel. It is a real experience.

Reviews.Title: “All hat and no cattle”
Reviews.Author: happycamperNewYork
Reviews.Content: Another shining example of America's race to the bottom. I think that this hotel is seriously mismanaged. Yes, the architecture is lovely but the cold, unwelcoming lobby and lack of signage are missteps. When you finally check-in to your garishly decorated room, you will be overcome by the cloying smell of cheap air-freshener that is inescapable because the windows don't open. The interior designer should be indicted for crimes against humanity. The lighting is terrible, repeat, terrible. Hallways were filthy, hair in the bathtub was a real turn-off and no breakfast before 7 AM is inexcusable. On a positive note, the staff were cheerful and willing to help but seemed afraid or unmotivated to think outside of the box.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy with excellent service in a stunning environment!”
Reviews.Author: Joan M
Reviews.Content: Used a Snique Away deal for this hotel. Great discount for a really classy hotel. Beautiful environment for Deco enthusiasts. Excellent service including quick room service for breakfast. Be sure to join Kimpton for free wireless and $10 towards the interesting mini-bar. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: cliffcheek
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is ideally located downtown, just a 3 blocks walk to the harbor. My wife and I stayed one night in the Mediterrain suite to celebrate her birthday. The front desk stay was very nice and sent up a bottle of champagne and a piece of cake. Room was tastefully decorated and had a huge soaking tub that could fit four people. The wine hour was really nice, red & white wine with apple fritters.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly - People Friendly”
Reviews.Author: luckylady39
Reviews.Content: Went this past weekend for 2 nights and would of loved to stay longer. The Hotel is beautiful, the rooms are large and clean. We ate dinner there the first night it was great. But we were overwhelmed how nice the entire staff was at this hotel. It was the first trip with our dog who behaved so well (Thank God) and everyone was so sweet to her. We come to Baltimore often but have not stayed here, this is our new place - love it!

Reviews.Title: “"First time trying a pet friendly hotel"”
Reviews.Author: carlyn y
Reviews.Content: We've been to Inner Harbor several times, but now the kids are in college. "Snique Away" advertised a great rate for this "Pet Friendly Hotel"; it was only a 2 hour car trip, so my husband and I decided to try taking our 2 year old mixed breed Panda. The hotel was BEAUTIFUL, the staff just wonderful - couldn't do enough for us; very, very clean, nice amenities. My issues were a result of this being our first time trying to take a dog; realizing that since it was March, none of the outside eateries were open, so - while walking around Inner Harbor was very nice, there was no where we could all stop for a bite to eat. Pet sitting was advertised; but (the outside Pet Sitting Service) was only available Tues - Sat; we were there Sun & Monday. If I had realized this earlier, I'm sure I could have worked something out; - again; next time I'll know to set these things up myself ahead of time. Overall, we really enjoyed our little adventure; I would go back to the Monaco again in an instant - pet or no pet!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marc N
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and incredibly friendly and helpful staff. From Ali at the car check-in to Big Dave, to the Managers and especially Christina, who helped with last second room requests, everyone was simply outstadning. Room was sopacious weklll-maintained and lovely. Overall an exemplary expreicne.

Reviews.Title: “Crabcakes calling my name”
Reviews.Author: LuciR
Reviews.Content: We planned a quick 2-day family trip to Baltimore to visit a couple of schools and, of course, to answer the call of crabcakes. Not wanting to plan very far ahead I checked Trip Advisor for some advice and selected Hotel Monaco, Baltimore. We were not disappointed! On the hotel's website we chose the Suite Upgrade and booked a king suite for not much more than a queen double. We also followed another reviewer's advice and ate breakfast sandwiches at David and Dad's across the street from the hotel. At check in the staff member was very apologetic as the only suite available was on the pet floor. Being dog lovers it wasn't a problem for us. We actually only heard one dog barking as we were leaving the floor in the morning to check out of the hotel. We also received a voucher for $10 of minibar service. The wine reception was a nice touch for early evening apperitifs. The lounge area on the lobby floor is well appointed, as is the rest of the hotel. Kimpton Hotels where we have stayed do amazing jobs of retrofitting older buildings with great craftsmanship and character. We were pleased to see this was no exception. The amenities were great!. The room was spacious and a working set of pocket doors separated the bedroom area from the sitting area. There was a gigantic tub large enough and deep enough for two people to sit down on the built in banques and enjoy a whirlpool bath, which our son did. The rest of the bathroom was also nicely appointed. The plumbing, however, needs a check-up. This sink was very slow to drain and the toilet, in a separate water closet, had a tendency to splash up and out of the bowl. The HVAC system was apparently not able to cool down the room. It was unseasonably warm during our stay and we prefer a cool room for sleeping. We will be letting the staff know and I am certain the issues will be addressed as they were very attentive during our brief stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy -Bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: tlcjunk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business conference. The lobby has a gorgeous marble staircase and beautiful ceilings. The building is beautiful and the common areas are warm and comfy. The rooms are well decorated and the bed is comfy. The ceilings are high, the bathroom is granite and the robes are a nice amenity. I joined the Kimptom rewards club and received a $10 mini bar credit voucher which was nice. The fitness center is spacious and has a nice variety, but the TVs on the treadmills do not have headphone jacks and the first one I tried did not work. My room on the 10th floor is above Charles street and the traffic and sirens were pretty loud. I always bring ear plugs, so was able to sleep. The shades are stylish but let the light in.

Reviews.Title: “Get Away”
Reviews.Author: kasey m
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Hotel Monaco this past weekend for a getaway from our everyday life. We had the Charm Package so valet parking was including and our room came with a bottle of wine. We got there right after wine hour had ended but they still gave us a glass of wine while we were checking in. We recieved a $10 mini raid bar credit (which was nice since a bottle of sprite was $4). The room was beautiful but the bathroom was the best part of the room. We had a jacuzzi that fit the two of us with extra room in it. The bad part I would say was the restuarant on the 1st floor. We tried to get a table but the hostess was extremely rude and kept walking away from us. We finally got seated upstairs and the meal was delicious. Even thought the menu did not have a whole lot of choices. I actually wanted to order room service but did not see the menu to the next morning. The food on the room service menu was WAY differnt from the food offered in the restaurant down stairs. I would say that overall though we had a great time and would stay there again. Last minute thought: we were on the 12th floor and had a great view of the city

Reviews.Title: “Would have been five stars except for the food”
Reviews.Author: LCL-JC
Reviews.Content: I picked it because it was close to Johns Hopkins. The staff from curb to room were top notch. I had a lovely and CLEAN room, very quiet. I did not meet one rude person on staff during a four day stay. They were anxious to help me and meet any special needs I had. It's a beautiful hotel, formerly the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad headquarters. I saw Tiffany windows and the most beautiful hand plastered ceilings from the turn of the last century in the lobby. It is the middle of the bustling downtown area, very vibrant and I actually felt safe in the hotel and on the streets outside. (I'm from a small down and don't always feel safe in large downtown areas.) This was an incredibly nice place to stay. I will definitely stay there again. Room service on the other hand....NOT SO GOOD! Twice they did not bring us what we ordered, but the hotel made a generous adjustment to the charges. The restaurant has great friend staff, but it's gourmet weird. Best breakfast we had was across the street at David & Dad's Cafe across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service & upgrades!”
Reviews.Author: Sara G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Baltimore for the weekend in February 2012 to celebrate our birthdays (we booked the aquarium package). When my husband called to ask about early check-in/late check-out, the very helpful concierge (Lee) asked him if we were celebrating anything. After informing him of our plan to celebrate our birthdays, he said that he would see if he could upgrade our room and leave some "treats" for us and that we could check in early. When we arrived, the front desk was very friendly and helped us with maps, etc. When we got up to our room, we realized that Lee had upgraded us, for free, to a gorgeous corner suite with a full-soak jacuzzi tub. When we arrived at the aquarium, we realized that the hotel had not placed our ticket stubs into our welcome envelope. After we called the front desk, they had out tickets delivered down to us within 10 minutes--and later found out that they reduced our bill by $40 at check-out for the inconvenience. We had a fun time at the nightly wine hour (5pm-6pm) and had an awesome meal and cocktails at the hotel restaurant, B&O Brasserie. The cocktails are some of the best we've had! Their mixologist is fantastic. When we returned to our room, we found a complimentary bottle of champagne with a happy birthday note from the hotel's VIP concierge. Also, the hotel provides a steep discount for overnight parking if you drive a hybrid (which we do). We had a luxury weekend experience for an affordable price - I would HIGHLY recommend Hotel Monaco!

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Does It Again”
Reviews.Author: Bic20
Reviews.Content: We always try to stay in Kimpton Hotels when we travel because they are always trying to do something a little different from other hotels and from other Kimpton Hotels. The Monaco Baltimore is located in a beautifully restored building that was the headquarters of the B&O Railroad. As such there is a subtle railroad theme going on. Our room was well decorated in a navy blue and gold color scheme which was very pleasing and it had very high ceilings with decent views over the city. The wine hour, which seems to be standard in all Kimpton Hotels was held in a beautiful "living room" just off the lobby. The service was friendly and helpful. My only complaint is that a dirty room service tray sat on the floor in our hall for several hours before it was picked up. We will definitely stay here again the next time we are in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Glassdesign44
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Monaco Hotel for a convention trade show with my family. Everything about this place was perfect for us...from the outstanding service of the hotel staff, front doormen who got to know us well, great restaurant recommendations. Free wine hour at 5pm, a goldfish for the room, microwave, refrigerator, free Wi-Fi for Kimpton members and an excellent selection of newspapers. The room was a chique boutique room, king sized bed that was comfortable to sleep in all week. No complaints here, definately would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monica G
Reviews.Content: Monaco Hotel is nice, the rooms are not very large, but functional. The location is in a historical building. Access to the harbour in 10 min. The breakfast service can be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: Cyndee1980
Reviews.Content: Beautiful History in the remodled B & O Railroad Headquarters Building. Just a short walk to the Inner Harbor. Very Nice Rooms. Because our room was not ready at checkin we were given coupons for the bar and full breakfast in the restaurant the next morning. Breakfast was very good. Would definately return to the Hotel Monaco and will look forward to visiting other Kimpton Properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, too bad the service is bad!”
Reviews.Author: JTGarcia2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at several other Kimpton properties and had amazing experiences. We decided to visit the Inner Harbor to celebrate Valentines Day and chose the Hotel Monaco based on our previous Kimpton stays. The building itself is beautiful, inside and out. I don't believe there are really any "great" views, as the area is surrounded by other tall buildings. The neighborhood leaves a little to be desired. Our room was immaculate and beautifully decorated. However, the AC was incredibly loud. We had to turn the TV up and down when it turned on and off. What set this property apart from others we have visited is the lack of attention to detail and service. If you want room service, be prepared to be underwhelmed. Breakfast is not available until 8am on the weekends (the room service menu states 7am, but we were informed by the in-room dining operator that this was incorrect and that we should have read the preorder menu on the door know. Not really our responsibility to proof the signage in the hotel), nor does the restaurant open before 8am on weekends. There is not an alternative near by either, unless you want fast food. The front desk staff on Saturday morning did not seem to think this was a problem, maybe because they were too concerned with setting up the conference room for a meeting, with breakfast type items. Saturday night we were tired and decided to order room service. The menu selections are few, which is shocking considering the quality and quantity available in the hotel restaurant. When our meal arrived we were somewhat surprised. I ordered a steak, but there was no steak knife and the silverware on the tray was dirty. My husband ordered a hamburger, but no condiments were provided. Additionally, there was not water, bread or butter on the tray. We had to call for the knife and condiments and wait while the food got cold. From stays at other Kimpton properties and other hotels we know this should not be the norm. Upon checkout we were asked about our stay. We told Simon at the front desk our concerns. He was the first employee we met at the hotel that seemed to care. He listened to us and removed the room service charge, assuring us he would make sure our experiences were relayed to management. We truly wanted to love this hotel and are sad to provide such a review, but this property was not up to Kimpton standards.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic building”
Reviews.Author: suzanne_baal
Reviews.Content: The hotel building was gorgeous and our room was really nice. We got a deal on the room through SniqueAway and really found it tobe good value. The 'happy hour' was only an hour (short!) and we didn't arrange our schedule around it so missed it both days, but enjoyed the morning coffee. My only constructive feedback is that the room service menu was a bit limited, given that there is a restaurant right downstairs - I could have had better choices, speedier service, and likely paid less if I had just gone down and ordered take out. Also, the valet parking was consistently slow. We called ahead and waited for the car every time, making it an inconvenience rather than a convenience. The only 'convenient' part about valet parking was not having to actually park the car... But the hotel was lovely, the room was great, and it was a good experience. We enjoyed our stay and would come back to this hotel if visiting Baltimore again, and would recommend the hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Max777g
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night while visiting the aquarium. From the begining until the end of our stay all the employees of the hotel where very nice and made us feel at home. All the request we had where met. If you check in early you can pick your room. We requested the highest floor and they put us on the highest floor. If you are on a budget don't pay for valet parking, there is a number of cheap public parking garages around the hotel. The hotel is a good ten minute walk to the habor, so if you are not able to walk 5 blocks, stay somewhere closer. The only negative for the restaurant but I will review that seperately

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful birthday”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: My husband, our golden retriever, and I spent my birthday at the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore. It was spectacular - the room was beautiful; the food was delicious, and the service was absolutely astounding. Every hotel employee, from the parking attendant to the waitress at the B&O, was thoughtful, accommodating, and extremely pleasant. Complimentary champagne was set up in the room as a birthday treat, in addition to the standard Kimpton happy hour. The hotel offered dog walks, although we declined given the beautiful weather and the proximity to the Harbor. I am consistently impressed by the quality of service at the Kimpton hotels, and this was no exception. It was a wonderful birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: NadineTheQueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night for a get-away weekend with my husband and another couple. The hotel is in a grand, historic building. The decor was funky and beautiful. The room was quiet. The king deluxe room was large. The bed was very comfortable. The place was very clean and well maintained. They had a nice wine reception at night. What more can you ask for? If I had a complaint it would be that Kimpton, for some reason, likes to use sliding "barn-style" doors for their bathroom. I don't get this. It isn't very private. Fortunately, the bathroom was in a little hall way in the room so it wasn't so bad in this case. I was very satisfied and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been great...”
Reviews.Author: toriluvr
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the Hotel Monaco for 14 days while recovering after donating my kidney at Johns Hopkins. The building itself is spectacular, and the rooms are more than adequate. I absolutely loved that they provided a pet goldfish for the duration of my stay as well. It really did help to make the room feel more like home. Unfortunately, the staff left something to be desired. On the day of our arrival, they said our room (with 2 queen beds) was not ready yet, but we could take a room with two double beds instead if we liked. We opted to wait for the Queen room, based on the notion that it would only be a "short time" until it was ready. FOUR hours later, they finally gave us a room key and sent us on our way. We went to the room, unpacked, immediately departed for dinner, and upon returning, went straight to bed - exhausted from a long and stressful day of travel. It wasn't until the next morning when I woke up that I realized the bed I was sleeping in was no queen, but a double. So we waited four hours just to get the room that was ready when we arrived instead of the room we paid for. Very disappointing. The room situation was corrected by the manager, but the new room had it's own trouble in the form of a non-functioning mini-fridge. I called the front desk about it, and they said that someone would be right up to repair. That someone did not arrive until 9pm. Normally I wouldn't call 9pm an unreasonably late hour, but when you're recovering from major surgery, iit seems like the middle of the night. Not when you want some unkempt maintenance man skulking around your bedroom. The final staff mistake - and the final straw for me - came the second day after surgery, which was my first day back from the hospital. My husband had flowers delivered (he was in Florida at the time) and they were meant to be in my room when I arrived back from Johns Hopkins. It was a suprise, so when they were not there I didn't think anything of it. Two or three days later, he finally brought it up on the phone since I hadn't mentioned it or said thank you. Needless to say, their absence generated an angry call to the front desk, and the flowers were eventually delivered - looking a bit worse-the-wear from having sat somewhere unattended for 3+ days before making their way to me. On a positive note, the hotel restaurant was wonderful and the bartender was a genius. Try is signature drinks - they're out of this world! In summary, the three-star rating was all due to the beauty of the facility and the restaurant. If I were reviewing the staff alone, it would be a one-star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Worse experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: dstormz02
Reviews.Content: Reasons: I paid $300 a night for this room and when I got here they said the room was still being cleaned! No where to park. No one told me which elevator to take or when the champage will be delivered. Seriously! DO NOT GO HERE! MY VALENTINE IS RUINED! UNACCEPTABLE!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great city.”
Reviews.Author: wunderous
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco Baltimore just for two short nights. The hotel is in a grand, old building which has been refurbished into a hotel on one side and an office building on the other side. The staff were all very accommodating, professional and friendly. The location was central and very quiet at night. Parking was wonderfully easy - choose the valet or the self serve which is literally around the corner. The only downsides to this hotel were in the rooms. As noted in other reviews, the room was extremely large and spacious which was lovely. The bathroom had a large walk-in shower but no tub and the towel bar/hooks were quite far away with no option to hang your towel/robe anywhere nearby. The bathroom did not have a fan option or a window. The hotel pumped a sweet smelling air freshener throughout which can cause problems if you are sensitive to perfumes and the windows, bright and large, do not open. Upon arrival, we found an uneaten vitamin (someone else's) on the carpet in the middle of the room. In general, the linens and the furniture were a bit worn and scratched and felt like it needed a bit of care. The location and the service may outweigh the downside depending on your priorities.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel .you need to come see your self”
Reviews.Author: Jonba2
Reviews.Content: I stay there for my birthday weekend . I had a bless on wine hour free wine and the guess service at the front door was very nice to me and my friends . The kinds man who worker there name was ali he was the valet supervise he makes sure we been taking care off and the front manager Marcus they make us very welcome ! I will always stay there or advise to any one who will take a trip in Baltimore

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Saint
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay in 3 years at the Monoaco. Location is perfect. Walking distance to the harbor and the Mariner stadium. Short cab ride to airport (20 min/no traffic) as well as other stadiums. We splurged on the Mediterranean suite which was only $179 (plus taxes) on Jetsetter! We originally booked via Kimpton's website and I called to get the Jetsetter rate...they were honest and said they couldn't so just cancel with them and book with Jetsetter! We love the suite as it has a Japanese soaking tub and the suites are generlly corner rooms. Staff is awesome and so helpful. Great recommendations for dinner and other suggestions. The wine reception in the lobby at 5:00 pm is such a nice touch....it was standing room only! My only "issue" is that the rooms look like they could use a little refreshing. Our bathroom was fabulous bu the living room furniture has seen better days. Bed was very compfortable and as always, the pet goldfish is a nice touch! Love the robes (again, those have seen better days!) and as a Kimpton In Touch member, we get $10 to "raid the honor bar"! How fun is that! Thank you Kimpton for another fabulous stay! Just suggested your hotel in San Diego to friends and they are loving it as well!

Reviews.Title: “Quick stop - wished I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: vacationmom103
Reviews.Content: First, let me say I am a FAN of the KIMPTON brand. Again, I was very pleased. For this trip, I was collecting my daughter from a cruise trip down at the pier on Sat morning and wanted a reliable hotel to place our heads after a long workweek. My college age son accompanied me and we convinced an aunt to also book a room at this property for the night. Just walking into this historic building is a treat in itself. Marble from floor to three stories up, WOW! I cannot tell you how beautiful it was, you have to see it in person. Any train buffs out there? This is your hotel! It is the former home of the B&O RR Headquarters; apparently, they did QUITE well back in the day... Our room was a double queen, smartly decorated and very clean (I am particular). It was also very quiet. The mini-bar was fun to puruse, for our stay they had a wine promotion - 2 tickets for wine at the bar in addtion to the wine hour in the lobby, we met for din at the hotel B&O Brasserie that night for convenience and the food was outstanding. For Kimpton Loyal rewards members, they had a special "raid the mini-bar" promotion too; we had $15 in complimentary mini-bar credit, fun! I truly did not want to leave the hotel at 7am in the morning, and plan to return when we can enjoy for a weekend getaway. If you are traveling by rail or bus, it is a very convenient location downtown. Not far up the hill is the lovely Mount Vernon neighborhood. Looking forward to exploring this stately area on our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, few issues but staff handled them exemplary”
Reviews.Author: eghost79
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for 3 nights at this hotel...last minute family emergency...and we were pleasantly surprised of the character that this hotel possesses...mixing old world charm with modern amenities...they are offering a wine tasting every evening...however we were not able to participate since we came back very late every night. We had some issues with our room door...2 nights in a row (a little bit annoying and uncalled for)...however both times the managers Nicole and Marcus handled the issues with exemplary professionalism. We will soon have to go down again and this would definitely be our first choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely!”
Reviews.Author: FTPCGE
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Christmas Eve. We had stayed here the previous year and were looking forward to another great experience. At check-in we were told that we had been upgraded to a suite. The room was so nice. The living room space was great for some last minute gift wrapping, but it was the tub that made it so fantastic. What a great way to relax. I love the pet goldfish in the room. Staff is superior and friendly. We will be back next Christmas. I would hily recommend this beautiful hotel. It is like stepping back in time with all the marble and stained glass.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Building with Incredible Renovations”
Reviews.Author: NorthamptonSyd
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Kimpton hotels for at least 15 years. The Monaco can not be beaten for value, space, and service. The building was in serious disrepair when Kimpton bought it and renovated it so very carefully. The lobby is spacious and hip. The desk staff is marvelous. The rooms are spectacular, with very high ceilings, marble, and tasteful furnishings. The location is central to the Inner Harbor, the Oriole's stadium, and most of what you want to do by foot in downtown Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JmcDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite at the Hotel Monaco while in Baltimore taking care of wedding details for our upcoming June event. The suite was luxurious but still sleek enough to not feel too nice to touch anything. We lounged in our animal robes, we soaked in the giant tub, and enjoyed a picnic and a movie in our living room. The location is great: we walked over to the harbor and spent the afternoon at the National Aquarium in Baltimore (also a great time). If it hadn't been so cold, we would've easily walked over to Fell's Point as well. The staff are fantastic too: very welcoming, helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful building, excellent restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: rosgo
Reviews.Content: In the old B&O Railroad headquarters building. High ceilings, marble staircases, etc. Very friendly staff. Took a suite with a great soaking tub. Was disappointed by the furnishings in the suite, management could have done better there. Sort of suited a hotel a little bit downgraded then the impression this gives. Staff referred to me by name during my stay and very polite. Don't miss the B&O restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: SDR1076
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights to catch the Ravens-Texans playoff game. Booked on Hotwire and got a great rate. Parking was very expensive. We drove two blocks up to a $6/night garage (weekend only) on 222 N Charles St and walked to the stadium in 15-20 min. Excellent location with good food within walking distance. Front desk staff was very helpful in recommending nearby restaraunts. Overall good stay. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience at Hotel Monaco Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: william p
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this facility which only offers valet parking which they advertise as safe and secure. Unfortunately, when our car was returned, our sunglasses which were stored in the console were missing. There was no damage to the vehicle so the glasses were either taken by an attendant or removed from an unlocked vehicle while valet parked. I spoke with the hotel manager and he was not helpful. We are very disappointed in this facilities failure to care for our vehicle in a safe and secure fashion as they advertise. I would expect more from a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Little things do count”
Reviews.Author: I_am_reviewing_you
Reviews.Content: This is truly a historic building that is beautiful and yet modern! Overall I enjoyed my 2 night stay. One thing that needs to be addressed is the type and delivery of coffee. I love my coffee in the morning. Until I have my coffee I'm grumpy and frankly don't want to interact with strangers. So why on God's earth do you force people to go downstairs to get coffee. Furthermore, if you insist on community coffee drinking, for god's sake make sure that the canisters are filled at all times. I had to wait 10 mins. for the front desk person to refill it. On the second morning, I thought I would beat Kimpton's crazy morning coffee ritual requested a coffee maker delivered to my room...ahhh convenience. Started sipping. Yikes the taste was awful. Management, if you can have high quality alcohol and high quality snacks conveniently located in my room, please have high quality coffee located in the room. Other things: Parking seemed overpriced. Doormen seemed to be laking.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: GLevator
Reviews.Content: The place is beautiful. The room is tastful, but unusually colorful. The staff was as sweet as can be. The tub was deep enough to sit in and still be submerged. And the have a real bar and restaurant - great small plates and wonderful entrees. Generous cocktails and a grat happy hour. Pet friendly too. They left treat that my dog just devoured. You just can't beat the place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place at regular (Baltimore) prices”
Reviews.Author: TetanusCreek
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night before the Baltimore Marathon. The Kimpton's prices were mid $250s, but less than the rest of the downtown hotels' "marathon rate" prices that are supposed to be special deals. So, cheaper, but better? A no brainer. If you've never been to a Kimpton hotel, fix that. They do things right at all their properties, from stuff as simple as power outlets and usb chargers right where you want them to the luxurious bathrooms and (if you are a rewards member) the opportunity to raid the mini bar for a snack and beverage free of charge. The rooms here are smaller than they'd be at a newer building (as say, the Epic in Miami) but that's the way old buildings were built. The rooms are comfortable, spacious enough for two, and have great climate control. The building is beautiful with an old-school marble lobby and brass fixtures all around. Make the walk up the old staircases, but beware, they're steep and narrow. The location is excellent, close to the waterfront, the good restaurants, the convention center, the marathon start and finish line (Raven's stadium and the new ballfield). But, being Baltimore, the location is also a short walk (the wrong way) from skankier neighborhoods. Keep your eyes peeled. B'more has a lot of street crime. Parking is tricky. Look for the big public lot below the theater just down the street from the Hotel. There won't be any parking in front of the hotel, nor even a lane to pull into while you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Reviews02
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of Kimpton hotels, and stayed at the Monaco Baltimore with my boyfriend and dog. This hotel is extremely pet friendly and expect to see anything from a lab to a chihuahua roaming the lobby. Not to be worried if you don't like pets or are allergic as pet owners are assigned to "pet floors." The grand staircase is a beautiful reminiscence of the old B&O headquarters. Do try the attached B&O restaurant. Great prices and food for brunch and dinner. Valet parking is a little pricey, but is as expected in any downtown area.If you're already, sign up to be a Kimpton In Touch member (it's free), and allows you free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Did the trick”
Reviews.Author: Demanding T
Reviews.Content: Stayed for ne night as wanted to explore the city. Hotel is 5 mins walk to water front and had lovel old charm entrance as is in old office buildings of old railway company. Amazing cocktails in the bar and food looked good too. Had king premier room which wad spacious and had jaquizze. Sparing sem dodgy car service that pounced on us a w elf hotel and charged twice taxis rate all good. Had excellent welcome when arrived at hotel which was nic touch. Check out the visionary art museum if u can.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dani61a
Reviews.Content: THe Hotel is beautiful, very luxurious and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Parking is a bit expensive but worth the convenience. I was not crazy about the city of Baltimore itself, so luckily the hotel made up for it and the restaurant A&O inside was fantastic too!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: BenA80
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Monaco, but let me be clear - it did have it's problems. My gf and I stayed at the hotel over the NYE weekend. We booked the Mediterranean Suite, and were impressed with the room we received. The decor was upscale and trendy. The bathroom/fiji tub was exactly what we wanted and the bedroom was comfortable. The decor helped exacerbate the relaxed mood we desired, and despite being on the 10th floor that allowed animals, it was nice and quiet. The building itself is gorgeous - beautiful architecture and our room was spacious with plenty of windows overlooking the city. The mini/organic bar was stocked with great options that we definitely took advantage of throughout our stay. Overall, the hotel offered a luxury environment for a competitive price. So there must be a catch ... right? The problems we experience started upon pulling up to the building. After handing over my keys for valet parking, I was surprised that the three employees outside talking didn't offer to hold the doors for us. In fact, this was a common occurrence throughout our stay. Its okay, I'm not lazy, but come on. Take pride in your work and make your customers feel welcome. The doors were opened for us once during our stay, but all the guy did was hit the handicap button and doors opened automatically. The next problem we encountered was after we actually checked in. A few weeks prior to our reservation, we requested an in-room coffee maker (they are not standard and must be requested). After reading reviews about people not having their special requests fulfilled, I reminded the gentleman who checked us in. He assured us that it would be in our room by the end of the day. Well, as of the day we checked out - we still didn't have a coffee maker. That's just unacceptable. If there was a shortage, just be honest. And if you forgot after multiple requests, well then you shouldn't have a job in customer service. We also had some issues with room service. We ordered in-room dinning twice and breakfast once. Both times we ordered dinner, the woman who took our order made comments regarding the amount of food that we ordered, which I felt was rather unprofessional and a bit insulting. We ordered a salad, two appetizers, and two club sandwiches. She was shocked that we were ordering so much food. How is that relevant? Do your job and take our order. Don't question our eating habits. How about you focus more on making sure everything is brought up to our room - since that was also an issue during our stay. Also, quite a few items on the in-room dinning menu were not available but listed on the menu. The last issue that was disappointing was an issue we experienced with the television in our bedroom. On our last night, was had all intentions to order a movie and relax in bed. Upon laying down and getting comfortable, we realized the on-demand service did not work in our bedroom. It was so late that we didn't want to watch it in the living room area, and it was also too late to complain. Oh well ... Again, we did enjoy the room. But after spending almost $1000 for 2 nights (which included mini-bar costs, room service and valet parking) I just don't think the service matched the cost. I would definitely try Kimpton again, but I'm not so sure about returning to the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: L S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Monaco to celebrate our engagement. The hotel is absolutely beautiful on the inside! When walking up, people may think this is a bad area of Baltimore City, it is actually a decent area but if you walk one or two blocks in the wrong direction you can end up somewhere you don't want to be. When we showed up the woman at the front desk knew of the special occasion and congratulated us. She checked us in very quickly and gave us maps of the area and recommendations for dinner. When we got the room we realized they had given us an upgrade, front King suite to the Mediterranean suite, along with a complimentary bottle of wine. They called us after 10 minutes of our arrival and asked how we liked the accommodations and they wondered if they could help us get reservations. We decided to make reservations at the restaurant attached, The B&O Brassiere. We walked into the restaurant and were congratulated on our engagement, news spreads fast around this hotel. The food at B&O was decent. Nothing to be overly excited about. However, they do have AMAZING Maple Creme Brulee. The waitress at the restaurant was okay, not exceptional. The bathtub in this hotel room was massive, like a swimming pool (not really)!! The bathroom altogether was big and beautiful! The room was massive with a large king sized bed. It was very clean and came with a complimentary goldfish for our stay, I did feel bad that the fish was stuck in a tiny little bowl though. In the morning we ordered room service. The woman who took calls for room service was extremely professional and friendly. Our food was brought up to us within 20 minutes and we had everything we needed. The food was decent, nothing special but not terrible. One thing I would say is, bring your own sodas! A can of soda is $4 in the mini bar! Crazy! Overall, great hotel! I would stay again and would definitely recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Warmth in the heart of downtown Baltimore..”
Reviews.Author: Theos_leftluggage
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco Baltimore is a property with spacious rooms, nice travel themed decor and a cozy fireplace with 5 o'clock wine tasting, in the heart of downtown Baltimore. Last week was my second stay at this hotel. The bed was comfortable, and there was a nice easy chair and ottoman for reading when I could not get to sleep. Since I used to live in Baltimore, I did not need directions or restaurant recommendations, but it is easy to get anywhere from the hotel. There was a charge for valet parking, which we avoided by parking in the street around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Callaregie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while in Baltimore for work. I am a fan of the Kimpton brand, so I was pleased to learn that Kimpton had a hotel in Baltimore. The hotel is located in the old rail road building, so there is a lot of history, character and charm. The location was right downtown. Within walking distance to Lexington market, the theatre, the waterfront and many shops and restaurants. The rooms were clean and well appointed. Also, they were very modern. The breakfast was also good. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: djfunkywill
Reviews.Content: I was a little thrown off that the hotel front desk is on the second floor and you enter a lobby that is home to a couple of businesses. The check-in was friendly and efficient and a doorman assisted with our bags. The room the was beautiful and clean. The alarm clock with ipod connection was a nice touch. Our stay was on a Friday night which the Yankees were in town and the hotel was swamped. By 4:00 the lobby was very crowded. The complimentary cookies and milk were delicous but were in high demand. The supply was exhausted quickly but hotel staff continued to replinish. The wine hour was also pleasant. We were in town for a concert at First Mariner Arena which was only two blocks away. Inner harbor and Orioles Park are also very close. We didn't eat at the hotel but instead went to Ruth's Chris. Ruth's Chris would be a long walk but they will send a towncar to pick up diners from the Monaco. Everything about the Monaco was outstanding. I look forward to returning for my next trip to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “5-star everything.”
Reviews.Author: BrucieWayne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick 2-year wedding anniversary getaway. We bought the Aquarium package which includes free continental breakfast in their restaurant, 10% off lunch or dinner at the same restaurant, and 2 passes to the National Aquarium just a short walk away at the Inner Harbor. The building was beautiful inside and out with marble everywhere, including the huge marble stairs between the first floor and the lobby. We booked the King Deluxe room but was given a complimentary upgrade to their Mediterranean room which included a 2-person spa tub. Very romantic. All of the furniture looked clean and well-cared for. I loved the style and decor. A detail that I liked about the hotel and the room was that the ceilings were very high. They were at least 12-15 feet high, even the hallway ceiling was really high. This gave you a really open, spacious feel. We were on the highest floor (14) so I don't know if this is true with the other floors. Our room also included a goldfish which is fed and cared for by the staff. This is a pet-friendly hotel so we saw a few dogs there. My wife is allergic to dogs so they were able to accommodate us by putting us in a room on a floor that was pet-free (just let them know when you book your reservation). When we arrived to our room, there was a bottle of champagne on ice with two glasses and a lovely card from guest services congratulating us on our 2-year wedding anniversary. There is complimentary wine in the hotel living room every evening from 5-6 and coffee and tea in the morning. We didn't take advantage of the wine since we had dinner reservations at the connected B&O restaurant (see my separate review of it).

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Margareeta
Reviews.Content: I'm picky. The Monaco won me over. We stayed here for NYE 2011 and when we arrived the doorman was SO friendly and walked us up to the lobby and told us the history of the building which was very impressive. The bellman was extremely friendly ( you don't always find this in Baltimore). The room was gorgeous. We stayed in a king bed room. The only thing I would change would be the shower. It was only half covered with a glass door. It actually was a little cold...I need the steam from the shower to keep me toasty. The bed was SO comfortable. The views of downtown B-more was great. I LOVED THIS HOTEL!!!! We got dressed to go out to Pier 5 for a NYE party and the historic marble staircase I walked down was daunting ( I didn't want to bust my butt!) but absolutely beautiful. We asked the doorman for a cab and he had a sedan service waiting for us. $15 bucks anywhere in the city. The driver was great. But back to the room, I would've loved a coffee maker in the room. It just would've been convenient. I didn't partake in the complimentary wine social but it looked nice. No joke, I will absolutely take my next staycation here. The value for the price is unbelievable (and it was very clean). I LOVED THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: B3achLov3r
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Baltimore to catch a baseball game and also take in some sightseeing. Booked our hotel on-line while on route and were pleasantly surprised by this beautiful hotel built around a historical building! Our room was a nice size and the bed and bedding very cozy! Nice windows and a great view of the city. The bathroom was modern and nicely decorated. We really felt that we got great value for our dollar at this hotel. They offer guests a wine reception daily along with coffee and tea each morning. Free high speed internet service if you are a Kimpton member (you can sign up on the spot).The staff were efficient, friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel is fabulous! It is a five minute walk to the harbor front and a 10-15 minute walk to the Ball Park. Lots of things to do and a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Love Kimpton Hotels”
Reviews.Author: vacheezhed
Reviews.Content: Spent a special post-Christmas night at the Baltimore Monaco. This was the second Kimpton we visited in the past year. It was another great experience. All parts of the trip were wonderful, as expected - greeting by the doorman, front desk check-in experience, the room and amenities, wine reception, check-out and valet service. The room was larger than I had expected and the tub and shower added to the relaxing experience. Signing up for the Kimpton membership has its benefits, too. Plenty of things to do within walking distance. I'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Holiday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: suzyjacuzzi
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the hotel Monaco as a pre-holiday get away w/ my 2 twenty-something nieces and my sister. The hotel is a relatively quick $35 cab ride from BWI and just a few blocks from the inner harbor. Front desk staff were very welcoming and expedient upon our arrival. Our double queen room on the 12th floor was extremely spacious and perfect for the 4 of us. The beds were clean and comfortable and the bathroom was nice and spacious. However, the sliding door was a bit off ~ I would prefer a real door vs. the slider. We had a drink at the B&O Friday night which had a few customers at the bar and a few diners throughout the restaurant. Service was slow and they were not able to offer the wine presented on their bar menu. The hotel recommended Maisy's restaurant which is a bistro just a few blocks away. The restaurant and service was wonderful and we really enjoyed our home made crabcakes! We found it a bit odd that there seemed to be a lot of people lingering/sleeping in the lower part of the hotel lobby during the next day (Saturday) ~ It was not clear if these folks were just very tired hotel guests taking a break or non-hotel guests coming off the street and relaxing on the comfortable chairs/couches. We enjoyed walking around the inner harbor and took advantage of the good sales in the harbor shop mall. On Saturday night we went to Howl at the Moon dueling piano bar. This place is great and tons of fun! I highly recommend to anyone. The bar does not serve any food so you would want to eat prior if you planned on staying a while. Cover charge is $5 before 8:00pm and then increases to $10. The hotel completely missed the mark on our room service order. We called in for 4 sandwiches around 1:00am and waited close to an hour for extremely sub-par pulled pork sandwiches that were cold and somewhat tasteless. The gym is on the 3rd floor and is equipped with numerous cardio machines and free weights. The treadmills did not allow for headphones and the remotes some of the remotes were not in working order. The water taxi is a nice way to travel to Fells Point or other areas within the harbor. The fee is $10per person for an all day pass. Lots of the bars/pubs in Fells point have great bunch and drink specials on the weekends (ie, $10 for all you can drink bloody mary’s or mimosa). Overall a good trip but if I went to Baltimore again I would stay right on the harbor or in Fells Point ~ we did not always feel 100% safe walking back to the hotel in the late evening hours. . The hotel was very helpful with holding our luggage until departure and the bellhop was attentive in securing a town car for our ride back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building”
Reviews.Author: spaintravelerAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This historical building is the most beautiful hotel in downtown Baltimore. It's walking distance to the Waterfront and the acquarium. Complimentary happy hour in a gorgeous area of the hotel with a beautiful large fireplace. There is a large tv where kids or adults can play video games....it's not loud at all....because there are different sitting areas. Restaurant was very nice for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Really?”
Reviews.Author: Educkie2
Reviews.Content: I love my Kimpton Hotels especially Ink48 in NYC so i was really looking forward to staying at the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore for 5 days. I was sorely disappointed. The hotel lacks the warmth and welcoming environment of the other Kimptons I have visited. The building is beautiful but the staff needs an updated motivational training session or two! Perhaps it has something to do with not having to go through the lobby when coming or going from the hotel due to the design of the building. But the final straw came on my last morning. I was leaving early to catch a train and it was dark and raining. The doorman outside called me a town car instead of a cab. Two nights before i had the same experience and when i questioned the doorman, he assured me it was the same as a cab.I found that the driver did not know how to get to the convention center three blocks away and it cost me 2x as much as it should have! So when I balked he said it would be difficult to get another ride quickly. Reluctantly I took the town car which, yes, cost 2x the taxi cost. URRRGG! I am usually a pretty laid back kind of person but this was NOT the kind of experience I expect of Kimpton Hotels. Since the doormen are the employees you encounter most often at this hotel it would help if they were more service oriented. So sorry.....

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: healthEtreament
Reviews.Content: would go back again anytime. had a terrific experience with the famliy and saw all the sights in DC.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable historic property”
Reviews.Author: dinalew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights during a family wedding. The property is beautifully restored. The evening wine reception is comfortable and generous. The standard room is quite large and comfortable. We had a room service breakfast/brunch which was delivered quickly and was quite good. The staff was welcoming and friendly. Great location/base for walking around Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “All glitz, no substance”
Reviews.Author: facchino
Reviews.Content: It's a newer hotel and service is slow and disorganized. A half hour to get a bottle opener? Twenty minutes to check in with no other customers? The staff should spend the night at the Four Seasons to see how to run a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still great”
Reviews.Author: tonyshere
Reviews.Content: They always do it right. Good price, good location, good staff. wish they had these everywhere. It is hip yet not too young, something I like but without the 20 somethings. Beds were great

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RajivMehta
Reviews.Content: The Stay at the Hotel was extremely disappointing, The Building is Superb with Large rooms & bathrooms but the service was a big let down. No coffee or tea maker in the rooms (which is standard in a Hotel this level). & to top it all if you intend te leave early be prepared to go without tea, coffee or breakfast as the we were informed that the room service starts only from 08.00 am. The rooms are also not done every day as out of the three nights we stayed once it was not done and on another occasiion when we came back in the evening tired after the whole day out we found that the rooms were being done then i.e. about 18.30 pm in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “A gem near the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: JoeHouston52
Reviews.Content: This 1902 former headquarters of B&O Railroad was recently restored as a hotel. Service was great. Rooms including bathroom are VERY spacious and we thought "good value". Location is excellent. Only downer is that parking is $36/night. Hotel restaurant - yes read their restaurant - is rated as one of the best in Baltimore. We were not disappointed - gourmet dining that was not overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Best pet-priendly option in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Backbeat70
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay in a lovely room. The bathroom's soaking tub was a real nice touch. The hotel staff all seemed very friendly and helpful. The hotel's resteraunt, the B&O Brasserie has a spectacular cocktail menu which was fun to investigate. Pet's (in our case small dog), stay for no additional fee and the hotel is the best pet-friendly place we have stayed while travelling. Not a complaint, but one does have to be patient waiting on the elavators at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Chcfan99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Monaco in Baltimore for a weekend. The hotel is classy and immaculate. We brought our two dogs and they were greeted with enthusiasm and a treat bag. The room was very nice with comfortable beds and a nice city view. Join their frequent visitors club and you get free wi-fi and a $10 coupon to "raid the minibar" in addition to some other perks. The wine reception (complimentary) was very nice. They are quite generous with their pours. The location was great--just several blocks from the Inner Harbor. The restaurant was fabulous with great service there as well. We will definitely return here and look forward to trying other Kimpton properties!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & room”
Reviews.Author: jpelements
Reviews.Content: stayed several nights for business....good central location.....excellent service.....restaurant was reserved for private parties 2 nights....food from room service was the pits.....but again, hotel staff and room were great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jennifervirginia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our anniversary so we were very impressed to find in our room a hand written note congratulating us along with a bottle of wine. Their happy hour is very nice - the wine was good (and complementary) and the sitting room was very comfortable with a fire, board games, and Wii. The room itself was very comfortable and clean - with nice touches like Aveeno products. The location is good to several restaurants in Little Italy and the Inner Harbor. The one downside, which is easily avoidable, is the valet parking (there is no parking at the hotel). If you drive north two blocks past the hotel on the left, there is a self park (I think it's 222 North Charles Street). It's secure and $6 a day - a bargain compared to $36!

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore Monaco”
Reviews.Author: heavydcleveland
Reviews.Content: We chose the Monaco Baltimore because of it's proximity to walk to the Sade concert. The hotel's parking is ridiculously overpriced and we took the advice of someone from Tripadvisor and parked in the public parking lot around the corner from the hotel at $7 or $8 per day. We were really angry the 1st night, as we were told the hotel was overbooked, though we had a reservation. We followed the bellman out of the hotel and around to the Raddison (a.k.a. The Rattison) which was truly a dump. The next morning we immediately phoned to see if our room was available and someone came to get our luggage and cart it back around the corner, along the street. This was truly embarrassing. I knew it was not the bellman's fault but I was not tipping him a dime. This was the worst experience. We were offered a complimentary bottle of wine, but never received it. The room was very, very nice though. The high ceilings and the wrap around style. The room was # 1021 and sort of wrapped around the corner. It was very nice. The plush bedding and comfortable sofa were topped off by the tan granite bathroom. There was a huge hot tub in it and the shower closed with a clear glass door. Of course, I couldn't stand it and had to order the goldfish. The robes were kinda cute too. The safe didn't work but someone came to repair it immediately. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The "Nordstrom" of hotel customer service”
Reviews.Author: bobcatrock
Reviews.Content: All I can say is "WOW". The Kimpton chain of boutique hotels is usually a good notch above the pack when it comes to customer service, but these folks knocked my socks off. Stayed 2 nights on business with a local foundation that was supposed to be picking up my tab (though I'd stayed there on my own dime previously). There was some understandable confusion about my length of stay because of duplicate reservations made by both the foundation and earlier, by my travel agent. They sorted it out quickly and without my having to stand at the desk and wait while they did it, and they made sure I wouldn't have to change rooms. I was trying to check in absurdly early, and though they were completely booked, they made sure a comparable room was ready two hours early to make sure I had time to change for a dinner meeting - even contacted me by cellphone and met me with my checked suitcase as soon as I came back to the hotel. During my entire stay, I was greeted by friendly, good-natured, efficient bell captains, room service staff, and housekeeping staff. The concierge arranged for a cab to be waiting for my 0-dark-hundred morning trip to the airport, gave me a printed summary of the name of the cab driver, the description of the cab, what it would cost, and the time I could expect him to be waiting for me. I even got a courtesy call on my cellphone when the cab arrived to reassure me all was well. On check-out, they efficiently resolved confusion about charges the foundation was to pick up vs. those that belonged on my personal credit card again without making me wait while they fixed their own records - and this by an incredibly patient, totally service-oriented angel of a hotel desk clerk who had most likely been up all night and was dealing with me at 5 in the morning. A huge 'hat's off' to the Monaco!

Reviews.Title: “"woof" "woof" goooood”
Reviews.Author: Laurence31
Reviews.Content: How amazing it is to have a hotel chain that actually goes out of their way to accommodate guests with pets. How liberating it is to walk freely in a hotel and not feel gawking eyes and flaring attitudes. The hotel staff is friendly and always happy to assist no matter the request. The room decor is well done with vibrant and balanced colors. Room is clean, decent size and done in a contempary manner with nice size bathroom. The place is rather well maintained. No worn out carpets, no fraying curtains no shabby torn wallpaper. This hotel does it right and really fits the bill of what you expect at a "Boutique hotel" Whether you travel with your pet or not, the important thing is this hotel is a great spot to stay at. I know my dog had a good time. The dog bed and treats she got during her stay had me wondering when I may find myself at another Kimpton property again with my beloved pet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BunkAndBon
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel thanks to a special running. We were in Baltimore to go to the Watch The Throne Concert at the 1st Mariner Arena. The Hotel was perfect because of the location to the harbor and the arena. I was wearing some pretty high heels, but I was able to comfortably walk over to the arena. We stayed in the mediterranean suite overlooking the city. It was beautiful with great customer service. The Valet was great (but expensive at $36) and the bellman was extremely helpful even getting some ice for our champagne. The bathroom and tub was very nice. It comfortably seats two people. I would recommend staying at this hotel for a romantic evening in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Service, and More”
Reviews.Author: james59929
Reviews.Content: I have long been a fan of Kimpton Hotels and my stay at the Hotel Monaco Baltimore did nothing to change my allegiance and admiration. The Kimpton chain prides itself on value, quiet elegance, and service--and all are in good supply at the Monaco Baltimore. I had booked a Deluxe King, but was upgraded, at no extra charge, to the Mediterranean Suite, which was absolutely lovely. Indeed, everything about this newly renovated hotel is lovely, evincing as it does the elegance of the golden years of the B&O Railroad, the enterprise occupying this grand structure before the Kimpton Chain acquired it. The refurbishing was very nicely done in that hotel guests are offered all the modern amenities, but not at the expense of the marble staircases and other original architectural features. Ahh, but it's the service that truly stands out! From the attentive valet and concierge service to the reservation staff all are superbly trained to be both welcoming and competent: here is congenial professionalism at its finest. I found little perks everywhere. For example, when I went to the front desk to see if I could get my e- boarding passes printed, Nicole smiled, took my papers, and had the passes printed in about three minutes. I left smiling, too. Checkout was quick and easy as well. Further, the Hotel is in a safe location and only about a ten to fifteen minute walk from the Inner Harbor. Oh, yes, and give the B & O American Brasserie a try. The menu is upscale but reasonable and the servers are some of the best I've encountered. While I didn't have an opportunity to attend, I understand there are evening wine receptions in the Hotel "Living Room." In short, don't miss an opportunity to stay at the Monaco--the cityscape view from the high floor rooms is an additional perk.

Reviews.Title: “sweet suite”
Reviews.Author: TampaAki
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and conveniently located to many activities. Our suite was spacious and very clean. Our check in was over an hour behind schedule due to the room not being ready, but we were compensated for the inconvenience. The staff was friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went to celebrate our anniversary. I've never been to Baltimore but was excited to stay at Hotel Monaco especially after reading the wonderful reviews. Upon arrival we were pleasantly greeted by valet who helped us out with our baggage. We entered the hotel doors to see the wonderful architect of this historical hotel. So gorg! Upon check-in we were asked if they wanted to make us reservations for dinner. We hadn't even thought that far in advanced and they were kind enough to show us a menu to Kali's Court where they also provided a driver service because it was located in Fells Point. So after looking at the menu we agreed to have dinner there. We then proceeded to our room which was located on the 14th (top) floor. The decor was beautiful. My fiance loved the leather wallpapered walls in the bathroom. We got the King suite that had a jacuzzi which had two seats in the tub. It was really large. I will say that after using the jacuzzi I probably won't get a room with that again. It wasn't that it was bad, but the jets weren't strong at all. We usually stay at hotels with the tub option and really enjoy the harder jets for our backs. This tub didn't have any pressure to the jets and was rather disappointed. Other than that the room was fabulous with amazing views of the city. We didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurant connected to the hotel. We were running around most of the day so we also missed out on the wine happy hour as well as the warm cookies. Hopefully we will be back to experience all that and more. I definitely would love to come back and may even bring my little dog. FYI, having dinner at Kali's Court the restaurant sends over a long white stretched limo to pick you up and bring you back if you have dinner with them. I was loving it! It was a nice surprise when we walked outside looking for our driver to see a limo was actually waiting for us. It felt very glamorous riding in that. Dinner wasn't overpriced but it was a pricey place. We loved all that we ate and would also love to come back to dine there again. Thanks Monaco for a wonderful weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Teens loved it on college visit.”
Reviews.Author: 75205Traveler
Reviews.Content: Historical building, awesome funky decor, warm cookies at reception. Hubby and I had a romantic drink in swank 2nd floor lobby, then we all walked to a great bistro in the quiet of the evening downtown. We are well-seasoned travelers who usually go for old-world traditional hotels, but this got a "wow" from all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty - but missed the mark”
Reviews.Author: cr8it
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property on a recent trip to Baltimore. It was a very interesting building. Historical, originally the headquarters of the B&O Railroad. The room we had was nicely appointed, but a bit awkward with only one chair which made eating our room service breakfast a bit of a challenge. We had a giant spa type tub in our bathroom, but it was so high, you would need to be seven feet tall to get in it (and then I would worry that you could not get out). The service was sketchy. We had great service on check-in, and the bell staff was great. However, there were a variety of missteps. For example, we had an early flight and left a wake-up call for 4AM. Fortunately we set an alarm, as the call never came. When we got up to take our shower, we found that the housekeeping staff had left no towels in the room. I called the front desk, and they promplty sent some up, but I mentioned to the woman that we did not get our wake up call, and she became somewhat indignant, statin"I called you." Well both my wife and I were in the room, and neither of us heard or answered a phone. The rest was little stuff, like the water not being replaced in the mini-bar, etc. The room was clean, and it was a nice hotel, but it just missed on enough little things to put the entire experience in the average category.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & Beautiful for a wedding!”
Reviews.Author: SRStein
Reviews.Content: I recently went to a wedding at Hotel Monaco. This property is a great place for a wedding, not only for the gorgeous backdrop for pictures including a fabulous marble staircase, but for out of town guests because of it's proximity to the Harbor(walking distance), Federal Hill, Fells Point and other attractions. In keeping with the Kimpton flare, the hotel has an old-time facade but a modern and chic decor, making it feel very intimate. Wine hour is every day at 5 in the lobby area, big comfy chairs and sofas and a glass fireplace provide a cozy atmosphere. The rooms are very well appointed and the bridal sweet is spacious with an amazing bathroom. If you appreciate bells & whistles, you'll also love the animal print bathrobes provided! Just a head's up if you are having your wedding here and don't have your own wedding planner on-site that day: we had to stay on top of the girl helping us. She was very nice but didn't really take control the way she should have and we ended up running behind schedule. Another plus is the restaurant that's in the hotel - not your typical "hotel restaurant." I live in Baltimore and love it! Overall the service was terrific - I stepped off the elevator with several bags and one of the bellman happened to be standing there and immediately helped me.
