And one more thing that may make or break your trip- this is a pet friendly hotel!

Reviews.Title: “old time luxury building, new age accommodations”
Reviews.Author: susanl
Reviews.Content: Fabulous room, gorgeous bath room, pleasant and courteous staff! Stayed one night --- wish it were longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Baltimore but a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: MDB76
Reviews.Content: My dad and I took the amtrak down from NY for the day to go to a football game. We booked the hotel from hotwire and based on the reviews, we knew we were getting an excellent value. When I first entered the building, I was really impressed with the beautiful classic architecture. We arrived around 1pm, (check-in time was 3pm) and were hoping to go straight to our room, but the room wasn't ready. We made the very short walk to the harbor and came back to the hotel at 3:30, but our room still wasn't ready. As an apology, they gave us 4 drink vouchers for the bar on the first floor and told us our room would be ready in 30 more minutes. We went down to the bar, but didn't use the vouchers because we were full from the lunch we had at the harbor, so when we came back in, I asked if they could give us breakfast the next day instead. They agreed and we went up to a beautiful room. The beds were very comfortable although when I did the standard bed bug check (which I would do in ANY hotel), I discovered what looked like a pee stain on the mattress protector underneath the top sheet. I was tired from a long day of running around, so I didn't complain about it and just decided I would sleep on the other side of the bed. After the game, we got a great night's sleep and the blinds did a great job of blacking out the room. Breakfast was delicious, although I wouldn't have eaten there if it wasn't free because it was too pricey. Checkout went smoothly and when we exited the hotel, the bellhop asked if we needed a cab. We did, but instead of a (metered) cab, he signaled to a car that was parked in front of the hotel. When I found out how much that car was going to charge us to go to the train station, I was annoyed and I told him that I felt as if they were trying to take advantage of me. The bellhop told me that the car service is somehow affiliated with the hotel, (although I was upset and may not have heard him correctly), and then I said we'll just take a metered cab, which he promptly called. (There are tons of cabs on the street - similar to any other big city) Overall, I enjoyed my stay. The hotel was very close to the harbor and a 15-20 min walk to the stadium. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, nice rooms, but several instances of poor service...”
Reviews.Author: Lville3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite beautiful, and our room was large and very nice. We got an ok deal on the room rate and would have left quite happy except for the various service problems we encountered and the unapologetic attitude of the staff when we reported the problems. The first problem was minor: we arrived in the room and there was only 1 set of towels. Easy to fix with a phone call, but annoying that this call even needed to be made! Next problem: poor valet parking service the first time we tried it. The parking garage apparently is a block or so away, so you are supposed to call 10-20 minutes before you need the car. We did, but 20 minutes later, still no sign of the car. The attendant at the entrance said the valet was getting another car first, which made us wonder why there was just one valet person on duty for the whole hotel? The hotel charges $36 per day for valet parking; they surely can afford to hire more help. The total time to get the car was 30 minutes. They improved the next two times we asked for our car --15 to 20 min each time. Next problem: we ordered tea, coffee and two desserts (creme brulee and chocolate cake) from room service. The order arrived in a timely manner, but...the coffee cups were dirty, there were no napkins, no spoons for the dessert or the tea, there was no sugar or sweetener for the tea and coffee, and they brought up the wrong type of tea. We were really glad we didn't order anything more complicated! The person we spoke with about the problem really didn't want to listen to us; "yes sir, what would you like us to do?" was his response to my description of the problem. We asked for the items that were missing, and got some of them five minutes later (but not all of them!). We called the front desk, and asked for a message to be left for the manager, because we were unhappy with this situation. The manager called just a few minutes later and, while this response time was good, it was clear that she also really did not want to hear from us. She did take the charge off our bill. We go the same unapologetic attitude at check out; the desk clerk asked how our stay was, and we told him! He simply looked at our bill and said "they took that off your bill". A simple "we're sorry" would have sufficed, but perhaps they are trained not to admit mistakes at this hotel. The final problem occurred after checkout. We noticed a charge from the hotel which we did not recognize. Called the hotel, and they informed us it was a minibar charge. We did not use the minibar (didn't even know there was one...). Once again, no apology from the person I spoke with on the phone. Just a statement that she would credit our card. Very frustrating that we have to keep calling the hotel to get problems fixed. What we will remember most about this hotel is the poor service, problems and unapologetic attitude. We will not be back. There are lots of other lovely places to stay in Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “If I had to go to Baltimore again, I would stay here and never leave the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kman918
Reviews.Content: I wasn't impressed with Baltimore at all, but this hotel is what you would expect from a kimoton.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better.”
Reviews.Author: Wislynn
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at a Kimpton property in the cities in which they are offered. That includes San Fransico, New York, Chicago, and now Baltimore. While we were a tad confused at first at entering the building, we were quickly shown to the lobby upstairs and subsequently to our beautiful room. Since our room was not ready for our early arrival, our bags were stowed. The front desk was more than helpful in answering our questions and giving directions. The Inner Harbor is short walk away (by our standards) and we found the hotel to be plenty accessible to the Harbor's attractions. Valet parking worked well. We enjoyed drinks in the evening and breakfast in the hotel's restaurant. The service was great and the food fresh and delicious. Access to their workout facility was easy and easily the best facility I've been in at a hotel. Clean, bright, plenty of equipment and room. It helped that I was the only there on a Thursday morning, but I was very pleased. Our room was decorated well, roomy, and we appreciate the Aveda bath products. We also ordered room service in the evening from the Joy Bauer menu which is known for its nutritional value and taste. Our chicken/greens salad was better than expected. We love the Kimpton properties for their extra touches and attention. We experienced great service all around and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Indulge and enjoy in Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: Ga8tr
Reviews.Content: Second time staying here on business and love love love this hotel. Would also be great for a romantic getaway. Classic yet contemporary vibe, very lush rooms with amazing beds and baths. First stay, I had a huge walk-in shower. Most recent stay the room had a walk-in shower and step-up jaccuzzi tub - awesome after a day on the expo floor. Short wine service in lobby at night, followed by fresh chocolate chip cookies and milk. Comfortable walking distance to conv ctr, Inner Harbor and Camden Yards but they also rent bikes. Only warning is it can be a bit pricey so check their web site often for specials. One of my favorites from a self proclaimed hotel snob.

Reviews.Title: “False Fire Alarms”
Reviews.Author: Steph S
Reviews.Content: The room was exceptionally quiet, beds were a little further apart than in a typical hotel, which is nice for us since our daughters like to jump between beds, this stopped that from happening. The room was decorated well and it is a wonderful preservation of a historical building. The location was near JH for my husband's business, and near the Walter's Art museum for mine. The hotel owners have no control over the area, because this is a historical site, they have done an exceptional job of preserving and bringing it back into use. They protect it's occupants by providing security and room key dependent elevators. Cookies & milk and the wine were nice perks. We also appreciated the hospitality offered by the security guard the night we arrived. The lobby setting was quite nice to relax and have a coffee, or drink, a nice comfortable social setting, set to the side of the hotel front desk, offering privacy. The downsides for us were that it did not have cartoon network, this may sound silly but it is the channel our family looks forward to when we travel. It offers entertainment for our family at all hours, unlike nick and disney which were offered, but usually run with pre-teen targeted shows. Not appealing for our 3 and 5 year olds, plus as adults once the girls go to sleep, we enjoy adult swim rather than the plethora of reality shows. The hotel, with its channel line-up, seemed geared to the average reality-show fake-drama entertaining of 20-somethings. The curtains in the room are nice and look nice, but do not block out 100% of the light, mainly because they sit inside the window frame, so morning light seeps between the wall and the curtain. Pay $10/ day for internet, I am unsure why a 4 star hotel must charge extra for the internet, they charge extra for the room and seldom offer free breakfast, business travelers depend on the internet and knowing that I feel like hotels like this one, are just getting another $10/ day. (4 stars, for lacking a good channel-line-up & curtain issue, & internet, if fire alarm had not gone off) We were there the night the alarms went off. We thought it was odd that the staff did not speak with us. I felt a little exposed, the neighborhood is sketchy and we were all out alone. (Many homeless people sleep on nearby steps-which I am glad Baltimore allows this, since some cities "clean" this up for appearances, which is a lack of freedom IMO, however, I used this to describe the locale) As I mentioned before the hotel protects it's occupants by supplying safety elements, so I was surprised when none of the hotel staff were notifying us of anything. The only person walking around was the security guard. Some of the guests were concerned about the alarms being a set-up so someone could go into their rooms to steal things. Several people were with small children and could have been offered a blanket. It was another guest that offered such hospitality to us, rather than hotel staff. Most of us thought it was a fire-alarm malfunction, since no one seemed concerned, as if this has happened before. I would think that there would have been some sort of room check-off or occupant check-off to ensure no-one was left in their room had this been a "real" emergency. Hotel Monaco, you should be talking with your occupants. We tried to sleep through the next alarm, if it had been real, we would have been in trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking”
Reviews.Author: winesfoodfun
Reviews.Content: The Monaco is a grand dame of a hotel and appears to be the best hotel in Baltimore as far as class and sophistication, however, it lacks a location befitting of its stature and management attention to safety and customer care. Our first night, we were awaken by fire alarms in the room at half past midnight. Barely awake, we and the rest of the guests briskly made our way down exit stairs to safety on the street. Guests were commenting that one of the fire exits was blocked as they tried to leave the building so they had to double back and exit through the lobby. No smoke or flames were visable while we shivered in the night air outside in this dingy neighborhood. The fire trucks didn't arrive for about 20+ mins and the firemen were not decked out in any kind of fire fighting gear. Instead, they casually entered the building and went to talk to management. Inquiring guests found out that no one from the hotel called 9-1-1 initially. Meanwhile, we were completely unsupervised and guests were actually heading back into the building to keep warm. No staff came out to tell us what was happening or what to expect. This seemed very irresponsible for the hotel management to leave us to our devices since if this were a real fire, we certainly shouldn't be anywhere near the building. When the firemen returned to their trucks, they told us we could go back in. No hotel manager, no staff, no one from the hotel came to see us all back in the building. To make matters worse, guests were calling up to the hotel lobby from their cell phones and the staff seemed to not know what to say but were certainly not interested in making sure our fears were averted. Over one hour passed from the time we were woken and were allowed to return to our rooms. About 2 hours later, the alarms went off again. This time we called down to the front desk who told us that this was a malfunction which left us really uneasy about the safety of the building. The alarm and flashing lights in the room continued to sound and flash for at least 40+ minutes. Needless to say, this proved to be a very sleepless night. To make matters even worse, the complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning was weak, not hot and like dirty dish water. False alarms continued into the following day. Kimpton Hotels should look into instituting an emergency plan and have their staff better organized. I don't think I want to stay in another Kimpton given the poor communication and lack of concern for the safety of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby and public spaces...”
Reviews.Author: otsthedog
Reviews.Content: make for a great opening experience. The marble staircases are beautiful. This is an old building that retains its original charm. There are little oddities - elevators are divided between the hotel and some other business. Also, the lobby is on the second floor. But, this is part of having a repurposed building. Check-in was great --- they told us about the milk and cookies to start about an hour after we checked in and about the wine reception that began an hour after that. Valet staff are efficient and secure taxis quickly. The public space off the lobby had nice furnishings and provided a very comfortable location for the wine reception. We went up to our room which is nicely designed. I loved the bathroom --- looks upscale and the shower is huge (no curtain) and it has an airy feel. The bathroom door is a slider with a full-length mirror on the outside, so, the door can be open without feeling as if it's infringing on the bathroom space. Other amenities include animal print robes, clock radio with ipod dock. Wi-fi included if you join their Kimpton In-touch program (free to join). Also included in the program is the opportunity to raid the mini bar for $10. I didn't notice the fridge at first -- I thought it was part of the HVAC system. The hotel (like all Kimpton resorts) is pet-friendly. We didn't bring our pet, but enjoyed seeing people arriving with their pets. The vestibule in the lobby has a discreetly placed dog bowl full of food and water. Normal amenities associated with pets are included by the hotel. Best of all, no size limits on pets! If you forget to bring your pet, the hotel will supply you with a goldfish to keep you company for the night. No need to care for it, the staff will do that. Just enjoy having a friend to talk to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: CARNashville
Reviews.Content: We found ourselves stranded by yet another airline so we started calling around Baltimore for a place to stay. We took a gamble on this hotel. It was an excellent choice. Spacious rooms, wonderful bathrooms, robes and comfortable beds. They even offered us a nice glass of wine as we checked in. The building is beautiful and historic. The restaurant located in the hotel was a welcome sight considering it was pouring down rain. Excellent service and the food was very filling. I highly recommend this hotel in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Pmanster
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a. Gem. Located in the heart of downtown near the sports arena, train station and great restaurants. Love the European feel was very stately. We came vfor a wedding with our 3 year old. She stayed on the couch with make sift bumpers while we slept in the bedroom. It was tight quarters but comfy and cozy. The hotel was in great shape and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our visit and would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: vnb
Reviews.Content: Our experience was made special by Sam, a housekeeping supervisor, who did our turn down service. When our son asked Sam if he could take home the goldfish the hotel had provided for our room, Sam said yes and offered to bring our son another one (the original goldfish was a bit puny). Sam quickly returned with large goldfish, fish food, and a plastic bag for transport. He also called the front desk to have someone dispatched to our room to evaluate the AC, which seemed slow to kick in. After leaving the hotel, we realized that we had left our son's new toy in our room so we called and left a message for Sam. The staff called back shortly thereafter to report that they had found the toy and would mail it to us.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant surprise, Plesant People, Plesant Stay. Would recommend for Baltimore Grand Prix.”
Reviews.Author: stantheman16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the Inaugural Baltimore Grand Prix. Its 2 blocks away! The staff are all pleasnt and knowledgeable people. Suggestions to places to eat were spot on. Oh, I almost forgot, FREE wine/beer hour! 5 pm to 6pm. Very comfortable stay. Visually, the hotel is as close to functional art work.as it can get. Resturant at hotel was borderline eh, and ok. Only had breakfast there. My only minor complaint, the hallway was hot. The room I was in, AC worked flawless. Very comfortable in the room. Also, tried room service twice (late night), both times unavailable. But they gave us numbers to places that delivered late, problem solved. There was a dog, so i'm assuming its pet friendly. But the quesion is, would I stay there again? Without a doubt, YES. Would I recommend it to others, I'm telling you to give it a try. I'm not picky, so unless you are, this hotel is above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “shoddy and snotty housekeeping, in a rundown part of town”
Reviews.Author: HazleW
Reviews.Content: Our room was not even made up the first day, and when we came back at 8 pm from work to find everything a mess the housekeeper argued with us about whether or not we had wanted fresh towels. Zero points there for hospitality there. On the second night, the bed was not made because apparently you have to *ask* for that. Seriously? The carpet in the hallways is a mess, the air conditioning doesn't cool the room down, it's in a really crappy part of town, and room service cannot get your order right. On the other hand, the bed is comfortable and the room is quiet because it's an old office building and the walls are thick. But overall, don't bother - it's a hassle and not worth it. Stay somewhere else where they actually care if your room is clean. We like Kimpton and have enjoyed great stays at other Monacos...but geez, this one doesn't rate. The attached photo is what the bed here looked like when we came back this evening, after housekeeping had finished with it.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel in heart of city.......and very pet friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Stokvis1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel; great location; great rooms; great for traveling with pets.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice- for family, family w/ pets, & walking distance to Dwntwn”
Reviews.Author: jerseyians
Reviews.Content: Great service. From the bellhop to frontdesk, very helpful. Quick service. We wanted to reheat some food, they brought up a microwave to our room! Lounge is nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling4Fun06
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. It was a little confusing finding the check in desk because it's on the second floor of the building. You walk in and see gorgeous chandeliers and marble staircases. After walking up the staircase, you see more marble floors, beautiful decorations, several elevators, and the check in desk surrounded by furniture, a fake (but gorgeous) fireplace, and complimentary milk and cookies. Our check in was quick and easy and our room was extremely clean and comfortable. It was quiet, cool, and the bedding was wonderful. I'm a bit OCD when it comes to hotel rooms so I even double checked and there weren't any bed bugs! Our only qualm was that we requested a complimentary companion goldfish for our stay (simply because we'd never been to a hotel where we could do that!) and it never arrived. However, lack of a goldfish certainly isn't a big deal. Overall, the hotel was stunning, exceptionally clean, comfortable, and I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel Within Walking Distance To Everything Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Burgs4862
Reviews.Content: Went to Baltimore for a family vacation and stayed at the Monaco, mostly based on previous reviews on Trip Advisor. The previous reviews are extremely accurate! The Monaco was fantastic. It is in the building that was the world headquarters for the B&O Railroad. The entire entranceway to the hotel is marble and just a breath-taking entrance. The Valet/Bellman was immediately ready to assist us with the bags. The Front Desk staff was extremely friendly. Our room was a two double bed room. The room was cozy...a little small, but we didn't feel crunched in. The room had a "bonus" room, which was very odd. The bonus room was empty and really had no function as it was very small and probably could double as another closet. The bathroom and room were very clean, even spotless. The kids enjoyed complimentary cookies and milk in the afternoon. The hotel also had a Wii gaming system available in one of the lobbies for the guests to use. The hotel is very close to most attractions. We walked to Camden Yards for a Baltimore Orioles game. The Ravens stadium is just a little further, but certainly within walking distance. The National Aquarium and the Inner Harbor are also just a short walk from the hotel. The B&O Brasserie Restaurant at the hotel was clean and had courteous service. They ran a special where kids eat free through the summer time... BONUS! Took other Trip Advisor's recommendations and parked around the corner in the public parking. It cost me much less than utilizing the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “when they say they are pet-friendly, they MEAN it”
Reviews.Author: nicoletravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend and brought our dog for his first hotel stay, choosing it merely because they welcome pets. Not only did they make our dog so welcome (doggy bed, treats, maps to dog parks nearby) but it is a great hotel with an attentive staff and modern, luxurious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL WITH A GREAT STAFF...BEST IN BALTIMORE...STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MzAmerica
Reviews.Content: I stayed here quite a few times and this place is amazing. The staff is very professional and welcoming. The rooms are simply beautiful! This is a really upscale hotel and its the best in Baltimore! I've stayed in quite a few hotels in Baltimore! And let me mention the restaurant....just fab!!!! If you want to experience a perfect hotel visit...stay here! Feels like home! PS....they are pet friendly and treat the pets like royalty! My min pin Diesel loved it! And they are good at calling you by your last name...its as if they knew you your whole life! I loved hearing....Hey Ms. Anderson! Just FAB!

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed here several times - first class all the way”
Reviews.Author: C Z
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times - first class all the way. Beautiful building, great service, immacualtely clean rooms, and they even actually deliver the newspaper upon request. (you would be amazed how few hotels can do that). Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect StayCation”
Reviews.Author: Moore777
Reviews.Content: Ever since my husband and I stayed at one of your hotels last year (when we were engaged), nothing compares. Last summer, we needed a break from the stresses of life, but money was tight, so we stayed in area. We live in Baltimore, but I never actually spent time at the harbor; so for our stay-cation, we made accommodations at the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore – and we got spoiled! When we booked the room, we originally intended on seeing different attractions in the area, but once we got to the room, it was hard to leave! First of all, we loved the luxurious décor and the warm colors, both inside the room and throughout the hotel. We also fell in love the huge king size bed; now our queen-sized bed at home, (or anywhere else we stay), seems too small. We also loved the spacious and alluring bathroom; now, when we stay anywhere else, we feel like the bathroom is inadequate - no matter how nice it may seem. We also loved the fact that we could control the temperature of the room instead of just having the air either off or on. We were also glad that the room had a flat screen TV (like what we have at home), and that the cable was NOT limited (like it is in other hotels). In our entire three-day stay, we only left the room maybe three times; out of those three times, we only actually left the hotel once. The other two times we left our room, was to eat at the hotel’s restaurant (where the food and service was exceptional) and to explore the rest of the hotel. My husband and I have very sedentary lifestyles, but we even loved the gym! We actually worked out together and had fun (which was something we always wanted to do but had never done). We have nothing but good things to say about this hotel chain. Our stay at the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore was an experience that we will always remember. It was just what we needed. Our only disappointment is that we couldn’t stay longer. We got married this year (in May), and wanted to stay at Hotel Monaco again, but money is still tight. We didn’t even have a wedding, (just a very small, short private ceremony.) We stayed somewhere cheaper (about 30 minutes from home). It actually pretty nice, but it wasn’t the same. We kept comparing everything to Hotel Monaco and didn’t enjoy our time the way we could have. So I want to surprise my husband by staying at the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore for his birthday in December. I don’t get excited about many things, (and neither does he), but I can’t wait to stay here again! I only wish we could stay more often!

Reviews.Title: “Love it! They went above and beyond to make this a wonderful experience!:”
Reviews.Author: Jeremiah S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married right before hurricane Irene hit and therefore out travel plans out of Baltimore were cancelled. We found the Monaco online and thought lets give it a try just to get out of the house for our celebration. We were greeted by friendly and helpful staff who jumped right on dinner reservations for us with out even being prompted. When we walked into our room - Mediterranean Room - we were welcome by champagne and chocolate covered strawberries with notes of congratulations! Rose petals lead us through the beautiful room and fabulous spa bathroom!!! So romantic and decadent!! The gold fish roommates were one of the main reasons we picked the hotel and the little cuties greeted us too! Next time we come we know we will want to bring our puppy since they are so pet friendly! We had dinner in the B&O Brasserie and everything was delicious and the staff knew we were newlyweds and were treated so well including complimentary champagne again! We can not thank the Hotel Monaco enough for making our honeymoon romantic, decadent and special. We will definitely be back again and will always think of you with a smile! Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value & services”
Reviews.Author: bom2535
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the room at the end of the corridor therefore it's more spacious and not square-shaped feeling. Not much view from my side of the building but others were great nonetheless. Great attentive staff from valet (though expensive parking) till very helpful and friendly check-in. Internet always free at Kimptons upon request which no exception here. Room was lovely decorated, very upscale and beautiful. Bed and pillows were fantastic and very clean. Mini-bar items are in good selection and at acceptable prices. Compliment coffee till 9am. was nice as well as juices. Tried breakfast on E&O which also great and reasonable price. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel and will certainly check on this first for the next time in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful Kimpton property !”
Reviews.Author: MrCsMd
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, chic hotel in an historic building (loved the marble staircases) and great downtown location. Clean, quiet, and large room with a very comfortable King bed. Staff, as always for the Kimpton chain, was pleasant and helpful. Only negative was the ridiculous $36 valet parking fee....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: labrt2004
Reviews.Content: The first thing you see when you come into the hotel is the very impressive, gorgeous marble staircase. It's a historical monument. Along with the beautiful ceilings, that's almost worth it alone! The rooms are also a work of art. I couldn't get over just how pretty the draperies were. The standard king sized rooms aren't huge, but they're comfortable and they're full of lovely little details. Bright color in a room is always a refreshing change, As are high, pre-war style ceilings. I was tickled by the patterned robes on offer in the closet. Usually, you just have plain old white terry-cloth, but not here. Join the loyalty club, and you can get a $10 voucher to the awesome mini bar. The service was fantastic: We had booked a package that included a wine and cheese reception, but arrived too late, so the front desk gave me and my two colleagues $14 credit to the hotel bar (B&O Brasserie) instead, for any cocktail. We invited a fourth colleague along when we went, and even though we only had three vouchers, the waitress gave us the fourth drink for free, too (it was only an iced tea, but still). The only complaint I had is that in my room, which was a shower stall only room (no bathtub), there seemed to be no door to close the shower! You simply stepped in and took your shower while exposed to the cold air of the bathroom. The water splashed outside and made the floor wet. It definitely felt weird, and it’s kind of a strange design choice in an otherwise exquisitely planned room… But in summary, the place is a visual treat and staffed with very courteous people. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, we'll stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Akalevee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for our anniversary. We had tickets to the orioles and it was an easy walk to the stadium. The harbor was really close and easy to get to. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The restaurant was great. The host, bartender and manager were super accommodating. They need to reconsider the cocktail waitress though. The rooms are nice and big and the bed was comfortable. The only bad thing was that there was no door on the shower and the water got on the floor and made it slippery. We will definitely go back. We stayed at the Hilton last year and it was no comparison to the Monaco. I will recommend to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Awesome Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: karlsruhe_79
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about my short, two day stay. I arrived extremely early, around 7:30 a.m. and did not expect to check in until later, I just wanted to drop off my car and luggage but to my surprise my room was ready, plus I received a voucher for breakfast in their restaurant, which, by the way, was great! The room was nicely appointed, very clean, Aveda products. There was a wine and sangria happy hour every evening that also included a different shot of a drink, a small dish and cookies. The service was outstanding from the minute I arrived until I left. The bed was super comfortable. I wanted to stay longer and will definitely return to the chain. I travel often on business and there was nothing I would have changed about my stay, kudos to the staff and management!

Reviews.Title: “Best chain ever”
Reviews.Author: lavender12
Reviews.Content: i love the kimpton hotels and this hotel was wonderful. Good service nice clean and modern rooms and they made me feel like i was at home. no pool though :(

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but horrible service”
Reviews.Author: wubaba
Reviews.Content: I would have given a 5/5 rating if not for the poor customer service we received. My husband and I stayed here in 2010. We loved it then, and returned hoping for another great experience… The lady that checked us in at the front desk was very friendly. And the hotel is relatively close to the inner harbor. However, it was the hotel manager that ruined it all. It was the Otakon weekend so most of downtown Baltimore was filled with people in costume attending the convention. I was in costume as well. That manager said to me and my husband arrogantly that we were not allowed to take pictures in the hotel because “it is a private property.” He also asked me to stay outside of the hotel in the 100+ degree weather when I was at the ground level lobby waiting for my husband who went to our room to pick up some stuff. I would have never expected such level of customer service at any hotel, not to mention at this Hotel Monaco, which was rated as a 4 star hotel by TripAdvisor. I searched the Kimpton website and did not find any “NO PHOTOS ALLOWED” policy. It is also not mentioned anywhere that people in costumes are not welcomed in the Monaco hotel. I should mention that we went to other hotels in the area to hang out with friends and we did not encounter a single rude hotel staff at those hotels. All the people there greeted us warmly. We took tons of personal photos and had a great time without being asked to fill out any "release form" which, according to the manager, is required in advance to take pictures at the Monaco hotel. Comparing the amount of money we paid for the room and the services we received, we were very disappointed at Hotel Monaco and would not return. There are many less expensive hotel chains in the area that treat their guests like their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed but not quite a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: willymae43
Reviews.Content: The bed was wonderful. However the emergency vehicles seemed to go by just outside the room all night. Very hard to sleep. The room was looking a little "tired" too. My daughter and I ordered room service and got a chocolate brownie sundae. My daughter loves brownies and she would not even finish her share. It just did not have much chocolate flavor. The small scoop of ice cream was terrible and she had green stuff stuck to the inside of her milk glass. Oh, and they forgot to give us anything to eat the sundae with. So, wear earplugs and do not waist your money on room service if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good corner rooms. Friendly ambience.”
Reviews.Author: nyc010
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the recent heat wave. Front desk extremely friendly. Corner rooms are neatly arranged and pleasant. We received a bottle of wine for our anniversary. Stayed on aquarium package which is a great deal if planning to visit with young children. Valet parking ($36) a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wow the hotel is breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: nlandi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last November and was amazed at the beauty and cleanliness of this hotel...the location is ok and close to inner harbor walking wise...the room was spotless and beautiful....I didn't have much interaction with the staff other than check in which went fine..their restaurant was delicious! It is pricey a bit but not extreme! I would have stayed there again this year but they increased their prices per nite so its not affordable for us....I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slscottxny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in the Spring and wish I had more time there. The hotel is so visually striking it's hard to describe - you should to check out their website and look at the photos. Great rooms, great service, great location and a pretty decent restaurant and bar on site. If you want a bit of upscale in the Inner Harbour area check out the Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sneoae
Reviews.Content: I like to randomly try out nice hotels in different cities. This one received great reviews and I loved the pictures on the website. The best parts of my one night stay for a romantic evening in the upgraded room: 1. Spa/whirlpool tub (excellent!). Bathroom was immaculate. Loved! 2. Courteous and helpful staff--checked in with no problems and valet was very prompt. 3. Bed VERY comfortable. 4. No loud noises or thin walls. 5. Cookies and milk in the lobby was a nice touch. Not my favorite things: 1. I prepaid for my room through priceline but I'm noticing an addition $299 charge (between valet and a bottle of Reisling...why do I have this exorbitant fee?--haven't received a call back yet). 2. One of my curtains did not raise and let down properly. Decent curtains should be expected for the amount of money I paid. Overall: Very nice stay. Extra money was worth it simply for the bathroom and the romantic vibe it gave off.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: MrDuber
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent an evening here while visiting friends in the Baltimore area. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by the doorman and immediately ushered to the check-in desk. As soon as we walked into the building we were extremely impressed with how thoughtfully the old B&O headquarters building had been restored. The desk clerk accommodated my wife's request for a high room, and we were shortly riding the elevator to the top floor of the hotel. Our room was immaculate and well-decorated; however, there was a very hard-to-place odor (wet dog? clean-up from an earlier smoker gone wrong?) that was unacceptable. A quick call to the front desk and we were immediately moved to a new room - sans smell - down the hall. Like the first room, this room too was well decorated with Kimpton's distinctive style and the bathroom (marble throughout, extensive tile work in the shower) was first-rate. The staff, from reception to the cleaning personnel, were friendly and very helpful. We look forward to staying here again. Our only complaint is that the $35/day valet parking seems exorbitant given nearby garage rates.

Reviews.Title: “Love the place hate the staff”
Reviews.Author: Joshiep123
Reviews.Content: When I arrived to the monaco I gave the valet service my bags to hold on to while I enjoyed the city. When I came back 45 minuet later my bags where on a luggage cart in the middle of the walk way in front of the hotel with no one attending to them. When I told the staff about it they didn't seem to care. I loved every thing about the hotel except for the people running it.

Reviews.Title: “The room was beautiful but the service was just okay.”
Reviews.Author: Ravenhaired
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for Valentine's Day weekend. My husband requested a coffee maker for the room (you have to ask for one when making reservations), it wasn't there when we arrived. He had flowers delieved to the room and asked the booking agent to stay within a specific budget. They blew this budget by $40! Then, we got double charged for the room. My credit card company had to fax them a copy of the charges so that the card could be credited. These people need to get it together!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: RRMaheen
Reviews.Content: I booked a special trip celebrating my husband's birthday. When we checked in, not only did the hotel upgrade us, but also called my husband in the room to wish him happy birthday and sent up a bottle of champagne to help us celebrate. The hotel is also the perfect location to enjoy the inner harbor area and the evening wine reception was an added benefit. We will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlLover80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monaco Baltimore for a pre-birthday weekend getaway. We used valet the entire weekend and had absolutely no problems dropping off or retrieving our vehicle. The valet attendants were fast and friendly. Valet is a little pricey at $36/day, but well worth the convenience. Check in was a breeze and took less than 5 minutes (we used Hotwire for great deals). Keep in mind check-in is on the lobby level (go up one floor on the elevator or stairs). The building is gorgeous on the inside with marble walls and floors and beautiful chandeliers. The bell hop was informative and friendly as well. The room was a decent size and included a full bath, ample closet space, a TV, two large windows, a desk/chair and a king size bed (which by the way is THE most comfortable bed I've EVER slept in). The hotel was always quiet and it felt like we were the only people occupying the floor. The hotel is about 5 blocks from the Inner Harbor, so keep that in mind when booking. To a tourist, or someone unfamiliar with the area, the locals may seem a bit intimidating. Yes, there is a metro train stop across the street, but the hotel is in downtown. If you do venture out, stay on the main streets that are busy and you should have no issues. The B&O American Brasserie (the hotel's restaurant on the 1st floor) was pretty good for cocktail hour. It wasn't busy when we sat down around 3:30 pm on a Friday. We ordered the flatbread (their version of a pizza) which was surprisingly very tasty. Our food sat on the counter for about 5 minutes because the waiter left the room. It was slightly annoying, but nothing detrimental. We went back for breakfast the following morning. The food was very underwhelming. After 4pm, the hotel offers warm cookies and milk at the check-in desk. Some of the best chocolate chip cookies I've had. They were even cut in squares! After 6pm, the hotel offers white and red wine and sangria. We didn't take advantage, though. We also worked out in the hotel's gym on the third floor. It was completely empty when we arrived (10pm on Saturday), and there were plenty of clean machines in working order (ellipticals, treadmills, exercise bikes) along with weights, plentiful clean towels and water. The flat screen TV on the wall and on each machine was a nice added touch. The only negative I have to comment on would be the maid service. The maid came in while we were in the room, and she didn't stay longer than 5 minutes. With a four star hotel, I would expect a thorough cleaning of the bathroom, fresh linens, dusting and vacuuming, none of which occurred. She didn't arrange the complimentary toiletries properly, but instead kind of threw them on the sink. And, one of the new washcloths put in the bathroom had several pubic hairs attached to it. If I didn't look closely, I would have washed my face with it. All in all, this is a great hotel with plenty of great amenities, friendly and accommodating staff in an awesome central location. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Resounding Thud”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTripper007
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is located in the historic B&O Railroad building, a few blocks from Baltimore's Inner Harbor area. The hotel lobby is located a level of above the entrance and can be reached by elevator or from a gorgeous set of marble staircases. There is a spacious seating area near the front desk, and it is well appointed with comfortable chairs and sofas. Unfortunately, it's not near anything else. The bar/restaurant is located on the first floor. The menu aims for trendy, but hits at best the outer ring of the target. The bar staff, however, is excellent and worth a stop, even if you aren't staying at the hotel. The rooms are large and comfortable. I was disappointed to learn the hotel has nary a single firm pillow. You'll need to pack your own, unless you're comfortable sleeping on a pile of barely there pillows. The bed itself was comfortable. I noticed other reviews comment on street noise, which is present but not any worse than any large urban center hotel. The volume when the air handler kicks on is a bit disconcerting. My other disappointment was service related. When I returned to my room after being out for the day, I found that it had not been serviced. A call to Guest Services yielded the following, "Well, are you sure you there wasn't a sign out." Nope, no sign. The front desk staff looked at my clothes before I showered and dressed for dinner and recommended a place I entered and exited in one motion. They did not ask what type of food I preferred or what style restaurant would be desirable for our group. The service, with the notable exception of the bar staff, the valets and bellmen, was indifferent at best. For a four star experience, these guys need to get it together.

Reviews.Title: “Bitten by Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: TravelProf72
Reviews.Content: I love the Kimpton hotels and am an Inner Circle member so I try to stay at a Kimpton whenever I travel. I recently returned from a visit to Baltimore and stayed at the Hotel Monaco in room 1422. I had a fairly pleasant stay but noticed several bedbug bites (3-4 different locations) as I was leaving the hotel. I have reported the problem to the hotel's general manager. Hopefully they will attempt to rectify the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Kimpton standards”
Reviews.Author: mc437
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful experience at The Washington Palomar, this was disappointing to say the very least. The hotel was notified of our pre 3pm Saturday arrival, yet there was no room ready for us and we were told to come back at 3:00pm. When we arrived at 3:30pm, there was still nothing available. A complaint to the manager quickly rectified the situation; a room was immediately made available and she offered to compensate us for our inconvenience. This hotel, unfortunately, is not up to Kimpton standards in my opinion. The glasses in the bathroom looked as though they had been only rinsed and left to dry. The wallpaper was patched. Otherwise, the room itself was OK but don't take a room overlooking the street if you like your sleep. All we heard all night were police and fire engine sirens. The staff were OK, but not overly welcoming or hospitable. Not a 4-star hotel experience, by any means.

Reviews.Title: “very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Grandpuba007
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at worse, but overall underwhelming. Service was attentive when I raised a few issues but didn't actually follow-through. Views were also of a brick wall.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service, Beautiful Property, Easy Walk to Inner Harbor & Pier 6”
Reviews.Author: stagmomx2
Reviews.Content: Kimpton does it right. Called front desk prior to visit explaining we were celebrating our 23rd anniversary. Joseph at the front desk upgraded us to the Med Suite which was beautiful. The valets to Darryl and Preston at the front desk to the head of housekeeping--all are adept at providing superior customer service. The room was clean, well appointed and spacious (suite on 11th floor). We had a nice 20 minute walk down to Roy's next to the Marriott for their Hawaiian fusion cuisine, then enjoyed Chris Botti's concert at Pier Six. Easy walk back to the hotel. Yes, it's a city -- but Baltimore police and city guides out and friendly. Just walk with a purpose. Kimpton In Touch members enjoy the complimentary breakfast in the stylish B&O Restaurant and a $10 credit for the room's minibar. The building has beautiful architecture and Kimpton's reputation for boutique hotels and impeccable service continues to set the standard. When in Baltimore--stay here! Thanks for a fun anniversary weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Arguably the Best Hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoOrange
Reviews.Content: I travel to Baltimore often and stayed in a number of hotels. The Hotel Monaco is probably the best. Service is great, rooms are clean and quite, and it’s super stylish.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary over night set the stage for another 21 years!”
Reviews.Author: TheLadyKathryn
Reviews.Content: A friend of a friend was planning a surprise romantic anniversary get away for her husband. My friend called me for a hotel recommendation because I’m always planning something. Remembering our romantic room in Florida, I checked to see if there was a Kimpton in Baltimore. I don’t’ usually make referrals to hotels unless I’ve stayed there, but based on my experience at the Vero Beach Kimpton I took a chance. As luck would have it, I found the Hotel Monaco. I checked the pic’s on the web site and called to check reservation availability – I was looking for the romance package which was unfortunately sold out – but I booked the hotel anyway on line for the anniversary couple. I wrote in the comments that this was a very special occasion and a surprise. I also mentioned that the wife would like to check in early in order to apply romantic touches to the room. This weekend was also be Father’s day. I then prayed everything would go well and went off to my Father’s day weekend at the Palomar (Kimpton) in Philadelphia – also very very nice. Well, Monday morning, my friend couldn’t contact me fast enough to sing the praises of the Baltimore Monaco hotel. The room was better than her friend imagined (beauty and comfort) and the staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating. The front desk even found her a discounted rate which was better than the rate I found for them. My friends friend couldn’t have been more pleased and the weekend was “oh so romantic”. Therefore I am once again singing the praises of Kimpton and I now feel confident that I can refer the hotels (whether I’ve stayed there or not) to my friends and family and not worry they’ll have a bad experience. Also, and very important, both my friend and my referral reputations remain intact. Smile. My friend said that her friend was so happy, she was singing the praises of the hotel and recommending it at work all day Monday. In closing, to top it off the weekend, when the wife brought her husband back later that afternoon to begin the surprise, as she was walking him blindfolded through the lobby they ran into a well known comedian who joked about the kidnapping and gave them passes to his comedy show to help them celebrate the occasion. I’d like to attribute that in part to the Kimpton culture… if you’re happy, then everyone around you is happier. The whole pay it forward thing. You’re nice to me, I’m nice to the next person…. Etc. Anyway, thanks to the Monaco hotel. I can’t wait to give you a try myself. Please be aware, the neighborhood is an urban one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: pengysan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco Baltimore this weekend and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the hotel is pet friendly which was a bonus. The rooms and common areas are new and clean looking, bedding was comfortable. We stopped by the happy hour for complimentary drinks and it was a very nice atmosphere. The hotel is a short walk to the Inner Harbor and downtown, very accessible. We enjoyed our stay. While we probably won't be back in Baltimore, we'll certainly stay at another Monaco Hotel elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but the A/C wasn't working properly.”
Reviews.Author: lululouise
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on a recent business trip. As previous entries stated, make sure to join the Kimpton Hotel rewards club. I was able to get free wi-fi, breakfast, and $10 to use towards the mini bar. The room decor was very nice and they have Aveda products, which I absolutely love! The staff were very nice. The only issue is that I was staying there when the heat was 95 plus degrees. When I arrived, my room was set at the normal 70 degrees. I lowered it, but it didn't seem to cool off. I mentioned this to the front desk the following morning and was told that they would have engineering take a look. Well, that never happened! The next night was even worse! It was cooler in the hallway than it was in my room. I couldn't wait to leave the room to check out. While I'm sure this is not the norm, it needs to be addressed. While I would recommend the hotel, I would check the weather and call ahead to make sure the air conditioning is working properly. Oh, great happy hour reception for guests that's free!

Reviews.Title: “Classic building turned into hotel”
Reviews.Author: StephHorn
Reviews.Content: A beautiful office building converted into a beautiful hotel. Our stay here was pleasant except for an issue with the A/C which was not working properly. The front desk gave us a credit. The only problem is that Baltimore has just not made a great comeback. We rested on a bench in the Inner Harbor with a bunch of homeless people. We felt safe enough but not what we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel! My furry friends enjoyed it as much as we did!”
Reviews.Author: MissyLhoste
Reviews.Content: Our experience was exceptional! We brought our two very large Rottweilers with us and it was one of the best traveling experices we have ever had. The staff is totally accommodating and our rotties were pampered from start to finish! I had never stayed in a Kimpton hotel... But will seek them out after staying here! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: biandi
Reviews.Content: We came here for valentines day and it was amazing from start to finish. The bellman took us from our car to check in then went up to our room got us ice, showed us how everything worked and deposited our bags. After a half hour of arrival the front desk called to insure our satisfaction,now that's service. The room was decorated in a travel motif to go along with the fact that the hotel is an old train station. The bathrooms 2 person jacuzzi was very large. The evening wine reception was very nice. Even though it was Valentines weekend check out and valet were smooth and speedy. We will be going here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have stayed at a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pghpgh20
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Baltimore for the Memorial Day weekend. We could only get the Hotel Monaco for Friday night. The location is great, the staff is very friendly in the hotel, and the amenities are good. The turn down service was a welcomed surprise and so was the $10 credit for being a kimpton member. We did not use the valet service. We went up on street past the hotel to Fayette street and parked in a self-park underground lot that was roughly $13. The Happy Hour in the lobby from 5-6 was great. It was a nice way to unwind after a long day of travel. I will suggest if you book early, check your rate before arriving. I was able to find a lower rate the day before we checked in and changed it online to the lower price. The restaurant that is attached is great for drinks in the evening, but the morning staff was very disorganized and we ended up leaving before having breakfast. As with most Kimpton hotels- truly worth the money for the little amenities that they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay for Conference and Fun”
Reviews.Author: specialKCD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monaco for a conference at the convention center and a couple extra days to see Baltimore. Really great service by all the staff. Pet goldfish to keep me company in a lovely room on the top floor was a great touch. The stylish room was very comfortable and kept perfectly clean during my 8 days there late checkout on the last day was easy to arrange. Entire hotel was beautifully decorated and happy hour wine tastings were fabulous. Would stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, if only it could be surgically removed from Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Dragonlady15
Reviews.Content: Thehotel is beautiful, but unfortunately, that doesn't fix it's location. Baltimore is still a bit of a dump, and thus, the hotel felt mostly deserted. In retrospect, it is also too expensive for being where it is. And finally, the lack of clientele seems to affect the staff's ability to properly guide the few existing guests on how to navigate the city. We asked for help on the simple matter of how to order pizza delivery, and were given a place to call that never even delivered our food! And the night room-service menu is too scant and not really appealing-so we went to bed hungry. Really-if I'm paying 250 a night for a hotel, I expect better. Note to guests- if you stay here, do NOT order from Massey's restaurant if you care about getting your food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: MrTed
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Hotel Monaco while visiting family in the area. I am a member of the Kimpton In Touch loyalty program and we always stay at Kimpton hotels if one is located in our destination. This was one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms are modern and comfortable, but the hotel has maintained the building's historic character. The hotel rooms are located on the upper floors of the building, above several floors of office space. As we were there over a weekend, we did not notice any traffic or noise related to the office space. The hotel is located in the downtown area of Baltimore, away from the Inner Harbor, but within walking distance. Check in and check out were easy. The staff was welcoming and helpful. Upon arrival, we were shown to the front desk by a very friendly bellman, who also took our bags to our room. We used the valet service to park our car. It was $36 a night, but high parking rates are expected in downtown areas. We had to check out very early and the front desk and valet staff were very accommodating in making sure our car was ready before 5am. Our room was on the 14th (top) floor and had wonderful high ceilings, a large bathroom, and an incredibly comfortable bed. My only complaint about the room is that the A/C system is loud, which is generally good, but it is difficult sleep due to the system cycling off and on every few minutes during the night. Switching the system to "fan" just made the room warm. If you are not a light sleeper, or if you don't need a very cool room for sleeping, this may not be a problem. The hotel's restaurant, like other Kimpton hotel restaurants we have tried, was very good. We had breakfast there one morning and ordered room service for dinner one night. For both, the food was good, service was efficient, and prices were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: olger
Reviews.Content: Room was nice sized - although it developed a roof leak in the night. The dripping woke us up. Lobby was comfortable. Excellent fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Still feeling refreshed and checkout was 14 hours ago...”
Reviews.Author: lekelbelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night for an event at the convention center, and the only thing I regret is not being able to stay longer. I've stayed at the most expensive DC hotels, and this hotel puts them to shame. The moment you step through the front door, you feel like royalty as you're surrounded by marble staircases and a massive chandelier about a hundred feet above your head. I was impressed by the attention to quality in the suite I stayed in, from the massive marble shower to the robes hanging in the closet. The blackout curtains and plush king bed ensured a perfect night of sleep, which was badly needed. Their "Guppy Love" program added the perfect touch to my stay after I requested a fish be brought to my room out of curiosity. Housekeeping quickly delivered a goldfish to my room, it was too cute! Overall it was worth every penny, and I will consider this hotel first for planning any wedding festivities in the future, I was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: JRTurner610
Reviews.Content: Great building, wonderful refurbishing as a hotel 2 years ago, great rooms with fantastic decoration, Italian tile, high ceilings; friendly and helpful staff. The only thing I didn't like was the lack of coffee makers in the rooms - I don't buy into the nonsensical philosophy of "we're too posh to allow customers to make their own coffee in their rooms". For coffee addicts like me, we don't want to move anywhere in the morning until we've had our first (couple of) cups of coffee. We don't want to have to throw clothes on and try to act human to go to the lobby to get coffee there, no matter how much better it might be. Give us coffee in our room!! Otherwise, loved it! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get to enjoy for long, but pretty nice.”
Reviews.Author: OHTransplant3
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel late as we were just staying here as a stepping stone to get to Delaware for a weekend trip. When we got to the room, they had classical music playing on the iPod docking station. Cons: With the exception of the sheets, the room was VERY clean. Unfortunately we were exhausted and went to sleep without checking the sheets and found tiny spots of blood. I have to believe that this was a rare occurrence and I am not going to fault the whole hotel for this since they were very shocked when we told them the next day. I bet if we would have seen it the night before, they would have taken care of it right away. I also didn't like the fact that we could not carry our own luggage to the room even after we insisted we were fine. I understand this is a more upscale hotel but they should give you the option of whether or not you would like assistance Pros: The decor is great in this hotel with a lot of marble. A HUGE plus to this hotel is the fact that they are pet friendly. The gym is excellent. We woke up early and they had pretty nice equipment including elliptical machines, treadmills, and some cybex type resistance machines. We didn't get to go, but I think all Kimpton hotels have a wine reception every night from 5-6 which is very nice. FYI -- If you go to their website and become a "Kimpton in-touch" member you get perks such as $10 to raid the mini bar. All in all, I'd say if you can get a discount like we did (corporate discount) then this is a great place but I'd be a little upset to pay asking price for this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Unique Hotel Minutes from Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: stonecroft
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Baltimore for weekend with teenage daughter to visit college. We stayed two nights at the Monaco Baltimore in a deluxe suite on the 7th floor. The room was spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was large with a very good size walk-in marble and tile shower. The staff was very responsive to all requests. The fresh baked cookies and wine tasting each evening was a nice touch. The hotel common areas are large, unique and elegant. It is a 5-10 minute walk to the inner harbor shops and restaurants. We had dinner one night at the hotel restaurant, B&O American Brasserie-the portions are small but very good and slightly expensive. We took a taxi to and from the airport (BWI)-20 minute ride each way depending on traffic and cost is +/- $45.00 one-way (i found the taxis expensive compared to other cities). All in all a great stay at the Monaco Baltimore and recommend to anyone staying in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Decadent experience”
Reviews.Author: thinktankjp
Reviews.Content: We had a great one night stay at the Hotel Monaco. Reserved a king bed room, gambled on the $15 upgrade option the week prior and we were rewarded with a Mediterranean Suite. The room was modern and fun, with wonderful bathroom fixtures and amenities. The bed was very comfortable. The staff at the front desk and the valet were all polite, helpful, and efficient. The room had wonderful tall ceilings and huge windows for great daylight. It was a splurge, but I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but room service problematic”
Reviews.Author: NYerUWS
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel with its great Kimpton service. Rooms are gorgeous - got a small suite with spa tub, and thoroughly enjoyed it and the very comfortable bed. Heard not a single sound during my entire stay. The only problem was room service - when bkfst arrived 30 minutes late, the woman who answered the phone made excuses and then was the person who delivered a soggy mess of cold eggs, melted butter for the toast and limp greens. I also ordered room service for dinner the night before, and was disappointed in the temperature of the food. In both instances, it was obvious that the personnel delivering the food and answering the phone need customer service training. Since problems with room service have been identified in numerous reviews, I don't know why the hotel has not fixed this problem by now. There is a very seedy section of town close to the hotel, and when we asked directions to walk to Little Italy, the front door staff directed us right through it instead of directing us to walk through the Inner Harbor area, which would have let us avoid the problem entirely. With some attention to these kinds of details, this could be a world class hotel

Reviews.Title: “Really unique hotel ... a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: travelingtocaribean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise vacation. It was very clean, in an old train station building, totally renovated. It was a very unique hotel, not the norm, very comfortable and elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and style. Best hotel in Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: KStarrr
Reviews.Content: The staff was great. The evening cocktail hour that serves free champagne and organic wine was just what I needed upon arrival. The cocktail hour host was very friendly and knowledgeable about the wines being served. The historic building in which the hotel is located has a very interesting past, and they did a great job of preserving/restoring the original grand marble staircase. The bedding was a dream to sleep on, and the bathroom was one of the nicest I've ever seen--everything in it looked brand new and was well designed. The high ceilings gave the already generous-sized rooms an even larger feel. My only complaint about the room was that there were some stains on the chair in the room, and that made me not want to sit on it, but no biggie. I used the fitness center once, and although small it was very clean with good cardio equipment. If you want great service and style, I highly recommend this hotel. It's probaby the best Baltimore has to offer. Don't forget to request your goldfish during your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Am I asking too much?”
Reviews.Author: bulldog6649
Reviews.Content: Went to this Hotel to see Elton John at First Mariner. The location was great, just a short walk, the restaruant was also very good. But if you want room service in the morning good luck. After three or four calls we left the hotel without eathing breakfast at 11:30. We were told after the the third call why we still did not have breakfast, "they were crushed with orders". So, the management and stafff are so inept, they can not get me breakfast two hours after I ordered it? Please. This is a motel with Hotel location. On top of this, no newspaper (when everyone else had it) in the morning, TV did not work, no kleenex, Again, if location to the arena is th priority. This is it. Just don't expect quality service once you are there

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Weekend in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: thorntree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco April 1-3 for a family gathering. We booked thru Priceline and were pretty sure we were going to get the Monaco as several of our group before and after us also got the Monaco thru Priceline (4**** Baltimore Downtown and Inner Harbour). The hotel is in the old Baltimore and Ohio Railway headquarters which was built in 1905. The outside in unpretentious, but the inside has a lot of character. The rooms are very large and our room was very quite because we asked for a quite room and were given an inside court with no real view which I will trade in favor of a view anyday as quite is more important to me. The halls have a very thick carpet so the noises inside the hotel were practically non-existant. The bed was very comfortable and the furnishings very nice. The hotel is about a 4 block walk from the inner harbour. While the Monaco is not as flashy as some of the other Inner Harbour hotels it is just a nice on the inside. On Sunday morning our group of 20 had a very nice brunch in the hotel restaurant with 2 large tables set up for us.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Never Stay Anywhere Else Again”
Reviews.Author: d_hops
Reviews.Content: The Monaco in Baltimore exceeded every expectation, and went above the already-excellent standard that Kimpton Hotels always live up to. The property is gorgeous: the building is breathtaking, with special details in numerous places. The fitness center is well above what most boutique hotels offer. My room furnishings, floor plan (I was in a large corner suite overlooking Charles St.) and bathroom were phenomenal - including the deepest bathtub I have ever seen! The staff members were also tremendously welcoming and helpful: from the time I got out of the cab until I departed the next morning they went beyond all necessity to ensure I was comfortable and happy. From being greeted with a glass of wine, to being handed a jogging map of the city upon check-in, they paid attention to the things that matter to me. The GM is certainly running this place well. I can't wait to go back, but this time for fun instead of work!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place!”
Reviews.Author: johnee40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore for the first time this past Sunday, 3/20 just overnight. When we arrived we weren't too sure about the place because the lobby is not where you walk in because the hotel is in a building that also houses offices. We took the elevator up to the Lobby and it was very nice, very modern and everyone greeted us in a very friendly manner. We asked for a room in a quiet location and we ended up at Room 814. It was very nicely appointed, very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We treated ourselves to massages in the room and a lovely woman named Sharon came - she was very professional and very good at what she does. The room was a good size to be able to set up a massage table and the bathroom had a tub so while one of us was getting the massage the other was soaking in the tub and it worked out very well. The Restaurant that they use for room service which is located in the building has the most wonderful food. We ordered sweet potato gnocci with braised pork and sweet green peas and it was to die for!! We also got a great salad and a flat bread and we wished we had ordered more of everything - it was all fantastic!! In addition, they have milk and cookies at 4:00 in the lobby and at 5:00 they serve wine and champagne. The lobby is very comfortable with a really cool fireplace and great seating arrangements. I asked for a quiet room and I got a quiet room. I never heard a sound all night except for street noise which when you're in a city environment, there's not much you can do about that, but the hotel was fabulous and I would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is astounding!”
Reviews.Author: jana1954
Reviews.Content: This is our second experience with a Kimpton Hotel and we were again so very pleased with our stay, the accommodations and the staff. When we arrived on Friday evening we were helped by a wonderful young man to check out and to our room. I wish that I could remember his name so as to give him the direct credit because he took care of us during our check out as well. Note to self to write these things down. Our room was fun with the animal prints. The bathrooms are beautiful. We called to the consierge and got a reservation for the B & O Brasserie downstairs. I had read some very good reviews of the eatery and was looking forward to eating there. Service and the food was very good. We got a South American malbec that I am still dreaming about. However, I was looking forward to the fish dishes that I had read about online. We found out that the menu I read was from the previous chef that had been gone a couple of times. Time to put the new menu/information up on the internet. The next day we wandered up to the Walters Museum. We spent most of the afternoon there and had to leave before we got to every area since they were closing. What an incredible collection. That evening we went to a cabaret at the Center Stage that is several blocks north. When we arrived back to our room there was a card with an earring that I had lost during the wine hour in the lobby. Marta, the front desk assistant had found it and brought it to my room and left the nicest note. That is service! She could have left it at the front desk and called to have us come down for it which I would have gladly done. There is a clean and well equipped gym on the third floor that we took advantage of each morning and the later check out time allowed our workouts to be thorough and for us to go to the B & O for the brunch and not lug our luggage in with us. It's been my very small experience that the employees of Kimpton find it a pleasure to help and not just a job.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCougars
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and experienced great service, especially at check in. The staff were helpful and very friendly. The kids loved the milk and cookie hour and the adults loved the wine hour! The rooms were clean and modern looking. The location was great- within walking distance to the aquarium, science museum, and art museum. Only drawback was the walls were thin and we were able to hear the crying baby next door.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Deanna_11
Reviews.Content: Great service, comfortable and luxurious room in a historic location. Loved the goldfish! Definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in beautiful historic building.”
Reviews.Author: TraceyPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stop-over in Baltimore and chose the Hotel Monaco. We love Kimpton properties so there was really no other choice for us. Loved it! Beautiful historic building – our room was a little on the small side but beautiful none the less. Bed was dreamy and the bathroom was surprisingly large. It’s a quick 5 – 10 minute walk to the Inner Harbor and we felt perfectly safe walking to and from. We had a nice dining experience at The Prime Rib which was a short cab ride from the hotel. Taxi service to and from BWI will run you about $35 each way. Check-in was a breeze although the front desk staff was not as friendly as we are accustomed to from Kimpton. Not sure what the deal was – chalked it up as a fluke encounter. We would definitely return to this hotel as well as recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “First Class everything!”
Reviews.Author: bcrook
Reviews.Content: What an amazing stay! The only thing that could have been better was if we had stayed more than one night! The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. We were upgraded to the Mediterrean Suite Room 910 and it was great! This was my husband's first time staying at a Kimpton Hotel (I'm constantly raving about them) and he is officially 100% impressed. Even more so that the bellhop had a glass of wine in our hands before we got to the Check-in counter. (I refrained from telling him about the daily wine hour *wink*) We couldn't have been more pleased! Do make sure you sign up for the free InTouch membership, as there are some nice perks that come with it.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate service”
Reviews.Author: Mizzreb
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is located in a beautiful vintage bank building. Everyone was friendly and accommadating from Campbell the bellman to Brian at the front desk. The room was lovely, comfortable and clean. The amenities were first class, from the Aveda bath products to the terry robes in the closet. We enjoyed the chocolate chip cookies with milk shots at 4pm and then at 5pm enjoyed a glass of wine before going out for dinner. The hotel is located in the business district but not too far from the Harborside tourist area. I would definately stay here again. p.s. wi fi is free if you are a member of the Kimpton program.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: kohl57
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at The Monaco and we came away saying to ourselves: Damn this is a great hotel. Now we need to say it to others (again), not that's it's really needed as the place was humming the weekend before Valentines Day. Any kinks experienced last year when this was all new and bit rough around the edges have been gratifyingly smoothed out and there was little that wasn't perfect. Great room, spotlessly clean and with delightful service. Extremely welcoming reception and the free wine reception every afternoon was generously and charmingly hosted. The B&O Brasserie breakfast is superb value even if our order was a mite mixed up. Only only complaint was that it was closed to the public the day of our arrival and we missed one of Baltimore's fav happy hour venues. We love the location, too, a perfect combination of Inner Harbor and Charles Street/Mt. Vernon. If this isn't Charm City's best hotel, I'd be astonished.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: rlm99
Reviews.Content: We snagged a good price on Priceline, so considered it prudent to contact the hotel to make sure we had what we wanted (no smoking, king bed). The response was above and beyond, confirming that the Priceline reservation was not exactly what we wanted, and giving an immediate upgrade. Upon arrival we were met with a gorgeous room, a complimentary gift basket, and more than what we would expect at every level. We don't have much prior experience with Kimpton hotels, but that is going to change if this is indicative.

Reviews.Title: “nothing could be better than that”
Reviews.Author: rsndu
Reviews.Content: We were there with 2 kids. Location of the hotel is few blocks from the Inner Harbor. Check in was easy. Staff was professional and tried their best to make our stay comfortable. Room was spacious and clean with flat screen TV, extra room space on another side which we did not use at all, mini fridge, and a complimentary gold fish which we requested. Linen was clean.
