And above all the entrance and decor of the hotel is breathtaking. I would stay their again and recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nifty Digs in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: adamunc
Reviews.Content: This is a great Kimpton property just a few blocks off the Inner Harbor and about 4 blocks from the Baltimore St. light rail stop, so it's easy to get around. It's a renovated historic building with a beautiful lobby and detailed architecture. Inside the lobby is the B&O Brasserie entrance. Check-in is on the second floor. There's an elevator and a staircase that would make Scarlett O'Hara green with envy. I was here on a holiday weekend for a night, so things were kind of slow. That was fine with me since I got into the room very early--and got the stand-by e-upgrade to a Mediterranean Suite. (If you aren't familiar with Kimpton's stand-by e-upgrade program, you should check it out. After you make your reservation, you'll receive an e-mail offering you the chance to stand-by for upgrades to higher-level rooms for lower rates. At check-in-, if the room is available, you get it. If not, you get your reserved room. I ended up with the suite for $149, only $40 more than the standard room I booked.) There's a pleasant parlor off the lobby (high ceilings) where the complimentary wine reception is held every evening. We had champagne at ours. Very nice. The Med Suites are the Mac Daddy. 800+ square feet with a large living room with comfy sofa and chair, table, and big flat screen. There were two big windows looking out over downtown Baltimore, which has some architectural gems in addition to the Monaco. (The Bank of America building is just down the street and is great to have for your view.) Around a corner is the bedroom, which had a curved wall so a 180-degree view. It's really just a comfy bed with two nightstands, but good lighting and a classy deco headboard. The electronics are good, with another flat-screen and an easy-to-use iPod dock. The bathroom was the crowning glory. Large and open, with separate shower and an amazing Jacuzzi tub for two. Absolutely huge--even a step up to get into it. Bathroom could have used a little more counter space, but otherwise perfect. You could even look out the window from the tub if you left the door open. All the Kimpton goodies are here, including the goldfish companion (I had two, so even my goldfish companion had a companion) and the $10 free mini-bar raid for InTouch members. The B&O restaurant was a little austere in decor, but the nibbles I had were great--the crab bisque and some awesome gruyere mac-and-cheese croquettes. It also has a creative and worthwhile cocktail and beer list. Not sure if B&O does the room service menu or not, but anyway it's capable if a little plain. I've checked out several hotels in Baltimore, and this is probably the best other than its being a little back from the Inner Harbor. Baltimore's not an especially great hotel town, but this is a spiffy place. If you want to check out something a little more formal, it's worth a stroll down to the Intercontinental Harbor Court and a stop at their Explorer's Lounge to sample the buffalo chili.

Reviews.Title: “Really Cool hotel with a huge bathtub.”
Reviews.Author: Cabinboy1
Reviews.Content: Impressively grand entrance in a historic building. In the center of everything. Walters Museum a short walk away along with some tasty resturants including a few IRISH PUBS with live music. The prices are right too. One nice thing about Hotel Baltimore is that its just far away (but walkable) from Inner harbor, but just far away that you are not surrounded by the business set hotels. The tubs in this Hotel are big and deep, and you do not need a pool in this Hotel. Service A= Free cocktail hour, Free Coffee. and you can have a goldfish delivered to stay with you for FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Familyof3PA
Reviews.Content: Was better than expected for our weekend family trip. I was worried because this hotel doesn't have a pool. Our 5 year old enjoyed the coloring book and toys in his goodie bag, the goldfish and the Wii. Also, the chocolate chip cookies and milk. He was happy, so we were happy. The king bed was really comfortable and the flat screen tv was nice. It was a little longer than I really wanted to walk to Inner Habor because of the cold at this time of year, but not too bad. Parking was a little confusing, but we parked in a nearby garage for $16/day, and left the car there all weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Restored Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustJudie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Hotel Monaco while in Baltimore. It is a beautifully restored building, at one time the main offices of B&O Railroad. They really knew how to build a work of art back then! The hotel is full of marble with a main staircase that is really lovely. The rooms were not large, but with very high ceilings, so did seem larger. Very nice granite counter bathroom, no tub, and the shower has a partial glass door that allows some water out, and is not our favorite design for a shower. But that was a minor thing. The bed was very comfortable and we liked the animal print bathrobes! Staff was always helpful and polite. The lobby area, or what they call the living room, is a very inviting area with comfy places to sit and a fireplace. Wine and appetizers are served late afternoon. Coffee & hot chocolate were available there during the day. We had dinner one night at the hotel restaurant, the B&O Brasserie. While on the pricey side, it really was excellent food. Great service too. They also had a nice happy hour there every day too. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: mcrog
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is fantastic. From the bellhops, architecture, furnishings, and all of the extra amenities, I was very impressed. I especially loved the wine tasting around the fire with the coziness of a family atmosphere including the well behaved dogs enjoying themselves. This is a unique and especially warm and caring environment. The only mishap was the bellhop in the early am. He was not on top of his job. Otherwise, everything and everyone was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem, a must experience”
Reviews.Author: traveltrek57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem in an urban city setting. Beautiful Old World Hotel with updated features. Only open a year it is modern, beautiful, and very comfortable. Truely a must stay type of place. We arrived after a horrible trip on I 95 and were catered too by the staff from the valet , to the bellman to the front desk check in. WoW!!! Only no is the on site resturant. Others surround the hotel, would strongly recommend them over the one attached to hotel. It was the only negative on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but check your bill”
Reviews.Author: md26225
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, well furnished and clean. The valet's and front desk staff were very helpful. This was a fantastic stay until we reviewed our credit card bill and found we had been charged an extra fee not associated with the room fee or the valet parking charge. We called the hotel and found the charge was for items used from the rooms mini-bar. We did not use the items and disputed the charge. This is a great place to stay if your going to the inner-harbor area but be sure to review your credit card statement for add-on charges.

Reviews.Title: “You Just Can't Do Better”
Reviews.Author: travelersK&W
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is an excellent choice when traveling to Baltimore. My wife & I stayed there and were thoroughly pleased. Every staff member is pleasant and professional. Rooms are large, clean and modern. The common areas of the hotel just can not be beat.. And they are pet friendly at no additional fee.. This is a safe bet for an enjoyable stay in the Baltimore area. By the way there are several nearby parking garages that can save a few dollars from the hotel rate.

Reviews.Title: “A-MAZ-ING!”
Reviews.Author: VA_Newlywed_0813
Reviews.Content: I was referred to this hotel by SniqueAway.com (pronounced Sneak Away) and was immediately struck by the beautiful pictures. I carefully read all the TripAdvisor reviews to be fully informed. Let me say that this hotel is beautiful! I planned this weekend as a date night/ getaway with my husband and all weekend all he could say is 'Wow!'. Upon checkin, you're offered a companion goldfish to name and care for. Pets are welcome as well and the hotel provides pet toys and food to welcome your critter. The decor is incredible -- the ceilings in the guest rooms must be about 12-14 feet high and the bathroom is well appointed with Aveda products. Basically, you can trust the pictures - the hotel is really just as beautiful as it seems. We didn't dine at the hotel restaurant (B&O) but we did go by to see it. It had a funny smell, kinda like cleaning supplies maybe. We chose to accept another TripAdvisor recommendation and eat at Vaccaro's up the road - another excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “On a cold, dreary week in Baltimore, I felt like I had a home.”
Reviews.Author: Dee461
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Kimpton hotels whenever I can, and this is one example of why. The airline lost my bag and promised to have it delivered overnight. Needless to say, the bag did not come and I was faced with the prospect of attending a business meeting in my travel clothes from the previous day. When I shared this with the housekeeper, she quietly left the room and came back with a bag of toiletries. I was hesitating going to my meeting, but the housekeeper told me that I would feel better after showering and that my blouse could be pressed and I would look just fine. She was right. I made the meeting and was able to get through the day thanks to her.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I gave this a second chance”
Reviews.Author: diehardphilliesfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last October when it had only been opened a couple of months and was not too impressed. It was definitely ironing out some kinks. But I wanted to go to Baltimore the Sat-Sun after Thanksgiving to visit someone and attend a concert and ended up with this hotel on Hotwire at a great price. I loved it this time around - I got the promised amenities in my bathroom, everything worked and the service was impeccable. Liked the continental breakfast coupons you receive now too. I ate in the restaurant and it was excellent although I did not care for their desserts much. It is truly a peaceful, elegant environment and I loved reading in the 'living room' having a cup of tea in the evening. Room was beautiful, immaculate and service outstanding. Great location. I am not sure why some people post as though the Inner Harbor was miles away - it is around a 5-10 minute walk just not on top of it which is fine with me. The Circulator is a fabulous addition for tourist - and it is free!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Cant be beat!”
Reviews.Author: legaltravelor
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel on the innerharbor. The rooms are spacious with high ceilings. Nice large king bed. Only complaint with the room was the desk was a little banged up. Service was very good. Appreciated the wine tastings. ONly complaint was that the bell hops could have been a little more helpful and offered to carry bags etc. Still a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - Ok location depending on your trip.”
Reviews.Author: savemyfish
Reviews.Content: Got this Hotel on priceline for 70/night. Worth paying the regular room rate! Very nice, clean, contemporary designed hotel. It's located in the central business district - both good and bad. Parking was a breeze - left around the corner there is an underground parking garage marked with a yellow "hotel parking" sign. 7.75/night on the weekend - well, in after 4 out before 9 AM. If not, it's 15.50. Still much better than the 43/night valet! It's close to both fells point and federal hill, but both are about a $10-$12 cab ride each way. Sign up for the rewards program. That gives you free wifi and $10 in mini bar credit! We got the free coffee every morning and also went down for "hot chocholate" hour. We missed the wine hour, but it sounded like a lot of fun. Definately try this place out next time you are staying in Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: travler2130
Reviews.Content: Xceptional service and friendliness. Rroms were beautiful and loved our pet foldfish.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our short stay”
Reviews.Author: blondedawn
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here and very much enjoyed it. The room was very spacious, and we liked the unique Kimpton decor. I got a kick out of the animal-print bathrobes. We slept very well - the bed was very comfortable, the window shades blocked out most light, and we could not hear any noise from the hallway or adjoining rooms. Toiletries were Aveda and smelled lovely. The only thing I wasn't a huge fan of was the shower -- instead of a curtain, it had a clear glass panel that only went halfway across. While this successfully kept the majority of water inside, it meant that I got goosebumps while showering because the colder air from the bathroom could get into the shower unimpeded. Front desk staff was excellent both upon check-in and check-out. We booked our room through Priceline (for a steal), and they made no mention of this nor did I feel we were treated any differently because of it. The hotel also has fun perks, like an evening wine hour (the zinfandel they were serving during our stay was very good) and the ability to have a goldfish delivered to your room (which we took advantage of, just because we could). Location is very good, as it is an easy 15 minute walk to the inner harbor area. The only major disappointment of our stay was the valet service. This hotel does not offer self-park, so you are forced to use the valets. However, when we first pulled up to hotel to check in, the valet was clearly understaffed, as there were 4 or 5 cars waiting for the valets to come take their keys. When we returned to the hotel after dinner, there was no line, but there was also no valet. We waited in the car 5 minutes before I finally got out of the car and went inside to see if I could find someone (the valet apparently came and got our car shortly after I left). Finally, when we checked out, we similarly had to wait several minutes before we located a valet. Given the very high price of valet parking ($36) and the fact guests are not given any other option, I was unimpressed.

Reviews.Title: “Little Perks throughout this Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nanci_Dru
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for a work meeting. The hotel is downtown within easy walking distance of the Inner Harbor. Still, it's a little sketchy, but I think that may be Baltimore. It's also very close to the light rail and metro. The hotel is in an old B&O railroad building that it also shares with some offices. You walk into a marble area and then go up to the lobby. The decor is modern, almost like a W, but perhaps a little more classical. There was a great "living room" area off the lobby that had coffee, tea, hot cocoa, and wine, depending on the time of day. It was also a comfortable area where you would actually want to sit. If you join their Kimpton InTouch rewards, which is free, you get free wifi that worked really well. You also get $10 in minibar snacks. The hotel had a small business center but it appeared to have nice computers. Valet parking was $36. The room was great and looked brand new. It was large, with a nice entryway, flatscreen TV and large windows. The bathroom was very trendy, with faux leather walls and a beautiful tile walk-in shower. There were robes, Aveda toiletries, and an umbrella for use. It was a very nice room. My only complaint was the temperature control. The hallways were like a sauna, and I simply could not get the thermostat regulated in the room, which resulted in poor sleep. The bed was relatively comfortable and had a nice duvet and pillows but was not as comfortable as other hotels. All in all, I would definitely stay here again. Also, the meeting facilities were very nice and the buffet lunch, while somewhat cold, was creative. I didn't eat in the restaurant but heard good things about it. The hotel is also very pet-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: ZuzuTraveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several hotels in Baltimore, but this is the best one we've visited. They have a beautiful lobby, and serve iced tea in the reception area. The room was huge, clean, and quiet. We also had a nice view of the city. The location is a mixed bag. Baltimore is a nice city, but you are subject to people asking for money and other assistance. We were never in any danger, but the city itself leaves a little to be desired. That said, the hotel itself is very nice, centrally located, and only a few blocks from Orioles Park and the Inner Harbor. It is also right near the bus line that runs to/from Fort McHenry. The service at the hotel was great, and our stay was wonderful. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: LiliCece100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 2 kids and 2 small dogs while my husband attended a continuing education course. The hotel is very grand and the marble stair case is something out of old europe. The walls are thick and therefore is a very quiet place to stay. The decor is very art deco and harkens back to grander times. Since this is a very pet-friendly property our pets were greeted by name, were provided with a nice bed, food and other niceties.There is a small dog park nearby but we did not enjoy that so we found other places for their walks. We were surprised by the warm cookies and milk in lobby at 4:00 p.m. each day along with hot coffee and tea in the mornings in the hotel "living room". A cozy beatifully decorated are with grand sofas, chairs and a cozy fireplace along with very modern, progressive music that was playing. The decor of the rooms was beautiful with what seemed to be 15 foot ceilings. We were on the 10th floor. The location is very convenient and is in the center of it all and just minutes walk to the harbor filled with restaurants, museums. You must check out the awesome Barnes & Noble at the harbor. All in all a great stay,

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IACityMich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for one week and loved it. It was centrally located, close to the conference center, close to the harbor, close to public transportation. We loved the daily wine and coffee bars it offered and enjoyed relaxing in their nice "living room." The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were nicely appointed. Additional features we liked are that they are pet friendly and even loaned companion fish for people who wanted them. Overall, the hotel was beautiful and we had a very nice stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Kid friendly yet elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathy5512
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the inner harbor in Maryland and had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Monaco. The employees were all very nice and helpful. Upon check in my 2 sons got to pick a prize from the treasure chest and were served cookies and milk as we waited. Once in our room we were surprised by room service delivering our complimentary pet goldfish (ours to keep for the stay) along with 2 toddler size animal print robes. My boys were over the top about the goldfish. The hotel was beautiful and the room was amazing. Very comfortable bed and pillows. We will be staying there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly comfortable -- appalling decor!”
Reviews.Author: paulwoe
Reviews.Content: kimpton hotels are trying hard to do it right in stylish fashion. This boutique hotel got its start as the HQ for the B&O Railroad, and some of the period details remain ... gorgeous marble stairs, wide, quiet hallways, etc. The decorators went crazy on the color scheme, but that does not take away from the fact that this is a very cozy place to stay. Rooms are not overly large, but baths are quite spacious. Service staff are friendly ... but the hotel oddly has no gift shop or newstand so if you dont grab one of the very few papers delivered on a weekend, it's a 3 block hike to the nearest shop that sells it. Similarly, they've a long list of "if you forgot it, we have it for you free", but twice in the weekend I saw other patrons asking about toothbrushes and razors (on the list) only to be told they could buy them from the mini-bar. Rooms are outfitted with flat screen tv, ipod dock; there is wi-fi but i found it a bit slow (not unusual in a building this age with walls as thick as these); register as a kimpton in touch member and the wi-fi is free, something other upscale hotels should emulate. Location is a few blocks up from the inner harbour and a few blocks south of the charles street dining district. Hotel has a car service contract offering mercedes sedans that for a flat fee of $10 take patrons to spots in town; the driver gave me his card to he could pick me up after i visited my mother who was recovering from heart surgery at nearby Johns Hopkins, as well as after my friend and Ihad done some Halloween carousing in Mount Vernon. Dont miss out on Lexington Market, a 1/2 mile walk west ... the best crab cakes in town ... and kudos to the dining room here B&O ... seasonal menu, relatively reasonable pricing, and pretty good food.

Reviews.Title: “For a frequent Kimpton guest, this hotel will be disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: lstaplin
Reviews.Content: After making a reservation at this downtown Baltimore hotel, I called back a day later to inquire about a room upgrade (not available) and during the call asked the desk staff to make a reservation at the hotel's restaurant (B&O Brasserie) for the night of our stay. When we arrived, there was no reservation, and we were seated at a noisy table at the bar instead of in the dining area upstairs. (On the plus side, the food and service in the restaurant were excellent.) When checking into our room, after 7:00 pm, we found that the housekeeping staff had left a key in our door, and it was obvious they hadn't finished cleaning/prepping the room. Later we discovered that the heating/AC vent blew directly onto the head of the bed; and as it is high up on a wall (at least 10 feet) it could not be adjusted. I had to keep the covers over my head all night even on low fan, because of the blast of air from this vent. Some hall carpets also were dingy and appeared unswept. Having enjoyed previous stays at Kimpton hotels in SF, DC, NYC and Philly, this one did not meet expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The most fabulous hotel, ever.”
Reviews.Author: NRLong
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the Hotel Monaco. I stayed there twice because my elderly mother has cancer and has been in Johns Hopkins Hospital. The reservation gentleman on the telephone told me he was sending a special gift to my room for me as a surprise. Then the complimentary car service picked me up in a sparkling black Mercedes with a delightful driver and whisked me to the hotel, where I was warmly greeted by the doorman, and escorted to the front desk. They upgraded me at no charge to a suite, I presume due to my dire circumstances, and a new gentleman, Leo, escorted me to my room, procured ice, new new gentleman brings gift from reservation man, it's a GOLDFISH! to keep me company. By now I'm crying. Everyone is all smiles, the room is a total palace. Amazing. Totally amazing. Room service, perfect, staff all knew my name, they called to see if I liked my room and my fish (!), bar and restaurant lovely and the ambiece is wonderful. Anything is procured by the touch of a button and I spent each evening in the GIANT bathtub, then a totally amazing shower. There are big bathrobes, great minibar, amazing sheets, whooshing air conditioning, perfect quiet. This is my idea of the perfect hotel. They fed my fish while I was at the hospital with my mother. They gave me a late checkout when I couldn't tell when I needed to leave. They all smile. Did I mention that I love this hotel? Both times I stayed here were excellent. Vouchers for free breakfast or cocktail. In the heart of bustling downtown, cool city views out the windows. High ceilings and windowsills two feet deep. I could live here happily. Thank you, Hotel Monaco, for all your care during my difficult time. It felt very personal.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great...except my refrigerator was broken and it didnt get fixed”
Reviews.Author: weloytty
Reviews.Content: I had a pleaseant and uneventful stay. The staff was courteous, the rooms were clean, spacious and well maintained. The only problem I had is that the minibar fridge was broken, so I had to drink warm diet coke when I wanted one of those 5.00 minibar diet cokes. I stayed 3 nights, and after both the first night and the second night, I informed the front desk that my refrigerator was broken. It never got fixed, and I never heard why.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great, staff was confused”
Reviews.Author: EAKTravels
Reviews.Content: We came here for a romantic getaway after Thanksgiving. The location was great, within walking distance of Inner Harbor,. The building was sparkling new, and the room was spacious, comfortable, and attractive. We enjoyed the complimentary wine on our first night. The only real complaint was the staff. Within a few minutes of us checking in, someone from the hotel knocked on our door and then opened it almost immediately without waiting for a response from us. It was intrusive and not necessary. Later, at checkout, they overcharged us for parking and seemed very confused about how to remove it from our bill. Could have been growing pains from a new staff at a new location, but they should have been better trained before the opening.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Stay”
Reviews.Author: moonbat
Reviews.Content: Since my usual Baltimore hotel was booked, I stayed here for the first time ever. It's rather pricey, though I recieved a significant discount through the discount agency I used. This is one of the few hotels that I have stayed at about which I cannot think of a single derogatory remark. As other reviewers have remarked, it is a boutique hotel in a restored historic building which used to be the B&O headquarters and has been lovingly restored. It's in a good location - about 15 minutes walk to the Inner Harbor and about that to the Mount Vernon historic district. The lobby is all marble and guilt old-fashioned splendor and the rooms are very large with tall ceilings. The rooms are tastefully decorated, with free wifi. The bathrooms are large and also marble. I can't say much about the view, as mine was a panoramic view of an adjacent wall 20 feet away. The hotel has an excellent restaurant with room service and plenty of nice restaurants within walking distance. My discounted price included a continental breakfast. It was nice, but included nothing special outside of the usual cold cereal, fruit and pastry offerings. As this is a Kimpton hotel there are plenty of extras such as in-room spa service (prices around $135) for message and aromatic wraps of which I did not avail myself. They have a milk and cookies hour in the afternoon and also a wine hour in the "living room" off the reception area. One of the weirder perks is that guests may request the services of a "companion goldfish" gratis. I asked the receptionist "Seriously? Like does anybody actually, you know, request one?" "Sure" he said "Lots of people!" So, whatever floats your boat ... One of the major plus points of this hotel is that they allow pets. Even big dogs, and go out of their way to welcome and accomodate them. I highly recommend this hotel if you are traveling with Rover or Tigger. As others have noted, the staff is exceptionally courteous and solicitous. I'm not sure that I would consider this hotel worth the price at their full price, but if you can get a discount on the room rate, I most highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a little more from a "4 start" hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Just_Nini
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco in Baltimore is a nice, trendy boutique hotel. It's located in the former headquarter of B&O railroad, only 10 min walk to Inner Harbor. The room is very nicely decorated and bathroom is very trendy and spacious. However, there were a few things that I had expected a bit more from a 4 start hotel: (1) Towels - expected nicer plush towels; (2) tissue and toilet paper were cheap and rough; (3) no coffee maker in room - have to call and ask for it (4) When we asked for a king size room, they said it'd cost us $40 more. Like I said, these are minor things in the grand scheme of things but Marriott Camden Yards down the street, which is considered a 3.5 star hotel, was overall a bit more comfortable and definitely more accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: i always breathe a bit deep when I go to Baltimore as I love the city but the hotels always underwhelm me. Stayed true to my favorite roots in DC , I was able to get the Kimpton Monaco and could not have been happier. Drove this time and parking was on the left on Charles Street right before you get to the hotel. Took the garage elevator and popped up right across the street from the Monaco. I arrived early but check in was graciously accepted. Very cool marble lobby , whereby, you take an elevator up to the check in and then a separate elevator to the rooms. Actually , very good security. Room was huge for the price, immaculate, elegant bathroom, great pillows, robe etc. and the stay was fantastic. Staff as always at the Kimptons is really helpful, I walked the three blocks to the Convention Center every day and I now have a new favorite in Baltimore for my once a year convention trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and dog friendly”
Reviews.Author: singbluesilver
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I wanted to get away for a night and didn.t want to go too far, Baltimore is a hour away so it was an easy drive. I found a great deal online for a room at the Klimpton, 99 bucks for a room with a hot tub and huge seperate shower with king size bed....on a saturday night no less..oh and free valet parking as well which runs like 30 dollars i believe the room was beautiful and huge with really high ceilings, which made it seem even bigger. Staff was super friendly, when we checked in they said we had been moved to a regular room due to over booking...when i made it clear we came there because we wanted a hot tub, a switch was made quickly with no fuss. if you friend the klimpton chain on facebook you get special code words to say at check in for treats, this time the summer promotion was the word popsicle, which netted us 4 free drink coupons, worth 40 bucks. they also have a hour with free cookies in the lobby and a free wine hour too, got some good sangria..... the hotel is super dog friendly, they even do a dog happy hour, we didnt have ours but i enjoyed petting all the various dogs i saw in passing. we also got a late checkout with no problems.... the hotel is a easy walk to the harbor with all its activities but we were with locals who knew the way, the cab ride home was 5 bucks and quick... i def think this place is worth a stay, esp if you get a good deal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smiles for Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Cabinboy1
Reviews.Content: Unlike anything like it in Baltimore. Feels, looks and smells like Las Vegas But without the price and attitude. Extra large bathtubs are fun to splash around for the kiddies or that significant other. Walters Art Museum just steps away and you cant beat the view. Try it you will like it. I have been there many times and they have never failed me.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff is polite but is so vague on cost of items”
Reviews.Author: LillianWalkerShelton
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on our wedding night. We were very excited to stay at this four star hotel, however the staff there was very vague on the cost of extra items. They charged us $5 for toothpaste and $ 5 for a toothbrush. They say that there was a list of prices for the mini bar and there was not. I think that this place is a rip off and you would do better staying at a Marriot. It is just a bunch of over inflated charges that they make once they have your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed, but the positives outweigh the negatives”
Reviews.Author: meprice82
Reviews.Content: Physically, this hotel is perfect. Beautiful, huge guest rooms with great views (the7th-14th floors of the building) and beautiful common spaces with marble stairs and tiffany windows. I walked into my room and said, 'woah.' I've lived in apartments smaller than the room I stayed in. The location is okay. Better for business travelers than leisure travelers. It's about a 10 minute walk to the Inner Harbor, but it's right downtown, so it's near the office buildings for meetings. It may be a little too close for comfort to East Baltimore Street for families, but the area around the hotel is pretty safe/decent for Baltimore. The service...eh. They're friendly, but a little inefficient. Their (expensive) valet system needs improvement, but they were pleasant enough and the desk staff worked with me to help resolve my problems. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat, especially for the rate I received.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at an historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: treefreak
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the monaco for a trade show. this hotel is a convenient walk to the convention center as well as the inner harbor. the monaco, itself, is an historic building dating back to the early 1900's with beautiful chandeliers, a pair of grand marble staircases, and classic stained glass windows in the lobby. the rooms were large with modern fixtures; a nice blend of the old and the new. service was friendly and efficient. they offered complimentary wine and sangria near the lobby in the early evening which we took advantage of. other services included a business room with free access to a computer and printer to book the return flights and boarding passes. we ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant which was exceptional.we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: FlyGuyToo
Reviews.Content: Great location near the inner harbor and within walking distance to many restaurants and attractions. A comfortable, quiet room.....but........ the staff failed to provide any level of personal attention that we experienced at the Hotel Monaco in Seattle in June 2009. Our experience in Seattle is why we chose this hotel in Baltimore and the results could not have been more disappointing. We were told our room would not be ready until at least 3PM, even though we advised that we would arrive at noon. We had tour reservations at 3PM, so when we complained, a room "suddenly" became available. Whats up with that??!! All digital channels on the TV were frequently pixelated with intermittent and choppy sound. There was no turn-down service or newspaper on the weekend??!! A very expensive property considering the lack of amenities that should be included, especially for Kimpton In-Touch Members. If the typical business hotel can provide a Continental breakfast for 90 bucks a night, then the Kimpton should certainly be able to provide one when paying 3 times as much. I was on business in Japan the week before we stayed at this hotel and I stayed at a 4 star hotel in the heart of Tokyo for less per night than what we paid for this property and this included a full breakfast buffet, daily newspapers, turn-down service and very personalized attention. Very disappointing!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: operamax
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel an historic property (once the headquarters of the B&O Railroad) with two magnificent lobbys, not only are the rooms spacious and nicely furnished, but the staff is extraordinary: friendly, helpful, anxious to do everything in their power to make your stay with them as pleasant as possible. This includes going the extra mile, where necessary. The concierge had recommended and made reservations for us at a restaurant a short cab ride away. We were not sure whether we would want to visit a jazz club after dinner, depending on how tired we were. So, the concierge gave us her cell phone number; if we wanted to go to the jazz club, we were to call her from the restaurant and she would make the arrangements for us. The restaurant provided a shuttle service via a driver who was supposed to take us back and forth from the hotel. The concierge also contacted the driver to tell him to take us to the jazz club, rather than back to the hotel. That kind of service is truly extraordinary. In addition, the restaurant in the hotel (actually on the ground floor of the building housing the hotel) is an award winning restaurant with truly excellent food and, yes, great service. The hotel is a few blocks away from the inner harbor

Reviews.Title: “Good find”
Reviews.Author: smklaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. My spouse and I were leaving from BWI early the next morning and decided to spend the night in Baltimore so as not to have to get up too early to make our flight. We had such fun walking around the Inner Harbor with its street performers, shopping and wonderful restaurants. The hotel was immaculate and the staff was so helpful and open to suggestions. I must give a specific acknowledgment to housekeeping who keeps the entire hotel spotless. This hotel was the old railroad station, and the original staircases, marble etc. have been maintained in pristine condition. We were greeted with a wine and cheese reception in the lobby which has a beautiful double-sided fireplace as its centerpiece. We called the concierge a few times during our one-night stay and always received a willing, knowledgeable, professional response. The fitness center was well-equipped and open 24 hours. The spacious bathroom with oversized tile and marble shower was also a nice treat. The Monaco was in a convenient location (close to the airport, Little Italy and Inner Harbor). We would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, pet-friendly, comfortable oasis in the heart of Charm City”
Reviews.Author: PJDF
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in town for a miniature vacation around a family wedding. We chose Hotel Monaco because it is pet friendly, in a convenient location, and we heard it was chic (which we aren't, but it's fun to pretend). It was a fabulous choice. Our pets were truly welcomed. The front desk even sent bowls to our room when we realized we had not packed them. The room was spotlessly clean, quiet, spacious, furnished nicely, and the bed was delightfully comfortable. And it is certainly chic, even though it is housed in an gem of a restored early 19th century landmark, with stained glass, marble railings, statuary, and all the other opulent features of a Beaux Arts building. The bathroom is 21st century opulence; spacious, with a rainfall showerhead, beautiful tile shower, and fine appointments. Best of all, the staff are friendly to a one, and efficient. The next time we travel to Baltimore we will certainly stay at the Monaco, and when we next travel to a city with a Kimpton Hotel, it will be our first choice there too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Wally002
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay at the Hotel Monaco during August of 2010. We chose the Monaco because it was a Kimpton hotel and we had stayed at the Morrison House in Alexandria, Virginia which was also a Kimpton hotel. We found it very nice and the staff was very enthusiastic. I gave a four star on sleep quality because both my wife and I thought the bed was a bit soft. I know not everyone likes a firm bed, so others may not have any problem. Overall it was a cut above and we would definitely stay there again. We are planning a trip to Niagra Falls and I already checked for a Kimpton there, but unfortunately there isn't one.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, location o.k.”
Reviews.Author: mets8617
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is a beautiful hotel, the priceline rate helped too! The rooms were clean, hotel staff was very good,extra towels and a goldfish delivered within 10 minutes from the time we asked for them. Very comfortable beds and pillow. Short walk about 5 minutes, 5 blocks to the Inner Harbor. Park the car youself around the corner it was $33 for 2 days as opposed to the $36 a day valet fee. The only thing I did not like was that the surrounding downtown area is not well populated at night unless you count the homeless people. Would recommend at a discounted rate, only because the other 4* hotels seem to be in the inner harbor and a better area of town if you are there for tourism.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONALLY wonderful place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: peace5413
Reviews.Content: This hotel was magnificent in decor, , clean and very accommodating. Everyone from the managers to the bellhops were very professional and courteous. They made your stay so impressionable you could stay forever. Hotel staff were very knowledgeable in recommendations on places to dine and nightlife. Of course after dining in the hotel and enjoying the ambience you may not want to venture out. My experience at this hotel has certainly made a difference on where my next stay will be and I will certainly recommend this hotel to others. Thanks everyone at the Monaco for making the hotel a wonderful and pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Chance600
Reviews.Content: There is nothing bad to say about this hotel. The room was clean and the decor was pleasing. The hotel itself is stunning. The lobby area is breathtaking. All staff encountered were very kind, very professional, very helpful. Although I was there for business my husband and my two shelties went with me. The hotel and staff truly are pet friendly. Our dogs, aka babies were treated just as well as we were treated. I'll never stay anywhere else when I am in Baltimore. I am not associated with the hotel in anyway and I rarely write reviews, but I feel that strongly about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore's Best”
Reviews.Author: kohl57
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Monaco for two nights for Orioles baseball and this place really hit a home run for us. Friendly reception, great room with fantastic high ceilings, nice city view of Charles Center and beautifully decorated (more toned down and traditionally elegant than some other Kimptons) with a sinfully comfortable bed and linens and a great bathroom with tub bath. We liked the elegant lounge and the usual Kempton goodies of free coffee/tea in the am and lemonade in the afternoon but missed the wine reception. The hotel incorporates the magificent original marble and Tiffany Glass lobby of the old B&O headquarters and the entire physical plant is most impressive and beautifully done. A few niggling complaints: lighting in the bathroom was unreliable with the mirror light never functioning and that over the bathtub shower on and off indicating some wiring issues. Our room wasn't made up as late as 3.30 pm. Finally, there is an extraordinary typo in the room service menu indicating that room service surcharge, tips and taxes are "inclusive" when they meant, of course, "exclusive". We brought these matters to the attention of the Front Desk and promised they would be rectified and we were very graciously and generously given a discount off our bill. The best for last: the B&O Brasserie Restaurant. Just fantastic food (we had a delicious three-course dinner as part of Restaurant Week that was superb and a real value), great happy hour, reasonable and excellent breakfasts and the staff here is just wonderful. We've found a new Charm City hang-out in this place and highly recommended even if you aren't staying at the hotel. We really look forward to returning to the Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful & pet friendly hotel but staff unfriendly/uninformed”
Reviews.Author: urban-anthro
Reviews.Content: The Monaco is a beautiful hotel, and very welcoming to our two Golden Retrievers. The room was clean and spacious, but the air conditioning or ventilation which clicked on every few minutes was extremely loud, like a plane taking off . This was a minor inconvenience. My real concern was the lack of competence and attitude of the staff. I felt like this was a hotel opened for a few weeks rather then a year. The front desk manager was unfriendly when I called down for my car, and he subsequently never called the valet with my request. Room service was out of what we wanted to order. The person who delivered it could not answer questions about our bill. The movie we ordered kept freezing. A technician was sent up who assured us that it would be taken off of our bill-it wasnt. When I checked out and questioned other items on my bill the person at the desk could not explain what charges were, or was mistaken telling me a $10 charge was for internet (which is free ) etc etc. Nothing major, but overall vibe was of inconsistant service. I am not familiar with other hotel choices in Baltimore as to whether I would stay again. The physical plant is lovely, and I appreciate that my dogs were welcomed with open arms. Certainly the least impressive Kimpton Property I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dana1119
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through Priceline, we were a little skeptical, but it was great. We didn't have the room we needed the first night (apparently there are always conventions in Baltimore), so they gave us an air mattress for our son and moved us the next day. Beds were very comfortable and the rooms nice. Very accomodating. We were on the top floor and rarely saw anyone, almost like we had the whole floor to ourself. Hotel is beautiful on the inside and the rooms were very nice. My son got a companion goldfish for our stay there. We were told there was 24 hour Wii stations and cookies in the evening for kids. We were gone all day, so the Wii didn't help us any. Parking was pricey - $36/day, but we expected that. Had a mini-bar, but they let us keep our sodas in there. All in all, it was a nice place to stay. Oh, and the funniest part, they allow dogs and cats. They even had food bowls for them at the door and has a sign welcoming the animals by name!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: sunvib
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel by hotwire, and hotwire should be busted for putting it as a 4 star hotel..They did not even mention that it was a boutique hotel and was very old dating back to 1800.It was headquarters to railroad company.. First of all let me start with the good, which is their staff..Starting with the hotel manager to all who worked their were extremely cordial and courteous ready to help you in all possible way.. The hotel other wise when you enter you have elevators on two sides.One half takes you to the hotel and the other takes you to the offices..The place has got some very peculiar stench which is very strong as some of a paint or stale carpet or something.. We could never figure out how to use the phone for the housekeeping and hence landed personally at the reception if we wanted extra towels or something..Also the housekeeping was not there in the night only we could see them in the mornings.. Thogh they say that it is 4 blocks from the inner harbor,please do not do so if you have small children..Take a cab.. Next time we will take hotels that are near the harbor such as the intercontinental, hyatt etc.. Oh yes the business center was not free..the charge you per hour to use it..

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for your Charm City stay.”
Reviews.Author: Burydrive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I would recommend the Hotel Monaco and we will not hesitate to stay there the next time we spend time in Baltimore. Overall, we think that - based upon hotel character, overall cost, hotel staff, room size & cleanliness, and location - it would be a challenge to find a better hotel in Baltimore. When choosing a hotel, my wife and I tend to select 4 & 5 star hotels that are historic, posses traditionally decorated common areas (late 19th or early 20th century), and are located within the center of the city and/or center of the city's historic district. Hotel Monaco fell into this category quite well. In addition to being located within Baltimore, the hotel was clean, quiet, and well decorated. The location of the hotel allowed us to walk to the Inner Harbor (10 minutes), Little Italy (20 minutes), and Fells Point (30 minutes). We generally do not use hotel amenities such as the pool or work out facilities so we are not sure if these amenities exist or meet typical standards. The Hotel Monaco appears to be very pet friendly as we saw dogs frequently in the hallways and common areas. Checking in was easy (reception is on the second floor of the hotel). We reserved a 'King Deluxe' Room and upon check-in were assigned room 805. Our room was not completely ready for us when we arrived so we headed straight to the hotel bar for a well earned drink while we waited for the room to be completed (the pleasant gentlemen at the reception desk gave us several free drink vouchers that we gladly redeemed for a few afternoon refreshments). It wasn't long before we made our way up to our room. The room was big (375 square feet according to the hotel website) with high ceilings and provided great natural lighting. Overall, the room and bathroom were clean with modern decorations. Both the large king bed and the accompanying bedding were very comfortable. The room provided a city view that faced towards the Inner Harbor. We couldn't see the water due to the surrounding buildings, but the lack of a tall building next to the hotel gave us the benefit of natural light. There was only one very small drawback to the room - the air conditioning. The A/C unit was a bit loud and turned on and off constantly all night long (presumably due to the 100 degree July heat). Not a big deal for us - but it could be if you are a very light sleeper. Our trip to Baltimore was meant as a night away from home so we were not interested in exploring the typical tourist attractions. Our goal was to take relaxing walks through the city and along the waterfront to observe the culture and the architecture. If you are interested in exploring the city then Fells Point, the Inner Harbor, Little Italy, Sports Venues (M & T Bank Stadium and Camden Yards), the Aquarium, and Fort McHenry are within easy reach (either a relatively short walk or via the Water Taxi system). As for food – there are a lot of good restaurants in the city that the concierge can point out. We highly recommend a snack or meal in the Hotel Restaurant, the B & O American Brasserie. Arriving: We were travelling to Baltimore from the Washington DC area so we had several travel options available to us (drive, bus, cab, train, etc). We decided to take the 45 minute train ride (on Amtrak) from Washington's Union Station to Baltimore's Pennsylvania Station (i.e., Penn Station). For us it was a convenient choice. As an added incentive, the hotel was offering a 'Ride the Rails' package that entitled us to a 15% room rate discount if we took the train - simply book this package and show your train ticket at check-in to qualify for the special rate. Once we arrived at Penn Station we had the choice of taking either a 5 minute cab ride or a 45 minute walk to the hotel. Arriving in Baltimore on a hot and humid July day we made the obvious choice - we walked! As it turns out, this was not that bad of a choice for us. The walk was straight forward and downhill (exit the station, turn left, make your first right onto St. Paul street, walk 1.5 miles, turn right onto East Fayette Street, first left onto North Charles Street and you have arrived at the hotel). As an added bonus, the walk allowed us to see the terrific exterior details of some traditional Baltimore buildings. Departing: We checked out of the room at noon and left our bags at the reception desk for a couple of hours so that we could finish exploring the city. Upon returning to the hotel later in the afternoon, we picked up our bags (the doorman brought them from the second floor reception area to the front door) and grabbed a taxi to the Penn Station (having walked around the city for two days we decided that a cab to the train station was the right choice!). The taxi was new (an unmarked black sedan) and the 5 minute ride cost us $10. The driver (Moneeb) was friendly and we would recommend calling him if you need a car (410-926-4366). Enjoy your trip to Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel on Business”
Reviews.Author: FTLAW
Reviews.Content: I had business just a block away from this hotel, so I decided to give it a try. The building contains offices as well, so you take separate hotel elevators from the entrance floor to the lobby. The lobby is elegant and tasteful. You need your room key to go to any hotel floors above lobby level, which is a good thing in Baltimore. My room had a very high ceiling and a very nice bathroom with a stand up, glass walled shower and Aveda bath products. It was a spacious room with a nice flat screen TV. The bed was supposed to be a king, and maybe it was, but it was small in length and my 6' 2" frame hung over it. Not sure it was the bed, but I did not sleep well for some reason. It happens. For Kimpton members, there was free internet access, of course, and also $10 for use at the in-room minibar. The gym was nice with a decent selection of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Dog owner rejoice..”
Reviews.Author: Kittyangel2
Reviews.Content: Finally a hotel that is very dog friendly and have a dedicated dog floor that is just as tastefully decorated and comfortable as Thierry non dog rooms! We are impressed with the absolutely beautiful carpet, wall fixtures, furniture(I want to buy some for my house if they ever sell them). The lobby has very nice and comfy sofas with tv and fire place. The room itself has high ceiling and very big and fancy bathroom with interesting tiles etc. Our dog liked the room a lot and the staff also loved having her. They put a list of all dogs staying on a whiteboard in front of hotel to welcome them, I thought that was cute. We paid half the price normally would charge so it was a great value. I would stay there over Hilton or Marriott any day. Will try Thierry other location if a good package price come up. Thierry website has some like free parking or breakfast etc. Oh they did not charge separate dog fee either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near Inner Harbour”
Reviews.Author: jillv1701h
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few months ago in the King Premier room and everything was absolutely fantastic. The hotel has a terrific architectual design as it used to be an old railraod building (much more exciting than it sounds). There are these gorgeous marble stairways which provide a terrific picture op in the lobby area. The staff was wonderful and of typical Kimpton quality. We didn't get a chance to dine at the restaurant but the Kimpton Wine Hour was great, albeit crowded. Our room was very spacious and had a two person soaking tub which made the stay more memorable. Location wise, the hotel is essentially right between the Mt. Vernon area and the Inner Harbour so you can't go wrong either way. We got a little confused with some of the service elevators as they're right next to the regular ones so we would've appreaciated better signage but this was pretty minor. Love to return again and would recommend to anyone visiting Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “I could live there !”
Reviews.Author: BethTulsa_OK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel....my only somewhat minor complaint is that I didn't have a tub; I realize there are rooms with "soaking" tubs, but there are also rooms that have tub/shower combos. I am on my feet all day at conventions and love to come back and just soak for awhile..... That said, the room was great; quiet floor, comfortable bed etc. Room service was tasty and ordered more than once. The Asst GM was an absolute gentleman; helpful without being cloying etc......over all a great experience....Can't wait to come back again !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Building - Something Missing”
Reviews.Author: PECurls
Reviews.Content: You are first surprised that the lobby is not on the ground floor but one flight up, and then see the grandeur of the building. Wow! The staff could not have been nicer and offered complimentary lemonade and iced tea while I waited in the 'Living Room' for my room to be ready. The room was enormous and beautifully appointed but all of the furnishings were basically on one side. Odd. When I opened the desk drawer I found that a prior guest had dripped ice cream sundae or something and it was still in the drawer and on the front of the drawer. I cleaned it up. Ick! Other than that, and the mold or mildew spots on the inside of the shower curtain, the room was spotless. I think the best thing(s) about the hotel are the amenities - Aforementioned lemonade and iced tea to cool off on this very hot weekend; Complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby in the morning; Afternoon tea and the very popular Managers Wine Reception each evening at 5. Combined with how helpful and pleasant I found the staff to be (and the discounted rate I got on Hotwire) these niceties help one overlook the charge to use the business center high speed computer, the bad neighborhood (don't expect too much else in Bal'mer) and the fact that the hallway and elevator carpets may need replacing soon and a pool would have been a nice respite. I would recommend this place to someone else but I'm not sure that I'll be back any time soon. Maybe botique hotels are not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nikvic2
Reviews.Content: I didn't think that i was going to like this hotel being that i never heard of it , but i can tell u , i will stay there again it was wonderful u don't even have to leave the hotel if u don't want to, every thing is rt there for u the staff helpful the rooms are cozy my husband and my self highly recommend this place .

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: tash2010
Reviews.Content: Me and my significate other stayed here for the weekend and it was a wonderful stay. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are spacious, clean, beautifully decorated and has one of the most beautiful bathrooms I've ever saw in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great pet policy!”
Reviews.Author: ochibell
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a quick getaway over the fourth of July weekend, and the prospect of a Kimpton Hotel for reasonable price (~$150) THAT ALLOWED DOGS sealed the deal for us. We weren't disappointed. The hotel was in a beautiful restored building (former home of the B&O Railway). The location was not quite central (it was in what felt like a business district, which at night and on the weekend felt a little deserted). However, the hotel itself was very nice and we enjoyed our stay. It was an easy walk to the harbor. Rooms were large - we had a double room, which worked out fine for four people (2 adults, a 13 and 16 year old). I had noted on my reservation that we would be bringing our dog (no extra charge), and when we arrived, there was even a small dog bed and dog dish of food/water for our pet! Staff was friendly. Room was very clean and comfortable. Only complaint was that we were awakened in the night by loud talkers next door - so maybe the soundproofing isn't as great as one would expect in an old building. But other than that, we had a great stay. One note: parking at the hotel is $36. However, after 5 or so on the weekend, street parking is free, and seemed abundant (check the parking ticket machines on the street - it seems different parts of town have different regulations and hours). So for our Saturday overnight stay, we just parked on the street right down the block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience--Will try somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: wdtravel
Reviews.Content: First the good: -The rooms are spacious and have very high ceilings which make them seem even more so -Our bathroom was incredible. We had a giant two person tub with seats and a separate shower. -The water pressure is great -Staff is very friendly Now the bad: -We checked in in the evening, turned down the thermostat, and went to bed. Tossed and turned all night from being too hot. In the morning found out why--the room was 74 when it was set for 65. We had to be moved to a different room. If I have the inconvenience of having to pack up all my things and move down to a lower floor (in a nice, 4 star hotel), I'd like to be compensated in some day-- a breakfast voucher, have a day of parking taken off, something. We got nothing. -The first morning we went to the front desk to get our car. They said to go downstairs and it would be ready in 10 mins. We waited 15 then asked the valet. He said they hadn't gotten the request and we had to wait another 10 mins to get the car. -The hotel isn't really condusive to walking to the harbor, especially in July heat. We had to drive everywhere we went. -We booked through a third party. I printed out the paperwork before we left in case there was a problem at check-in. After we got to the room I read the fine print and a free breakfast was included in our reservation. We were never told this at check-in. Had I not brought the paperwork, read the fine print, and asked the front desk we wouldn't have received our breakfast. I really am wowed by all the positive reviews on this site. I don't consider myself a picky traveler and was not impressed by this hotel. Had I been staying at an inexpensive chain, I would be satisfied. But considering this is a 4 star hotel I was disappointed and would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bath Robes!”
Reviews.Author: WnnaBTrvlWrtr
Reviews.Content: The Monaco Hotels have always been pretty high on my list -- I've always liked the chic design, the goldfish, and the Aveda toiletries -- but the addition of zebra and leopard print bathrobes has sealed the deal! Our room was a little small but we didn't mind because we were only there for a quick overnight. We did appreciate the large walk-in shower and the fluffy towels. Best of all, though were the robes. So fun!! We enjoyed a glass of sangria at the wine reception before heading out for the evening but were disappointed when we returned that the B&O Restaurant had stopped serving food (including dessert) at 9 pm. When it came time to check out, we had an extremely helpful desk clerk, Christine, who looked up a parking coupon on the internet and offered to print our boarding passes. It was a short stay, but one we look forward to repeating.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't recommend it more”
Reviews.Author: flyingbutterwings
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in this hotel last October. My only regret about the entire stay is thy it's taken us this long to write a review. Truly enjoyed the experience, large rooms, amazing staff, originally and uniquely decorated rooms. Complimentary wine reception and milk and cookies were the icing on the cake! Very impressed and would love to return. Many thanks for an amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice! Very warm, comfortable hotel with very good amenities”
Reviews.Author: Unbiased&FairAdvisor
Reviews.Content: A very good, clean, comfortable hotel with very nice staff. Comfortable room with some wonderful amenities offered throughout the day. The hotel is very convenient, within walking-blocks from the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. It does however feel a little isolated/deserted, given it is amongst what seems to be office buildings ... but just not many people on the streets, day or night, and there are some 'homeless'/street people in the area. We had no problems however, with its location. The hotel, oddly, is in a converted office building (?), sharing the building with offices. Upon entering the hotel, you are greeted to a classic, marble lobby for the building and then a sign ... pointing to use the left elevators for the hotel and the right elevators for the offices. You must go to the hotel's "lobby" (next level up), to register. Not a biggie, but seemed odd .... Let's move on to our review: Room & Amenities: Very nice room, with king size bed, lacquer-red credenza/desk, chair, LCD TV, along with in-room safe inside the closet that included (2) 'stylish' (think tiger stripes!) bathrobes and an umbrella. These are nice touches to details! Some other hotels have only 1 robe-always white or no umbrella ! The bed was super comfortable, not too firm, not too soft. The bathroom was very spacious, with walk-in shower (no tub). We asked one of the cleaning people to just see another room as a comparison, and that one was larger with tub and a couch too ! We probably got a smaller room, given we went the Priceline route (on the cheap!) Back to the room: high ceilings, eclectic colors including red credenza/desk, gold wall paper, blue fabric headboard panels, trunk-style nightstands, paisley rolling curtains, but all of it was very tasteful and worked fine. We wish the curtains had more blackout-coverage, as we awoke to streams of sunlight (through the sides) each morning, but thankfully not hungover which would have made it worse. A mini-bar and chargeable snacks were available, along with a list in the bathroom, of beyond-the-basic toiletries available, optional items you may have forgotten - some free, some not, but again nice touch! Now on to the amenities, which we really enjoyed: in their "Living Room" ... a sitting area near the front desk, had an eclectic collection of chairs, couches, and sofas for guests, with a pseudo-fireplace, the hotel provided some tasty treats throughout the day. In the morning, coffee, tea, etc (not full breakfast), early afternoon = cold lemonade and cold tea, mid afternoon = fresh chocolate chip cookies and milk, evenings = wine tasting..... again, nice touches ! There is a gym/fitness center that was nice. We did not try the hotel's restaurant, B&O American bistro ... menu seemed ok, but pricey like all hotel restaurants. We had one pet peeve ... the business center that provided (2) computers with a printer was chargeable. Presumably, as Kimpton loyalty members, we wouldn't be charged, but we weren't going to bother using the ones there, as it requested a credit card. Instead, we accessed the internet free-of-charge in our room. Service: Very nice staff. Front desk was friendly. We did not request in-room dining, so cannot comment. Cleaning people were super nice (especially the one who allowed us to see another room to compare), and friendly. The room was always perfect when we returned, clean and with no issues. Doormen: minimal greeting and acknowledgment, probably because we didn't need them, but we're ok with that. Summary: A very good, clean, comfortable hotel with pleasant staff ... and most fetching, the drinks and treats throughout the day. As we noted above, there were nice detail touches we noticed throughout our stay there. It is very convenient to the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards, as well as public transportation options. Useful Tip: Getting around: use the "Charm City Circulator" bus = FREE of charge for (2) lines: Purple and Orange. Happy Hotel-ling !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at one time, Employees need to learn about customer service”
Reviews.Author: ewcooke
Reviews.Content: The lobby area was worn and looked like it had seen better days. Employees at the hotel appeared to not notice you were there. We saw what looked like was blood on a staircase and mentioned it to an employee (8 hours latter it was still there) I booked this hotel through priceline and was extremely excited by the reviews and then upon getting there noticed that many of the bad comments that I thought were over statements or picky people were completely true. The location is great the concierge was knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Trinman80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monaco for two nights while visiting friends in Baltimore. Service was friendly, room service was good, Internet decently fast, bed comfortable, bathroom large and clean. Decent gym with good equipment, which I used twice. Tip on the Internet: if you sign up for their loyalty programme (which is free), you get free Internet. Only complaint is, when I ordered a cab, they put me into an unmarked, unmetered limo - it turned out OK, and I wasn't gouged, but I felt a little uncomfortable with this. Also, the desk in my room could have been a little bigger as a workspace. I wouldn't object to staying here again, but might give the Intercontinental a try next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “upscale Kimpton!”
Reviews.Author: erdocmdca
Reviews.Content: I had a business dinner on a weeknight, and anticipated martinis after, so I did an overnight staycation rather than drive home out to the 'burbs. I usually stay at Henderson's Wharf Inn, which is one of my favorite hotels; I love Kimptons and have been looking for a reason to check out the Hotel Monaco, which just opened last year. I had reservations, since I generally don't like hotels in older structures. This one is wonderful! The rooms and hallways are very fresh, interesting, and beautifully appointed. Lots of outlets in convenient places (I usually hate the old, painted over, and limited outlets in older hotels); high ceilings, but appropriately scaled -- I don't like the proportions of the rooms at the Hotel Monaco in DC -- it feels very retrofitted. Bathroom fixtures are brushed nickel and high quality. Very comfortable bed with white high thread-count sheets and douvet. I got the "summer" package -- for an extra $10 above the base rate, I got $25 credit in the bistro downstairs (nice lunch), $10 credit to "raid the mini-bar"; free valet parking ($36/day for guests); and one free movie per day. The lobby is typically Kimpton -- interesting, comfortable, and a little quirky. The entrance is a little off-putting -- HUGE marble entry that doubles as the entrance to a large business-oriented old-bank-style building. The lobby of the hotel is actually on the second floor in a much more manageable space. Overall, much more than I expected. I will be looking for an excuse to stay over in the city again and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, MINOR complaints.”
Reviews.Author: NickW724
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and had a weekend break in Baltimore, and picked this hotel based on pics of the rooms. We were not disapointed! The hotel is beautiful! It is located on most, but not all, of the floors of the old B&O Railroad building. The first impression came from the friendly doorman, and the stunning lobby. We took the elevator instead of the beautiful staircase to checkin, and we soon in our room. When I booked the room I booked a King Spa Room, but at checkin we were given a Mediterranean Suite. The room was gorgeous, with a nice living room with big LG tv, couch, chair, and closet with a safe. The hotel offers 'companion goldfish' but ours was dead (we named him Bob). We called down and another (Al) was up within minutes. The king bed was very comfortable, but the highlight of the suite was the bathroom. It was in the corner of the building, and had and angled wall for some architectural interest, and an incredible, deep spa tub. Overall the room was incredible, with only two small complaints, both identical to the next review on the list...our iron leaked water and the AC struggles to keep the room cool. To sleep comfortably we had to turn the thermostat down to 65. I was till warm, but my girlfriend was comfortable, and she likes being warm, normally keeping her thermostat at about 72. As far as the rest of the hotel, every single staff member we encountered was warm and friendly, everyone at checkin, the bartender Eric, the guy bringing a new goldfish, the girl bringing breakfast, the housekeeper, the door staff, the concierge, even random employees in the elevator were all very friendly, and even funny. Great as the room was, the staff were even better. We enjoyed a few glasses of wine at the evening wine reception, and noticed that when a couple showed up for the reception with a kid around 10-12 years old a staff member quickly brought out controllers and games for the Wii in the reception lounge. We ate in the restaurant one night, and it was good...not superb, but we only had a burger and fish and chips. It wasn't cheap, but not outrageous either. Over two nights we had two great bottles of wine, both based on the recommendations of Eric at the bar. Nice guy, and a great bartender! We had room service breakfast both days, the first morning we had the B&O Breakfast, which was eggs, bacon/sausage/ham and potatoes with toast and coffee...we both thought there was something odd about the eggs...both taste and texture just werent right...but the rest was good...but it wasnt cheap. The next day we got two continental breakfasts-danish, croissant, and muffin along with some great fruit, a huge glass of fresh juice and coffee. It was good, and really a much better value. Several other reviews mention location as a downside of this hotel, and if you are looking for a harbor view it's not for you. I also wouldnt venture too far on foot at night, but the same can be said for a lot of downtown areas. However, in daylight the walk to the harbor is not far, and feels perfectly safe. At night, I'd say take a cab. We ate dinner at a great local seafood place on the water, The Rusty Scupper, and they offer a free shuttle that picks up at the hotel. Guest services were happy to make reservations and arrange the shuttle for us. If all you want in Baltimore is a harbor view move on from the Hotel Monaco, but if you dont mind a short walk or cab ride and want a gorgeous hotel with character and an incredible staff, try this one instead. It's worth it, just don't expect ice cold AC and a good iron. But do get the fish. It's kinda cool.

Reviews.Title: “everything just right”
Reviews.Author: cheese-arific
Reviews.Content: A great location just a couple blocks from the convention center. The lobby is beautiful marble on the historic register. staff is friendly and helpful. rooms are a good size with nice amenities. aveda bath products. all in all, a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly beautiful hotel, terrible location!”
Reviews.Author: Steve25054
Reviews.Content: This Hotel Monaco in Baltimore is a beautiful place, with everything you could want in a hotel. Beautiful rooms, great staff, nice restaurant downstairs. Unfortunately it is in a terrible location. We were there on a Sunday and the street in front of the hotel was full of transients, making it impossible to go out at all. If you're there for business only and can deal with being accosted by panhandlers, then you're probably ok. Also, Mercy Hospital is a couple of blocks down the street and even 8 floors up, you can hear emergency vehicles on their way to the hospital. It's too bad, because this is a great hotel but we probably won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Class Act”
Reviews.Author: MayHee
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at this hotel. It was so incredibly clean, the staff was the nicest, most polite group of people, and our room was 5 star quality. When we arrived early Saturday morning, the doorman couldn't have been nicer. He assisted us with our luggage and gave good recommendations for breakfast. We attended the wine hour, and the wine was fantastic. One of the best parts about this is that nobody was trying to sell you anything or bother you in any way. The message was simple - come to our wine hour to enjoy all of the (great!) wine that you'd like, and make use of our lux lobby. It was so relaxing and such a nice bonus. They also had a milk and cookie hour that we didn't attend, but thought the idea was adorable. (Also, loved the fact that they had a Wii in their hotel lobby too.. would have never expected it!) The room was so clean, that I would believe it if we were the first 2 poeple to stay in it. I'm not sure if all of the rooms have a soaking tub, but try to book one that does. It was SO nice. The room was huge with tall ceilings and decorated to the 9s. My only very very slight complaint is that our AC turned off while we were sleeping (i think that it's motion sensored) and it got a little warm. Simple enough to get up and restart it though. The comfort of the bed made up for it. When we walked in there was a sign welcoming a canine guest of the hotel, along with a bowl of treats and water, and directions to the closest dog park (so cute!). I regret not bringing my dog because they had a lot to offer for the pooches! She'll be coming with us next time :) PS: based on the cleanliness of the hotel, you'd have NO idea that it was pet friendly. Finally, the location can't be beat. It is directly in between Camden Yards and the Inner Harbor so we always had somewhere close to go. We parked our car at the hotel and didn't need to use it once, and never had to call a cab. The surrounding areas were safe enough (it is Baltimore..). We walked around late at night with no problems. You'd be making a mistake in not staying at this hotel. I'll will not stay anywhere else in Baltimore, and I look forward to staying at their hotels in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near waterfront”
Reviews.Author: AAndTMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights while attending a graduation. The hotel was very nice; rooms were large and very quiet for being in the middle of the city. Service was pleasant, and the price for a hotel in the city on a hioliday weekend was reasonable. Rooms were clean, comfortable. Just a gripe or two.. first, $36/night for parking is a bit steep, although I've seen worse. Second, they charge for internet. When this happens, I just use the black berry as a modem and forget the wireless, but really.. a $250+ / night hotel charging $3.00 a soda, etc... do you really need to try to suck $20 a day out of my wife and I to use the internet? Third, no turn down... I know its picky, but if you want the 5 stars ;)

Reviews.Title: “Love Kimpton, Love the Baltimore Monaco”
Reviews.Author: wkmoon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a one-night stay on a recent Sunday evening. We had booked a special rate for the basic "Deluxe King" room, but upon check-in they informed us of a free upgrade to their corner Mediterranean Suite! A great deal for $159 a night! Let me back up to the arrival process though...I've read comments on here about unhelpful bell-hops and parking attendants, but we found the opposite to be true. There were several young men manning the stand, and we were promptly greeted and assisted from unloading our bags all the way to a tour of our suite. You enter on the main floor of the old B&O headquarters building which is beautiful with all of the marble and historic-register staircases. Your greeter will accompany you to the Monaco's lobby which is on the second floor of the building. There is a large and inviting lounge with fireplace where they have their evening wine receptions.
