The check-in staff were all very friendly, and gave us all of the information that we needed for our stay. Our greeter then took us to our suite and gave us an orientation of the facilities, pointing out the safe, closet, hairdryer, etc. The suite itself was a nice size with separate living room and bedroom. The ceilings were 11-12' tall and the walls were covered with tall windows that had shades as well as sheer coverings. The bathroom was huge-all done in brown marble with a tile pattern on the wall of the jetted tub/shower. I could not hear a peep from the hallway or other guest rooms. I could hear some Charles St traffic, but after all, you are in a city on Baltimore's major north-south street. It's to be expected. The decor was toned down from your usual Kimpton loud-crazy-fabric choices, but still unique. To address comments of safety, perhaps those people did not understand the location away from the Inner Harbor that is more city-focused than tourist-focused. Baltimore is a bit gritty, but if you know that, then you understand it. I would caution a late night walk to the northwest, (Fayette-Howard intersection and Northwest of that) but any walk towards the Inner Harbor (south and east) should be just fine, when done with a partner or group. Just use common sense. It was also very convenient to the convention center and not terribly far from the Mt Vernon area (Wash monument). Our check-out was first-class as well. Big Dave took care of us and even took us on a bit of a photo-shoot, getting pictures of us in various spots in the hotel. All of this was done I am sure, to keep us from having to stand and wait while they brought our car from its parking location. I had two issues, but I put them at the end, because I did not want to deter readers from the positives of the property (and I think that most people can figure out that one negative review is the true minority when the hotel is #2 in the city)...first the HVAC was working overtime to cool the room. This was a cloudy, cool day, so I worry about the summer heat. The management may want to check on this. Second there was a strong smell in the room and in the hallway. My husband could not smell it, but he has a lot of trouble with allergies...I am not sure if it was off-gassing of carpet, wallpaper, etc or something else. I would have to honestly say that it smelled like a skunk. It could potentially deter people, and may be what the woman who wrote the bad review on May 24 was talking about. If this were a non-Kimpton property, and we had been treated badly, I would have downgraded for it, but I just could not let that over-ride our great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST MISS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: salsgalWarren_Nj
Reviews.Content: Dear traveling friends, I always say "it's the person you are with, not the place that matters." I no longer say that since I had the displeasure of visiting the Monaco hotel. My wonderful husband and I had a reservation at this hotel, which was rated as a 4 star hotel by Hotwire. Whoever came up with this rating was either paid off to do so, or doesn't get out much, if at all. That is, unless you find homeless people camped out in front of hotel property appealing. If that's not your thing, you can find people urinating within a stones throw of the property, if not directly right on it. Within 1 minute of getting to the hotel, I was on the phone with Hotwire telling them that we were not staying there. They insisted for some reason that we at least complete the check-in process before they could properly and thoroughly process my complaint. When we pulled up our car to the Valet stand, the guy supposedly "helping" did not lift a finger. My husband took the bags out himself!!! I even told this person that my husband has a bad back, but that didn't inspire him to help in any way whatsoever! Then, the next step was to bring our luggage up to our room. The same guy said "the lugguage doesn't fit in the elevator" Any simpleton would have known that all that had to be done was to turn the bags sideways . Speaking of fits, that's when I had one, and I announced to my husband that I would rather sleep in the car than stay there. He said he wanted to look at the room since it was very late at night and hotel rooms in Baltimore on that night were scarce. I waited downstairs for him. He came downstairs 2 minutes later with all of the luggage. He said"you would have hated it" I replied, "no kidding". This place brought out the worst in me, for sure! My husband, my favorite person on earth BTW, told me that the stench was horrible, and the bed was equipped with 2 double beds!!!!!! I was assured I was getting a King when we booked the reservation by phone. I was back on the phone with Hotwire within 1 minute telling them that I didn't care what their policy is. My policy is to never gett ripped off. They complied and gave us an apology with a full refund and even extra $ in hopes that we would give them another chance with a new reservation. My traveling friends, DON"T STAY HERE!!! You are much better off sleeping in your locked car. At least that's clean and safe!

Reviews.Title: “great location, flawless stay”
Reviews.Author: Bator2000
Reviews.Content: this hotel is conveniently located a few short blocks from the convention centre as well as the inner harbour. some reviews commented on the safety concerns after-dark, but we did not experience any problems (and we walked everywhere). all staff were fantastic, including doormen, room service and housekeeping - friendly and very accommodating! across the street are coffee shops, and up the road is a superb little grocery store. easy to walk to countless restaurants - but don't forget the B&O Brasserie onsite! the only improvement i would suggest is a vending machine for water - other than the wet bar, you would have to order room-service for it...is an inconvenience. oh yes, very noisy air conditioning system in the room - but given the fact that it was pretty warm and humid during our stay - it was still very much appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to High Kimpton Expectations”
Reviews.Author: maghua
Reviews.Content: I chose the Monaco over the big waterside hotel where my conference was being held because I have never been disappointed by the brand. Indeed, the Monaco was lovely - stylish, good-sized rooms, and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: claude64
Reviews.Content: Comfortable Airy Rooms; Large bathrooms;good amenities;pleasant staff; happy to stay again. Noisy Airconditioning Room could do with lounge chair and table to have inroom dining (adequate room) - hotel unable to supply

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, newly open but getting...”
Reviews.Author: ChappaquaNY
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous Hotel, newly open but getting worn out fast. Many service glitches... None mal-intentioned but lacks coordination and service that a renovation of this caliber deaerves

Reviews.Title: “Great place, one small complaint”
Reviews.Author: PAHasher13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco to treat ourselves to a night away, and also to be able to bring our dog with us. A few of the nice touches: our dog's name on a whiteboard by the entrance, where there was also dog food and water, and the staff manning the door remembered the dog's name for the length of our visit. it was also nice to be able to have the dog with us duirng the wine hour, which was fun. We had a King Deluxe room (no other 'cheaper' rooms were available) which was a nice size, nice bathroom. My complaint is that the room was very very dark, and every window looked across a rooftop to another window. there was one window (behind the TV) where, if I leaned just right, I could see the street (and sun).. I wanted to leave the curtains open, but wasn't sure what, or who, was behind the other windows (some of them were alos part ot the Hotel Monaco), so, kept them closed a lot. but i am definitely one who likes having the sun come in, and would have really liked to have a view. But, we were in the room more at night than during the day anyway, and the staff was very friendly and nice, and I liked the vibe, and location, of the hotel, so all in all, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Monaco made a horrible day all better.”
Reviews.Author: cyasukot
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco rocks. I'd had a horrible flight with lost luggage and a 146 person line at the taxi stand - but from the minute I arrived at this hotel (3 am), everything got one hell of a lot better. The staff was friendly and sincere. The soaker tub in my room took away my aches and pains. The minibar revived me. The bed was awesome. The next morning, I had breakfast at their attached restaurant (very good and not too expensive) and the smiling doorman got me a taxi. The staff at the hotel pestered the airline until my bag was delivered, and when I checked out, a doorman who happened to be riding the elevator with me had a cab to the airport ready and waiting when I reached the door. This place is awesome. It's hip without being snooty, welcomes pets, and truly did whatever they could to help me out. They've got my loyalty, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: polin001
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The look and feel of the place, the rooms, the service are all superior. We stayed in a Mediterranean suite that was just as comfortable as being at home but with some very nice views of Baltimore. The wine hour was very much appreciated and so was the friendliness of the staff. The wild robes in the room were a nice surprise. Finally, the bed was one of the most comfortable ever in a hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, outstanding staff, wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chris3502
Reviews.Content: We were in Baltimore for vacation and the Hotel Monaco exceeded my expectations. It's a charming historic building and from the moment we arrived, the staff took excellent care of us. Check-in was a breeze, concierge service (Dave) was exceptional, and we were very happy with our room. I had given my preferences (through the Kimpton InTouch program) when I made my reservation and everything was in place upon arrival. The hotel staff was very attentive and happy to answer any questions that we had regarding transportation, dining, nightlife, etc. around the city. I also can not say enough good things about the restaurant, B&O American Brasserie. The management, bartenders, and wait staff were all very friendly and the food quality was excellent. This trip fell on my birthday and everyone went out of their way to make me feel special. (Thank you to Marcus, the Asst. General Manager!) I highly recommend the Hotel Monaco and it would be my first choice for a return trip to Baltimore. The whole experience was so positive that I will certainly plan to stay in other Kimpton Hotels during my future travels.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem of a Hotel, Prepare to be pampered!”
Reviews.Author: surfer143
Reviews.Content: My husband travels for business and takes us along with him so we spend approx. 200 nights a year in hotels. He loves the Hilton brand so 99% of the time, we stay there. Unfortunately, for this particlar trip to Baltimore, he couldn't get a reasonable rate at Hilton so he used Priceline and ended up with Hotel Monaco. We have never stayed at Kimpton Hotels before. This hotel is beautiful. It is absolutely clean, the rooms are cozy. The staff took such great care of us, especially one of the doorman, a really big guy whose name I never got! (shame on me.) Our girls absolutely loved the place and were thrilled with the two goldfish delivered to our room. We travel so much that they cannot have pets at home so this was a real treat. Every day on our way out into the city our doorman would ask about the fish by name!!! The kids made sure I was back for cookies and milk hour and loved the wii in the living room. My husband loved the wine reception and spent every evening telling me all about his day there. The first day we checked in we were just in time for the wine reception but instead of making us come back down, the staff offered to deliver two glasses to our room! This is a wonderful hotel and I have to say that everyone I bumped into greeted me, over 4 days of our stay. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and we did not encounter anyone who was even just somewhat friendly! They were all super friendly and kind! The location is awesome for walking downtown and the rooms are spacious. Those were the only two things I really wanted. I have to say, though, that the service went above and beyond to make us feel right at home. To sum it up, our checkout day, both of my children kept asking, "Why can't we LIVE here??" Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful piece of history”
Reviews.Author: lasfloras
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel with beautiful furnishings, not all rooms have tubs, some are walk-in showers and you should specify if you have a preference, but they don't tell you that; the business center is $6.75/15 min session, but boarding passes can be printed free (and you can check in as well without charge). In room safe is large enough for a laptop. The perks include free morning coffee/tea service in the lobby, 4pm choc chip cookies (limited supply) w/ milk, and evening wine service from 5-6pm. The restaurant's breakfast service was a bit slow, or was it our waiter, don't know, but the food was tasty. Dinner was excellent at the same place however, and the kitchen is open till 10:30pm. Valet parking for dinner is only $5 if you have friends meeting you there. I think daily valet parking is $20/day. hope this information is helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel at a wonderful price”
Reviews.Author: lporges
Reviews.Content: The Monaco is a new hotel that took over the headquarters of the B & O Railroad. It kept the unusual lobby area and built the hotel on the upper floors. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are unique and the price was amazingly reasonable. When we checked in I asked for a room with 2 beds, they didn't have it available so upgraded us to a mini-suite at no extra charge. The bath room included a two-seater jacuzzi! The only drawback is that it is about 8 - 10 minute walk to the inner harbor, but it is good exercise.

Reviews.Title: “I am very picky and the Hotel Monaco worked hard to make me happy!”
Reviews.Author: loudab
Reviews.Content: My husband, I and our two teens just stayed at the Hotel Monaco for a rainy three day weekend. I am an extremely light sleeper and found our first room--a lovely suite overlooking Charles Street to be way too loud for me. (I live on a very quiet four acres in Chapel Hill.) When I asked if we could be moved to a quieter suite the next day, the Kimpton management was very accommodating. We moved to a quieter suite, but, the truth be told, it was still a bit loud for me. The next morning, a lovely gentleman (Big Dave) at the front desk asked me if I had slept well. I said I had slept somewhat poorly, but acknowledged I was a tough sell. He said the Kimpton could do better and arranged to move me and my family to yet another room--a psuedo-suite overlooking a back alley (not what most suite seekers would have chosen) which was blessedly quiet. I slept like a rock. I really can't say enough about how this hotel goes the extra mile for guests. Free coffee in the mornings (although they did keep running out of half and half), free wine in the evenings, free internet, free breakfast coupons, an eager to please staff. They even have pets--we got a goldfish for our stay--for families looking for something a bit more. There were a few--very few--rough spots. The hotel could use more people at the front door given that the doors are awfully heavy, especially if one's arms are full of luggage. The windows really need to be double paned--Charles Street is a busy, loud street and the single paned windows let in most of the noise. Some of the suites are poorly designed for families--the one we stayed in the second night required kids to troupe past the parents' bed to use the bathroom. If you stay here, when you make your reservation, tell the staff exactly what you want. My experience is, if they can make you happy, the staff at the Hotel Monaco will go the extra mile to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: dd8881
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great hotel. Everything was new and clean, and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful at every turn. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Baltimore. The food in the restaurant was pretty good as well, and not too expensive for a hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and unique hotel with hit-and-miss courteousness”
Reviews.Author: PacoCA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days in March on business. Small unique touches remind you that it was the former offices of the B&O Railroad. Also was impressed by the stained-glass windows and the all-marble stair cases. Rooms are functional and clean, but walls were thin and loud guests were disturbing at all hours of the night (staff did correct the situation even before I was able to contact them!). Location is perfect with almost equal distance between the Washington Monument and the Inner-Harbor. Plenty of good restaurants within a few blocks, and the on-site B&O Restaurant delivers to your room. The exercise room and small business offices were nice, as was the convention space (if you are coming for a meeting). Internet is free IF you join the Kimpton club which is at no cost. The only downside, besides the thin walls, is the hit-and-miss staff courteousness. When there was someone at the door, they were kind, but more often there was no one there, and at one time the staff was talking with some "friends" and ignored us completely. The front desk was understaffed at times and were more business minded than friendly. The staff serving the business meeting rooms were more courteous. Overall it is a charming and unique hotel with hit-and-miss courteousness with the staff. If you interact infrequently with staff, this will probably not dampen your enjoyment at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: aerojommel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on Charles St. in Inner Harbor. It is like the beginning of the west side of Center City. It is only a few blocks from everything from Camden Yards, Powerplant Live, Pratt/Light St pavillions, ESPNZone, Restaurant Alley, Lexington Market, Bars, Clubs, etc. When we are visiting, we walk everywhere. This is a great location for those who like to keep their car in the garage for a few days. Walking north west towards Lexington can be a little dicey.(much different neighborhood) But it's still an ok walk for most people. This is a new hotel in a very old building. History buffs will love this place. It is the former home of B&O railroad's corporate offices. Much of the infrastructure can still be seen and is very well adapted as part of the decor. The service we received was top of the line. You can certainly tell that these folks make every effort to make sure you enjoy your stay. In a service industry where customers are often left wondering where the service went, the entire staff at this property should be commended. The common area next to the hotel lobby is one of the best I've ever seen. It has a roaring fireplace in the center of the room with high-backed comfy couches and chairs. Free wine in this area for guests at 5pm is a great touch. Free cookies and milk at the lobby desk at 4pm is also enjoyable. The animal print robes in the room are a fun accent. Room safes are also a nice addition over most Baltimore hotels. Do not Valet from Hotel. There are several parking garages within a block where you will pay less than half of the $36/day the hotel charges. Ask the desk questions.(Anything from restaurant choices to routes to walk) Happy hour wine in B&O are the same they are serving guests for free in the common area. Wifi is free for Kimpton In touch members.(free to join at Kimpton.com)

Reviews.Title: “Lost some charm...”
Reviews.Author: KWIZHartford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August, during the "soft opening". We loved it then, and returned hoping for another great experience...Well, some of the initial charm is gone: no art books in the living room, no magazines in the rooms (Nature Conservancy, etc.), no Kids Packs...Speaking of kids: Kimptons are known for being child-friendly & in August my children were made to feel very welcome - this time no one spoke to them, said hello, nothing! Also: where are the friendly & helpful doormen? We struggled thru heavy doors alone each time we returned. Where were the running maps and bottled water? Gone. Also, there never seemed to be a "greeter" or concierge, just some un-smilng front desk staff. (David was a notable exception who made sure we were taken care up at departure time...). Part of the reason we love Kimptons is the feeling that staff actually care about you; compared to the clinical business atmosphere at bigger chain hotels...The place is still beautiful, but the friendliness & care was missing...

Reviews.Title: “poor first impression, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jacksondc
Reviews.Content: the first impression of any hotel starts at the door. we arrived at 4pm...no bellman, slow valet parkers (it's your only option) and a sense that we interrupted a quiet rainy afternoon. while the valets were generally competent, you didn't get a sense that your car will be safe. please contract this out for better, faster and friendlier service. once inside the hotel...what a beautiful place. the reno of this old baltimore and ohio headquarters was done right. you enter at the lobby of the building and are whisked away to the hotel lobby on the next floor. tiffany glass, marble stairs. great to see an incredible old building turned into a showplace. we were met at the front desk with warm chocolate chip cookies and milk! our rooms (three of them) were perfect and all together including a connecting door...they must have read our minds as we arrived at different times. the room was really spacious - even the regular rooms were impressive... and the amenities outstanding. the restaurant is a must see...called B&O, it is great modern design, romantic and seems to have it all together. the hostess was friendly, informative and honest (incredible given the other restaurants we tried in baltimore who were less than helpful). notes: - be prepared for a wait for your car as the garage isn't easily accessible to the valet staff. request it a good 15 minutes prior to departure time (normal for almost any valet event). - let the front desk know if something is right...they're incredibly helpful and genuinely want you to enjoy your stay. - ask for a goldfish at check-in...you're own pet for your stay. - ask questions! the very well informed staff can answer almost everything! thanks hotel monaco for a worry free stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!!! Very Impressed with Monaco!!”
Reviews.Author: bogeyboi
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Hotel Monaco on business and quite impressed with how the place has been restored! Customer service was exceptional from the bellman to housekeeping. The entrance has a historic feel to it and a completely different art deco look on the second floor (Lobby). They even have a sitting room complete with fireplace (always lit) and Wii console hooked up to a 50" flat screen. The meeting rooms are also on the Lobby floor (which can also be accessed using the marble stairs at the entrance). Business center is small and they charge $6.95 per fifteen minutes. Rooms are well appointed, very clean, and spacious. Ceilings must be at least 20ft. Mini bar (for cost) and sundries drawer had anything you'd need. Bathrooms are granite marble and mosiac tile in the shower. There's a safe in the closet as well as robe. Ipod dock was also a plus and flat screen tv offered great reception. The fitness center is on the 3rd floor and very spacious with LifeCycle equipment, towels, cold water, etc. B&O restaurant is adjacent to the hotel and food/service is excellent. I'm not even a pork eater but was recommended the Pork Shank -- it's the best prepared pork entree I've had!! Hotel is close to Inner Harbor action. If you're a seafood lover you MUST try Mo's restaurant - the best I've had!!! (and they'll provide shuttle to and from their restaurant). Only cons I had with Monaco is the housekeeper didn't alway replenish my toiletries and I'd prefer having the sheets changed more often. Also the hotel is not exactly in the touristy part of downtown so you should exercise awareness when out, especially at night. That said, I was very impressed and enjoyed my stay here immensely. Would certainly recommend to anyone in Baltimore on business. Great Stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: kipperdelaware
Reviews.Content: I recently had to travel to Baltimore for a meeting and was snowed in with the blizzard of 2010. Under any circumstances this hotel would provide a great travel experience, but the hotel and staff outdid themselves in insuring that the snowed in guests were well cared for. There was great attention to cleanliness and the entire staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. The Monaco really was a bright star in a blizzard. Congrats to the staff and management on an outstanding job.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful renovation; outstanding staff; great location”
Reviews.Author: jayfriedman
Reviews.Content: We arrived the day before "Snowmageddon". The hotel was not crowded and the city of Baltimore was a mess. Airlines cancelled, you name it. The skeleton staff (those that could get to work), were simply outstanding. My overstay was greeted with discounting instead of goughing. As for the hotel, pet friendly, happy hour, really fantastic interior decorating. Convenient to Mount Vernon as well as the waterfront; but out of the waterfront crowd. Great value, great staff and a beautiful historic building. It was my first Kimpton hotel visit, but will not be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Style and Service--an unbeatable combination in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Writer46
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here one night for a business trip. Terrifically stylish place just oozing interest. Standard King room was more than adequate. Unbeleivably impressive bathroom with deep soaking tub. As a Kimpton In touch member was given a $10.00 credit for anything from the mini bar. What a great idea! Throughly enjoyed the B&O bistro. Excellent wine selection and superb service. Breakfast was great as well. I would highly recommend this hotel. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BinnyB
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel has been beautifully remodeled while preserving many historic details. Our room was spacious, clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff was pleasant and we enjoyed our spotless, quiet, comfortable room. We did not care for the breakfast at the hotel restaurant; found the food over priced and not of good quality (the menu claimed real Vermont maple syrup but it was not). Nice location. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Doorman hit on me during weekend getaway for boyfriend's birthday!! Really??!!”
Reviews.Author: free2behappy05
Reviews.Content: I planned a beautiful weekend for my boyfriend's birthday in November at the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore because it looked lovely on the website. I was very excited because it was the first time I had done something this nice for anyone, and me and my boyfriend were getting very serious at this time in our relationship. Upon arrival, we were not aware of the valet service or the check-in process period. So we pull up in my '04 Chevy, and the valet drivers just ignored us, and proceeded to serve the Lexus truck parked in front of us. Noticing the process, I had to get out of the car, go to the inconspicuous front desk to check in (it was on the second floor and I didn't know because NO ONE told me what to do or where to go), get my room key, and then tell the valet drivers "Hey...we're staying here." Once they realized we were guests, they were very helpful, and getting to the room was a breeze. STRIKE 1: Once to the room, there were dishes in front of our door from previous guests. The bell hop told us that it would be taken care of "probably later on tonight." OK no big deal. Later, I checked my bank account because I had reserved an expensive dinner that same night; just wanted to be sure that I could cover it. Unbeknown to me, because I used my debit card, the hotel charged me for two nights, two days of valet ($35/day), and incidental fee of quite a bit of money totaling: over $500...leaving my account unable to pay for the dinner. Now, I was under the impression that my card was to confirm my reservation and I would pay at the end; regardless of what I "thought", it sure would've been nice to know how the money process works when using a debit card vs. a credit card. The woman at the front desk did not tell me anything. My boyfriend ended up having to pay for his birthday dinner, and every meal we ate during that weekend. I had never been so embarrassed in my life. STRIKE 2: Since we were guests in the hotel, we figured that dinner in the hotel restaurant would be our best bet. LITTLE DID WE KNOW, the restaurant works on a reservation process...meaning if you don't have a reservation, you're probably gonna have to wait forever or eat at a awkward table with strangers. We ended up eating with strangers that night which ended up being a pretty nice experience, but not one we were planning to have. For the over $500 they took from my account without telling me, I personally feel that priority should be given to hotel guests at the restaurant. STRIKE 3: We went to breakfast around 9:00 the next morning leaving the "PLEASE SERVICE" sign on the door. When we went to breakfast, which was included in the room fees, I presented the little tickets which entitles us to the continental breakfast to the waiter downstairs. He was very polite, and informed us that we could sit anywhere in the restaurant we wanted, as he pointed upstairs. We went ahead upstairs, since we ate downstairs the night before. We made our plates, sat down and began eating when another waiter came up to us and asked us to present our tickets yet again. Of course I didn't have it anymore because I had given it to the waiter downstairs. It was quite an insult to see this waiter go downstairs and verify that we indeed had tickets and weren't just moochers. Just a little side note, not only did we eat the included continental breakfast, we ordered ACTUAL BREAKFAST too. STRIKE 4: When we got back to our room about two hours later, our room had not been serviced. This was not a big deal to us so we left the service sign up, and would just move out of the way once the cleaning staff arrived. It wasn't until it was dark outside and we were out of clean towels that we became irritated. We called the service line to tell them about the service/towels, and oh by the way...the dishes still sitting outside of our room. 2 hours later, we received towels. After dinner that night (around 9:00 or so), the dishes finally were picked up by a staff member who looked like he was the only one servicing all of the rooms. (We had seen him on other floors when we went for a walk around the hotel earlier that day) STRIKE 5: The final day, we got our things together, and prepared for breakfast and checkout. Since my boyfriend needed cash, we decided that I would go pick up the breakfast tickets while he got the cash, and we would meet up at the restaurant for breakfast. After I got the tickets, I went downstairs and was approached by one of the young men who works the front door. He said VERBATIM, "DAMN...What's Yo name??" Shocked and a little scared, I said my name and that I was here with my boyfriend. He said he didn't care, and continued to hassle me. I literally had to run and hide in the restaurant for him to leave me alone. THE RESOLUTION: Once we got to the front desk to check out, the concierge asked us how our stay was. We looked at each other and said, "Where do we begin?!" I told the concierge EVERYTHING. He listened to me intently, and was pretty shocked about how we were treated. He wrote down everything, and resolved to refund me the full amount of our stay only charging us for taxes and miscellaneous charges which totaled $81 total. This was a great resolution for our stay and I was pleases with the outcome. I took my boyfriend shopping with the money instead, but it was not what I originally planned. THE AFTERSHOCK: I checked my account to ensure that the hotel actually did refund me. To my surprise, the hotel reactivated my parking fee and took out an extra day of parking ($35) the next day! I had to call management to have them deactivate it and give me my money back. All in all, the hotel is beautiful...ABSOLUTELY gorgeous. Almost breathtaking; but the service trumps all of that beauty. I have told all of my friends and co-workers about this, and told them to never stay there. This is quite unfortunate because I can tell that a lot of hard work is spent on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjwidds
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights in December 2009. First task was to find the reception desk-for future visitors it is situated on the mezzanine level so you have to walk up the very grand staircase or use the lift. Once I found it the check was very efficient. Room was clean and well furnished bed was comfortable. Didn't use the room service and check out was as good as check in. Situated a short walk from the harbour area and close to transport links.All in all not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend without the kids”
Reviews.Author: Hairtonic
Reviews.Content: Our entire experience was excellent. We checked in right as the wine hour was closing up, and they comped us 4 drinks at the the hotel restaurant. We asked for a coffee maker, and they had one delivered within minutes of getting into the room. We stayed in one of the Mediterranean Suites and it was glamerous. The bathroom was especially cool. Huge tub with a shower right as you walk in. We ate at the hotel restaurant the first night we checked in, and ate there 3 more times. Delicious menu that changed every night. The hotel and restaurant staff were attentive and professional. We found no faults in our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to get this on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: relayer
Reviews.Content: Won this 4-star hotel on Priceline at $72 a night for this two-night stay, which included New Year's Eve. The hotel lived up to the lofty ranking on Tripadvisor. The only thing I wasn't happy about was forgetting the camera for some pictures. Hotel Monaco is a Kimpton Hotel located in town but only a couple blocks walk to the Inner Harbor. Rooms had high ceilings, modern decor and a clean, comfortable feel. Our king room only had a walk-in shower in the bathroom if that's a concern. I like the LG HD TV's and they offered about a dozed HD channels. We were on the 12th floor and found it very quiet in the evening, not bad considering the hotel seemed pretty full for New Year's. Valet Parking is the only option at the hotel for $36 a night. There is a parking garage one block up on the left and it was only $21 a night. If we include the tip for valet, I probably saved $40 for the two nights by just walking one block. Be careful when pulling up to the hotel because there is no pull out from Charles Street. Curbside is the only option for unloading. As stated earlier the Harbor is an easy walk and we did it on a snowy, cold morning. The restaurant/bar in the hotel is called B&O American Brasserie and we ate a quality dinner in there. It also has a modern theme, but moderately expensive if one is just looking for a quick bite. However, the smaller brick oven pizzas are excellent for only $9. The Caribou Coffee Cafe across the street was also a nice place to stop for some java. As stated earlier the Harbor is an easy walk and we did it on a snowy, cold morning. I highly recommend this hotel for a great stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel but does not live up to the Kimpton hype”
Reviews.Author: TravelMom_Bowie
Reviews.Content: The location and interior of this hotel are magnificent. The room was spacious and well kept. My suggestions are as follows: 1 - Improve the valet service. Every time we needed to retrieve our car via the valet, it took no less than 20-25 minutes. That's a long wait. 2 - Ensure staff are knowledgeable about hotel packages. I booked a package that was advertised on the Kimpton site and saw posters for in the hotel's lobby, but no one on the staff at the time of check-in seemed familiar with it and seemed to bumble over themselves trying to figure it out. Even upon check-out, we were not provided all the credits proffered in the package and had to have the hotel's manager fix the mistake. 3 - The in room dining menu left a lot to be desired and was very expensive. While we would have preferred to stay in the hotel for dinner, we decided to head out because of the limited menu. For breakfast, we ordered 1 omelette, 1 waffle, 1 pot of coffee, and it cost us over $50! The service fees and delivery fees were extraordinary and not necessarily disclosed prior to ordering. If we had known we were going to pay so much for eggs and an Eggo, we would have gone out in the cold to the Caribou across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: fjjess11
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a couple of paid vacation days to use up before the New Year, so we decided to head down to Baltimore to see the Aquarium and Inner Harbor. I looked into hotel in the area and The Monaco ended up being my choice. A major snowstorm hit the east coast the day of our departure, so it took a couple hours more than usual, but the trip was worth it. Because of the snow we were limited mostly to stayin in the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful at check-in. They informed us of all of the hotel features and accomodations. Our room was clean, quiet, and overall very nice. after a quick shower ( the only downfall was the design of this thing), we headed down to the lobby where they were serving FREE WINE!! We ate at the B and O restaurant that night and then sat at the bar for drinks afterward, which was wonderful. To wrap it up, we enjoyed this hotel, the staff, and the guests so much that we booked an extra night here.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn S
Reviews.Content: I stumbled into the Hotel Monaco for a one night stay quite unexpectedly because of travel delays. There are certainly plenty of hotels in the neighborhood -- Baltimore's somewhat seedy and downtrodden business district though it's an easy walk to the Inner Harbor -- but I'd stayed at a couple of Hotel Monacos in San Francisco and Salt Lake City so thought I'd give it a try. You know when you walk into a hotel, all stressed and disheveled, and you walk out, some 15 hours later, and feel like you've been transformed into a calm, centered normal person? That's how I felt. It was just a splendid, if way too short, stay and I'll go back (and might even start checking out more of this chain since there are now East Coast properties). Check in was superb -- request for bathroom with tub was honored though the room rate I booked apparently was shower only. Hotel is just beautiful; Kimpton, its owner, has taken the gorgeous old headquarters of the B&O Railroad and given it a warm, contemporary yet lushly traditional (hard combo to achieve!) feel. The hotel by the way is tucked inside what's still a commercial office building. Loved the color schemes in my room (a cerulean blue put me in better spirits immediately upon entering) and here's a little detail but it's symbolic of what Kimpton does right: Inside the closet, the walls are painted a matching blue. It's a small thing but ... it works. Loved the whimiscal room snacks (for a fee, no problem), the soft zebra-patterned bathrobes, Aveda toiletries, the free Internet if you sign up for Kimpton's loyalty club (my pleasure), the general spaciousness of the room, and the ultra-comfy bed. I don't remember too much more -- it was a very short stay. There is a hip looking restaurant on the ground floor and I was too late arriving for a meal the night before and had to leave just before lunch so no time there, either, but the menu looked just fine and loved the ambience. The only thing I'm not crazy about, and this might not be relevant to most, is the neighborhood's a little dicey. I'm a native Baltimorean and so I know how to get around -- but I really like areas like Johns Hopkins Homewood, Mt. Vernon and Fells Point and even Federal Hill (which all have hotels) because there's life there. At night, here, not so much. And even the nearby Harborplace, wow, the economy has taken a huge toll on that once-beloved place. Empty and soulless.... But I'd still go back in a heartbeat, the Hotel Monaco is a lovely, lovely new addition to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have had a better stay!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotterGyrl
Reviews.Content: Came from DC to celebrate the BF's Birthday. The hotel is gorgeous and perfect if you appreciate all things pretty as I do! We were upgraded upon arrival because of the occasion to a larger room with a Jacuzzi tub (huge). He is a frequent business traveler with a lot of hotel stays under his belt and kind of a Hilton snob...lol! He was impressed beyond belief! So we loved the staff, very helpful, and the Goldfish was a hit. The restaurant was amazing. It was a nice night spot for drinks, great food and good ambiance, no need to go to the harbor . This could possibly be our rekindling spot close to home!

Reviews.Title: “Some Opening Night Hiccups”
Reviews.Author: pickles1107
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I am a big fan of the Kimpton chain, so I was thrilled to be in town the day the new Monaco opened in Baltimore (July 30th). The location is not as good as the other true Inner Harbor hotels, although it is definitely walkable. The building itself is beautiful as the former headquarters of the B & O railroad. Even if you aren't staying here, if you happen to be walking by you owe it to yourself to stop in the lobby to see the magnificent Tiffany stained glass ceiling. As with any opening, there are bound to be a few glitches, and the Hotel Monaco was no different. I was greeted by several doormen, who all seemed excited to have guests and eager to help. I dropped off my bags and took the rental car two blocks north to a garage that charges $6 /day weekend rate (222 N Charles I believe). Valet is steep at $36 per day, so check out the other options. The receptionist was still learning the system and it took a few minutes to apply my Kimpton InTouch membership to my stay. Understandable. I was then escorted to my room by one of the bellmen who took my bags. I was assigned room 1406, on the top floor as I requested. We got off the elevator and the bellman took me to the wrong end of the hallway before realizing he had gone the wrong way. Honest mistake as he was still learning his way around I guess. We went back the other way and found the room. He then came in and began explaining the features of the room as one would expect. After he was done explaining the finer points of the bathroom, he then pointed me to the FOURTEEN inch flat screen TV (no, I didn't mishear him as he said it twice). In actuality, it was a nice LG 40"+ LCD. This was clearly a direct result of the training this gentleman received, and I hope they had this straightened out soon thereafter. The room was very nice....typical Kimpton style and very large (my queen queen room was over 400 sqft!). I particularly fancied the leather wallpaper in the bathroom. I have only two other minor quibbles, the first being that my rate included a nightly cocktail in B&O, the hotel restaurant, but the hotel had not received the vouchers from corporate yet, so I did not receive my cocktail. When I checked in, I mentioned this and they offered to escort me to the bar right then, but I was late to a dinner reservation so I declined. The only other comment I have is I did not receive my InTouch welcome amenity $10 minibar coupon, which I assume is also attributable to opening night kinks. I understand one cannot accurately judge a hotel by it's performance on opening night, and I will be back next week to see how much the staff has grown in 5 short months.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: Case1096
Reviews.Content: The Baltimore Monaco proves itself as another wonderful Kimpton property. The hotel has offices on the lower floors with hotel rooms on floors 7-14. We had a King room on the 14th floor which included a vaulted ceiling as well as an extended seating area. The front desk was friendly and helpful. The hotel is within walking distance of the Inner Harbor. It is located in the downtown area so you still have to use common sense when wandering from the property. As it has been reported here in other reviews the valet is very expensive at $36 a day. There are nearby self park lots that are more reasonable. Our only issue with the hotel was with the valet service. For the price you are paying they are extremely slow. In addition, they do not wear easily indentiable uniforms. At night we had to question the valet if he even worked at the hotel since he looked like he was wearing street clothes. So be cautious and hopefully as this hotel grows it will correct this issue.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel - LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: dburkett
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Monaco Baltimore for one night in December 2009. The hotel was flawless, decor was swanky, staff was friendly and helpful, & location was ideal. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Please be aware; however, that it is pet friendly. You will see guests with dogs at the wine reception, in the lobby etc. Personally, it was just one more thing I loved about the hotel. If you don't have a pet with you, you can request a goldfish at check in. The location is in walking distance to Inner Harbor, the Powerplant Live nightlife attractions, Marnier Arena, & Camden Yards. There are many dining options in close proximity as well. I am a big fan of the Kimpton hotel chain. I have stayed in their Alexandria and San Diego locations. I have never been disappointed with a Kimpton and you will love it too!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic way to spend the holidays!”
Reviews.Author: wshale
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Monaco in Baltimore over the Thanksgiving holiday while visiting family. Wow! Great stay! The room is fantastic, the staff superb (especially Franklin, who made everything seem so easy!), the restaurant is a "don't miss" and the location is perfect. You are just a few blocks away from the Inner Harbor and the Lightrail system. Would definitely stay again! Thanks to everyone at Hotel Monaco in Baltimore for making the Thanksgiving holiday a great one! W. Shannon Hale

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsmoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Monaco for 3 nights. We were upgraded to a Mediterranean Suite on the 12th Floor. Absolutely beautiful and very quiet (which is paramount to me) nice downtown view. We had fabulous service from the front desk, bell staff and concierge. The hotel is really grand and the the decor is great. Loved the wine hour, missed cookie hour. Coffee in the morning is in need of help- too many guests not enough coffee and supplies fast enough. I wish they'd put coffee makers in the rooms without having to ask. But besides that one small complaint I loved the hotel, the room and the service. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying downtown Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: NYCTravelPal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco Baltimore for a post-Thanksgiving get-away. The hotel was lovely. It has a grand lobby (a little awkward since it is one flight up from the street level). The rooms are very spacious and decorated in a chic style-- sort of art-deco style. Everything was clean and neat. The hotel staff are extremely accommodating-- they provided us with a complimentary continental breakfast (it was not part of our package, though they do offer it) and were kind enough to waive the fee for the rollaway bed. If you join the Kimpton's 'in-touch' program they offer you free wireless connection and gave us a $10 credit for the mini bar. The hotel is located about 2 blocks from the touristy (but nice) inner harbor area and close to a downtown cultural walking tour. It's fairly close to the museums etc. (except for the Fine Arts and Visionary Art museums which are walkable, but a bit far-- about 3 miles). We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend the Kimpton and this hotel. By the way, our kids ages 11, 13 and 15 loved the hot cookies and milk served daily in the lounge at 4 (don't be late they are gone by 4:30!).

Reviews.Title: “Monaco nice addition to Inner Harbor hotels”
Reviews.Author: kennethwalker
Reviews.Content: The new Hotel Monaco Baltimore is a nice addition to the Inner Harbor Hotels with the usual decor and amenities you expect from a Kimpton. My room request (corner) was not available on check in at 3pm so I waited until available. Unfortunately the corner room I was in did not get much sunlight and only had a view of the adjacent buidlings. The lobby on the second floor is a little odd, and make sure everyone has a room key as you'll need it in the elevator to access the hotel floors. Parking is overpriced at $36 and no discount for Hybrids (like most West Coast Kimptons)! Try the Sheraton city center or the public garages a few blocks away for $20 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Incredible Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: greenbeltdan
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience at a Kimpton hotel - I've got elite status at Hilton, Hyatt, Marriott, and Starwood, so I tend not to deviate from the big chains. But boy, am I glad I did this time as my experience at the Hotel Monaco was incredible! I booked a package rate, which included a bottle of wine. Upon check-in, as a recent Kimpton In-Touch member, I was upgraded to a nicer room. When Laurelle, the wonderful concierge, went up to put the wine in the room, she noticed that the room was a little warm and offered to upgrade me yet again to a suite, which was extremely kind. Later, I mentioned to her that it was my birthday and that my family and I were going out to celebrate, and I found a bottle of champagne and a personalized note in my room upon my return. The wine hour was very classy, with pleasant conversation and very decent wine freely flowing. We missed the milk and cookie hour, but again, Laurelle came through and made sure that she put some aside for my family. In fact, she was so giving that I felt guilty. The hotel itself is incredible, as are the rooms. I've stayed at most of the hotels in the Inner Harbor, and this wins, hands down. If there's any knock, it's the location, which is a couple of blocks away from the attractions, and there are a few unsavories hanging around nearby, but that's not unexpected for Baltimore city (no offense to my Baltimore buddies, but it's true). I prefer the new Harbor East neighborhood overall, but you'd be hardpressed to find a better hotel in Baltimore, especially if you can get a good rate. Parking is expensive ($36/night), but if you don't like it, park at a nearby garage for about half the price without the in/out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel- Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: thame_hoops
Reviews.Content: Absolutly beautiful hotel, lovely decor huge HD TV's in room, clean, great location for my 4 day stay etc. However, the staff looked down their nose at me upon check-in, probably because i got the room for $60 a night through expedia. I booked a king room, when i checked in i was told i couldnt have one despite me boooking it. I had to settle for 2 queens. Being a 'kimpton in touch' member didnt give me any benefits like i was told. NO newspapers were delivered, no coffee maker in my room despite me emailing the hotel beforehand. When the coffee maker arrived next day, there were not any cups. I couldnt be bothered to argue as i felt the staffs attitude was 'hey mr, you got your room dirt cheap, quit complaining' When my booked taxi didnt arrive to take me back to the airport, the hotel staff couldnt care less. I waved one down in the street. Also, they have the most uselss doormen in hotel history. There seems to be 3 or 4 people stood round the door but your lucky if a door gets opened for you or if you get help with your luggage. At the end of the day, i am thicked skin and I treat people with courtesy . If they throw this back in my face then i treat them with the contempt they deserve. I will not tolerate being blantantly 'mugged' off and looked down upon from staff that are supposedly there to serve & Help I would stay there again but i suspect the prices will rocket once it gets established. The B & O bar next door is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully restored building”
Reviews.Author: JT4833
Reviews.Content: LOVED the hotel....rooms were beautiful, restaurant was top notch. Lobby areas stunning. From those standpoints the stay was beyond our expectations. Parking was pricey compared to other hotels in the area and only had a valet option. Convenient but ridiculously priced. Maid service was extremely lacking. We don't have super high standards....just want the bed made and bathroom tidied. We always opt not to have our towels or sheets changed daily. Well the only service we got for each of the 3 nights we were there was a made bed. It was as though the maid went into the bathroom and started to tidy it but got distracted and left. Very strange. Checkout was a mess and we were shocked. We ate in the restaurant twice and they had us there three times. We parked for 3 nights, they had us for 2 nights. Room was prepaid and the staff member said that was the issue. We've never had an issue with a prepaid room. Charges were put on our credit card then taken off so that put a hold on our card before the final charge could go on. Luckily we had another form of payment, but we will still have to deal with multiple payments that were put on unnecessarily. Overall a great stay and would go again. Even maid service was not a huge issue overall....checkout however left a sour taste in our mouths. Expected that to be a smooth process for a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “incredible!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lalala101
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco was incredible! My parents and I were staying for a night after they had picked me up from CTY and i was in awe when we got there. It is in a stunning building and is only a couple minutes away from the harbor/shopping area which is fabulous! The service was great, they were very friendly and on time. The value was also good. The rooms were good size and had beautiful windows and decor. The bathrooms were well kept and it was quite clean. I'm so glad that I stayed there, it was a wonderful place even though I was only there for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: dragonOL2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend trip to Baltimore for the B-more ComiCon... while the Kimpton in Alexandria was a bit more visually stimulating from a style standpoint (vibrant colors and furnishings) this Kimpton was pleasing as well. The architecture of the place was pretty cool and nice to look at. All of the staff was very polite and welcoming and the rooms were very nice and clean. The free wifi was a nice touch (for inTouch members) and upon entering our room I was pleasantly surprised to find a nice welcome card (hand written, not typed on some computer) that was personalized with a nice complimentary offer. The hotel is located in a section of the city that allows for easy walking distance to both the Inner Harbor and the Power Plant section of downtown (we hit Fogo de Chao's and PF Changs on consecutive nights and walked to both with no problems whatsoever, even at night). All in all I would have to say that the experience in this hotel was different than my experience at the Alexandria Kimpton, but definitely not lacking. Recommended! One word of advice: the valet parking was VERY expensive (somewhere around $30 a night!!!) and there are several parking garages in pretty close vicinity to the hotel that will charge a MUCH cheaper rate (around $15 - $20 a night) so unless you require your car be parked by valet, I would seek out the surrounding parking garages... easy access to your car and not too far of a walk for hauling luggage

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: vamel
Reviews.Content: This is by far the most beautiful hotel I have stayed in. The marble staircase is just stunning. This is my 3rd Kimpton stay and it did not dissappoint. We arrived later than I had hoped after spending more than an hour in DC/Baltimore traffic and missed the wine hour. But not to worry as when we checked in, we were given free drink coupons to wind down from the stressful trip. We were celebrating our 24th anniversary and were stunned to see our room upgraded to an AWESOME suite and a bottle of champaigne. The high windows and ceilings are stunning and the bathroom was huge and beautiful.. Unfortunately we could only stay one night before meeting family in NJ so we did not interact very much with staff. However, I did note that each time we passed a staff member in the hallway, they were very friendly--making eye contact and greeting us pleasently. Kimpton is a first rate hotel group and the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore is one of their gems. I hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great reuse of historic building”
Reviews.Author: SteveIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: We had shampoo and conditioner in our room. The room was very well done and the bathroom was great, but what topped all this was the friendliness of the personnel, Especially, Nick at the front desk. We asked for a tea maker when checking in and it was delivered to our room, but it would probably be better if a tea/coffee maker was in the room. It is inconvenient to go to the lobby to get coffee and tea (nothing is provided to take it back to the room and I ended up spilling some coffee).The remake of the building is top notch. It is a beautiful old building and a great rehabilitation. The beds, linens, etc. were extremely confortable and top quality. I was very impressed by the whole experience and woulld recommend this hotel. This is a five star property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautfiul New Hotel in Inner Harbor - Great Ammenities but Staff Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Salmantino6884
Reviews.Content: Of all the Kimpton Hotels in which I stayed, Hotel Monaco in Baltimore might be one of the most beautiful properties to date. Everything from the lobby to the hallways to the immaculate rooms... I was speechless. While I will continue to rave about my stay here, I was dissatisfied with one component at Monaco and it seems to conflict with other guests. I thought the service here was awful...especially compared to other Kimpton Hotels. I chalked it up, however, to the hotel being fairly new and it generally taking time for a staff to settle in. For others to review the service as incredible, however, has me puzzled. Upon pulling up to the hotel, the valet was smoking a cigarette and didn't seem to have a sense of urgency to help me. When I got out of the car he wanted to take my information outside in the pouring rain instead of going under the awning to the hotel... I had to move us there. Not a good start. Next, I went up to the lobby (this is one of those hotels that you must take an elevator to actually get to the lobby... somewhat annoying but not a big deal) and tried to check in. Unfortunately, there was only one front desk staff and three people in front of me checking in so the process took about 15 minutes. Like I said... not a good start. Now, after the initial issues... everything was incredible. I've never been in a room decorated so stunningly. The bed was big and comfortable. The bathroom (especially the shower) was amazing. Everything was top notch in my room and the decor matched the theme of the hotel and the building's history. If you have a few extra $$ to spend, I would definitely try to stay here just for the experience alone... I can't wait to return. I dined in the B&O restaurant for breakfast one morning and I ordered room service one evening and both were satisfactory... no issues. FITNESS CENTER WAS THE BEST YET.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is wonderful- otherwise it is a ripoff'”
Reviews.Author: diehardphilliesfan
Reviews.Content: While this is a beautiful hotel, sparkling clean and new, with one of the best staffs I have ever encountered in all my years of traveling, I will not go back. I cannot believe that a hotel that charges what they do is so chintzy when it comes to basic amenities. There is no coffemaker in the room (even cheap motels give you those). They will send you one if you ask, but why should you have to? They have complimentary coffee in the morning in the lobby, but a lot of people really don't want to get dressed first thing in the morning to go downstairs to get coffee; plus if you want coffee when you come back to your room, you have to pay for it, as the complimentary coffee is only three hours in the morning. The 'amenity' of internet access in the Business Center will cost you $6.95 for 15 minutes! As for bath products, I have never stayed in any hotel that did not have shampoo, condtioner and a shower cap (sometimes even body lotion). You get a bar of soap, that is it! They will tell you that these things are available if you ask (some at a charge) but again why all the asking? There isn't even a phone book in the room and the lobby has none of the pamphlets and folders of different activities and restaurants that most hotels in any location have. Everything is about asking the front desk. Another guest I met in the elevator also commented on the strangeness of it; sometimes it is just easier to look things up yourself. However, as I said the staff is wonderful which made my stay pleasant enough. Oh and by the way, do youself a favor at breakfast - go around the corner to the Radisson Lord Baltimore restaurant. They have a great $9.95 breakfast buffet which includes juice and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in downtown Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: lawgod
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel while running in the Baltimore Running Festival. This place was about 40% cheaper than the hotels suggested by the race organizers, but was just as convenient and really nice. Would stay here again in an instant. They had a great courteous staff. All the faclities were new. Health club at no extra charge. Free cookies and coffee and wine receptions every day. The building is an old historic building that they have updated beautifully. Rooms are modern and original and well appointed. Only minus is that the air conditioner is a bit loud when it cuts in. Don't go for the valet parking - there are lots around the corner that you can self park and save 50%.

Reviews.Title: “The usual Kimpton Fab”
Reviews.Author: bobin
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel chain. I've stayed at Kimptons in Chicago, Portland, Alexandria and Baltimore and never been disappointed. The rooms are delightfully appointed; the staff is always very pleasant and helpful; pets are welcome; and there is a nice wine social every evening.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous space in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: laurelann
Reviews.Content: Got a great introductory rate to the new Monaco, in a restored historic building near the Inner Harbour. Arrived to find a lovely, spacious room with large windows, super-clean bathroom, and incredibly comfy bed. The staff was first-rate, and the traditional Kimpton wine tasting was held in a very comfortable lounge. It was an easy cab ride from Penn Station, and a short walk to Camden Yards and the Inner Harbour area. The only real drawback - which hopefully will improve since this was a new operation - was the room service food. The panini I ordered was basically an expensive grilled cheese, with no sides at all, not even a potato chip. I'll chalk it up to the newness of it all and hope for better food in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MCA2222
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience. Well worth the money. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I never want to stay anywhere else....”
Reviews.Author: coltranemonet
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to find out about the Monaco on-line through Expedia, but we ended up getting a better price by booking directly through the hotel with a AAA discount. I know these were introductory rates, and unfortunately have heard rates will double or triple as the hotel becomes more well-known. We were so excited to stay in the hotel from the photos of the beautiful historic building and tasteful but interesting decor in the lobby and rooms. We were even more pleased in person! The valet parking attendants and bell staff were friendly and helpful from the moment we drove up. My son loved the warm chocolate chip cookies at the front desk. The room was beautiful and spacious (although an extra chair would have been nice.) The bathroom and shower were gorgeous! Everyone was so friendly, and while the parking was expensive, we never heard a word of complaint as we took our cars in and out multiple times. After only one day, the bellmen recognized us and greeted us warmly as if we were friends. We had a few small glitches (a sliding door that got stuck, the satellite TV lost service) but the front desk was so responsive and each issue was dealt with immediately. The hotel is pet-friendly, and we really wished we had brought our two labradors! I can't wait to stay at the Monaco again, when we visit our daughter at Johns Hopkins! Let's hope the rates don't become too prohibitively high!

Reviews.Title: “Attentive friendly service - wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BlasianGrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful! I booked this property at an introductory rate before the hotel even opened. This is the second Kimpton property I've stayed out and I can now say I've simply fallen in love with Kimpton! The hotel staff were friendly and knowledgable. Whenever I saw an employee always smiled and said hello. The bed was comfy and shower was awesome. The size of my room was MORE than large enough! I would stay at this property again if I ever traveled to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Spitzie
Reviews.Content: Our last minute plans brought us to Baltimore for the holiday weekend. The hotel was a terrific choice and we would definitely return without hesitation. The staff was incredibly helpful and went out of their way to greet you - everyone was upbeat and immediately asked if they could be of assistance. We were upgraded to a suite and it was absolutely wonderful - view perfect and the bathroom was truly unbelievable. The location was perfect - just a few blocks from the convention center, inner harbor and all attractions. The building was like going to one of the city's sites - the history interesting and the renovations were amazing. We have stayed at several Kimpton properties and this was one of the very best.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, poor really poor service”
Reviews.Author: blueBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: As I was traveling to NY with my sister and Kimpton offered me a very good rate for trying their new hotel at Baltimore we decided to give it a chance.We took the Amtrak and stayed thier for only one night. When we arrived we were received by Anisa, she was ok, she never welcomed me as a KiTM (Kimpton in touch memeber), and gave us our room (never gave is our tickets for breakfast) nobody took care of us so we went alone to the room assgined. For our surprised the room wasn´t finished, we have no locker, no safety room and the viw was terrible. I went down and talked to Anisa and she changed us to the room we paid for. The restaurant/bar is very nice, the staff is great and also the food. Obiusly we have problems at breakfast time (because we didnt have our tickets) so I have to go again as asked Anisa our bkf tickets (I went up & down many times for a one night stay!!!). We make our check out and asked and left our bags at the hotel becasue our Amtrak was leaving at 4pm. At 3.40pm we arrive to the hotel for our bags and the closet were they put them was closed and the staff didn´t find who has the key. At that point I was very angry with the staff hotel finally 15 minutes later they found the key and gave us the bags, we didn´t miss the train because the train arrived late from Wash. Baltimore is full of good hotels, with this kind of service I would not recomend this hotel to a friend. Things may have to change.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with class”
Reviews.Author: AllegrosFlight
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in what I think is a Federally Designated Historical Landmark. The architecture is glorious and breath taking. The front end staff, led by Nicole is attentive, courteous and professional. Nicole was just wonderful. She is so well spoken, so attentive and she made my wife and I smile so broadly. The suite that my wife and I occupied was large, tastefully appointed and it had two thermostats...that worked perfectly. The bathroom was a spacious marbled room with the deepest tubs we ever enjoyed. We will re visit this hotel whenever we are in Baltimore....

Reviews.Title: “Still some grand opening glitches”
Reviews.Author: Vicola
Reviews.Content: As with every Kimpton hotel in which I have stayed, this is a very nice hotel. Typical Kimpton. Tastefully furnished room, very comfy bed, decent size bathroom. There were a few problems that needed to be resolved, but nothing of great importance--all service related. I never received my welcome back to Kimpton note card, but heck, as I said it's not important. Breakfast was included in the price of the room, but if I return, I will not use the hotel restaurant. It just wasn't good. Hotel parking is VERY expensive. I really don't care if it is the going rate for the area, it's still expensive. The location is great--very easy walk down to the Inner Harbor. Hopefully next time I will have my dog with me. I love the way Kimpton treats pets, as well as humans.

Reviews.Title: “WOW WOW WOW - Stunning, Friendly, and By Far the #1 Hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: 6zbeast
Reviews.Content: Hands down this is where to stay in Baltimore. In fact, it is a reason to go for a visit in-and-of itself (when you don't want to mingle with the Baltimore riff-raff). I admit it, I'm not the biggest fan of Baltimore, I knew it had its heyday but I had never seen much of the glitz, just more just of Camden Yards and the Inner Harbor. So when my partner and I headed there to celebrate the one year anniversary of our wedding, (which is where we had one of our first dates) I had visions of Hyatt's and Marriotts in my head and their boxy architecture and sufficient service (you know the kind where your stay isn't an experience unless it is a bad one). So I was ready to be really picky. I couldn't help but be impressed, and I'm usually not. So because I write so few good reviews, I wanted to make a list: Location: Literally 4 blocks to anywhere of any interest in Baltimore (down the hill to Inner Harbor, up the hill to Mt. Vernon, over to the Convention Center). Despite my fear of anyone who even looks like they are from Baltimore, we walked everywhere, and only had to take a cab twice (when we went to dinner at Charleston). The building: Wow, looks like the Plaza in NYC, one of the most beauiful buildings in Baltimore or any city. The lobby, is one enormous marble and stained glass antique, so tred lightly. I am a sucker for immaculately preserved buidlings from America's industrial heyday (we just don't build beauty now like we did). Curb Service: I can usually carry my own bags, but they guy with the Humphrey Bogart hat was so friendly, and I'm a sucker for good fashion, so that was that. We were whisked in, which gave us the feeling of being quickly rushed past the coach passengers to first class, so that feeling of superiority immediately put me in a good mood. Lobby: The reception is on the 2nd floor, and rocks it out. You thought the W was posh, this is how you'd decorate if you wanted to show off, but still wanted it to be comfortable enough to let your inner rock star party a bit...Um did I mention lots of free wine. So, we thought about having a glass before we even checked-in... I'm sure that would have been okay, the place just has that vibe. Check-in: To the point, and friendly. They even have a Train with toys for kids (not that I really care for kids, unless they are entirely silent and serve some purpose, but its a nice little idea). The Room: Wow, Wow. I cannot say enough. Flat screen, comfy bed, very quiet, turn-down service, champagne (on-ice) and chocolate covered stawberries, and a 4ft deep two person jacuzzi tub. (one nit: some instructions on how to operate the tub would be great, we figured it out though, and I'm sure we coulda called too and someone would have told us). We could have stayed in the room the whole time. Checkout: It was a bit crowded when we went to check-out on Sunday, but most of that was due to some irresponsible woman with 5 offspring who sounded like 20 (I guess its hard to screen for that without barring children all-together). A bell hop was on it though, and I was actually impressed while he distracted them with the toy train so the front desk could get her checked out. Price: So I love to live it up, but the inner-midwesterner kicks in and I need to get a deal. This hotel was SOOOO worth every penny, and I didn't even realize what a deal we got until we got there. We got upgraded so we definitely got more than we paid for, but even then the price was about the same as Marriott and the Hyatt. I can't think of what else to say. The Hotel Monaco made our experience. So instead of just having somewhere to stay, it was part of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “nice, typical Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danut15
Reviews.Content: It's the typical Kimptom Monaco hotel with a stylish building, nice and artistic interior decorations, free wine reception daily from 5-6pm in the lobby, great spa products in the bathrooms (Occitane). Great location downtown Baltimore with nice views of the other skyline buildings. Valet parking is expensive 36$/day and nearby garages run about 10-15$/day over the weekends. Also, as a negative I should mention the "free breakfast" is a bit of a joke if you got it in the package, since it includes only coffee/tea, pastries and fruits, but if you want eggs, you have to order off the menu. I am not clear why they played this little cheap thing as a welcoming package since it's not really a pleasure to find this out when you go there. A big plus, however, the B&O restaurant in the hotel have amaizing dinners; the chef makes some of the most delicious meals I had; we tried the beef and chicken and can tell you that different flavors just melt in your mouth; a definitely must if you plan to dine in the area....Otherwise, rooms are a bit small and the A/C seems quite noisy when it runs. The staff is incredible and very accomodating, a typical for Kimptom. Definitely a nice place to stay overall.

HotelInfo.Name: Monaco Baltimore, a Kimpton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2 North Charles Street, Baltimore, MD 21201
